loans.use: to purchase calves in order to raise them and breed them

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias is an experienced client who farms. He is 27 years old and married with two children who are 6 and 3 years old.  Both attend school.  

He has high hopes of earning a good income from his business which is located in the Ruhinda, Mitooma district. HIs customers are the Matooke traders. He is a hard working man and works 8 hours a day, 6 days a week.  His business challenge is competition, so he is encouraged to work harder. 

He is determined to continue to farm in order to become financially stable. He hopes to use the loan to buy fertilizer, manure and mulch for his farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Edmundo

texts.es:
Edmundo tiene 43 años de edad, su estado civil es Casado, tiene casa propia, cuenta con servicios públicos(agua y luz); Edmundo vive en el distrito de Buenos Aires a 20 minutos de Morropón, la comunidad es pequeña y los pobladores se dedican a la crianza de ganado, comercio especialmente al comercio de platano; dicha comunidad esta ubicada en la provincia de Morropón, región Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que desarrolla Edmundo es la siembra y comercialización de platano, y él necesita del crédito para abonar su chacra, y de esta manera asegurar una buena cosecha, ya que su producción estará libre de plagas que pudieran dañarla, y al tener una buena cosecha obtendrá un buen producto para venderlo a mejor precio, generando de esta forma mayores ingresos, mejores ganancias y por ende una mejor calidad de vida para él y toda su familia.
texts.en:
Edmundo is 43 years old and is married. He lives in his own house which has basic public services (electricity and water0. He lives in the district of Buenos Aires, 20 minutes from Morropón, which is located in the province of Morropón, Piura region, on the north coast of Peru. His community is small and the inhabitants work in raising cattle, commerce and especially the production of bananas.

Edmundo grows and sells bananas. He needs a loan to fertilize his farm in order to assure a good harvest and that his production is free of insects that can harm it. With a good harvest he would have a good product to sell at a good price. He would generate more income, more profit and in the end improve the quality of living for him and all of his family.

loans.use: to fertilize his farm.

loans.name: Shadreck

texts.en:
Shadreck is a 34 years old chef at a sports center for young Zambians. He is married with 3 children, who all are in school. The youngest is in a school for children with special needs, which is hard on his finances. His wife handles bookings in a hotel. His dream is to become independent and build a business, preferably on his own piece of property in the future. Shadreck is also a gospel musician and performs together with his oldest daughter. 
The loan will help him buy a stock of improved stoves and biomass pellets, which together replace charcoal. He will then sell them and start building towards his dream. He is also motivated to be apart of the fight against deforestation and he loves teaching people about that as well as introducing chefs to a sustainable way of cooking.

loans.use: to buy a stock of improved cookstoves and renewable fuel pellets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cutlery, meat, maize meal, etc.

loans.name: Orfelinda

texts.es:
Orfelinda es separada, vive en casa propia, desde hace más de 20 años, junto a sus hijos, en una comunidad tranquila, donde su población se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería, y al comercio, dicha comunidad está ubicada en el distrito de Lagunas, provincia Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad a la que se dedica Orfelinda es a la crianza y venta de cerdos, desde hace más de 8 años, y adicionalmente también se dedica a la venta de verduras y tubérculos en su domicilio; ella cuenta liente con buenas referencias en la zona donde vive tanto laborales, como personales, tiene ya clientela fija. El destino del crédito serça para la construcción de una pieza de su casa y el restante para la compra de verdura en Chiclayo mercado mayorista para revenderlas en su distrito al por menor, genernadole mayores ingresos, mejores ganancias y por ende una mejor calidad de vida para ella y sus hijos.
texts.en:
Orfelinda is separated.  She has lived in her own house for more than 20 years, together with her children, in a peaceful community whose people make a living in agriculture, livestock and commerce.  This community is located in the district of Lagunas, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region on the north coast of Perú.

The activity in which Orfelinda makes a living is the raising and selling of pigs, which she has done for more than 8 years.  Additionally, she also makes a living selling vegetables and tubers in her home.  She has customers with good references; in the area where she lives there is both work and personnel, and so she has regular customers.  

The purpose of the loan will be for construction on a part of her house and the remainder will be for purchasing vegetables in the Chiclayo wholesale market to resell them in her district at retail price, generating greater income for her, better earnings and therefore a better quality of life for her and her children.

loans.use: with the construction of a part of her house and the remainder will be for purchasing vegetables in Chiclayo.

loans.name: Kihuura B United Group

texts.en:
Expeditor is a 53-year-old, hardworking, married man living in Kagadi, Uganda with his 7 children. 

He has been selling produce since 2001, and farming, in order to generate income to support his family. He hopes to buy some land although he is challenged by price fluctuations.  

Expeditor is asking for a loan to buy maize to sell. He is a member of Kihuura B United Group, where each member guarantees the other to get a loan, since they don’t pledge securities.

The extra people in the photo are children of the group members.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Bashiran

texts.en:
Bashiran is a 51-year-old married woman. 

Twenty years ago, she started a business with a ‘tandoor’ (a clay oven used for cooking in North India and Pakistan). She cooks chapattis and naan for the people of her community, and also takes orders from nearby hotels. In this way she makes enough money to have a decent life. 

Bashiran is the mother of four children and she is motivated to give them a beautiful life with a good education, food and clothing. She has improved her business to be able meet their day-to-day living expenses. 

Now she is in her 7th loan cycle and she has requested a loan of 55,000 PKR to purchase sacks of flour and packs of salt and oil, which will help her to inflate her sales. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan, and she plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of flour and packs of salt and oil.

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida is a 41-year-old married woman and the mother of nine children. 

The income generated by her husband was insufficient to cover all their household expenses, so she started her business seling milk. She has been doing this for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business, and recently she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales, which will ultimately help to generate more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 51-year-old widow who has been running a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. 

To keep her store fully stocked, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR which she will use to buy a stock of rice, sugar, grains and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. 

Parveen wishes to use part of her future revenue to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy a stock of rice, sugar, grains and flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a stove for her kitchen.

loans.name: Shagufta

texts.en:
Shagufta, age 41, is running a food stall in her street with the support of her husband. She makes delicious "gol gappy," a popular street food in Pakistan.  It consists of a round, hollow puri, fried crisp and filled with a mixture of flavored water ("pani"), tamarind chutney, potato, onion and chickpeas. It is generally small enough to fit completely into one's mouth.

Shagufta has worked hard to gain popularity and recognition within her town. Today, she is successful in consistently making sales and earning healthy revenue from the business. In order to increase her sales, she needs to purchase packs of flour, oil, salt and spices. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 60,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She is in her 8th loan cycle with a good repayment history. She wishes to spend part of her revenue on expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase packs of flour, oil, salt and spices.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 34-year-old married woman. She is the mother of six. In order to support her husband financially, she started a small general store in her locality.  Shehnaz is making a great effort to support her family. She is holding herself accountable to provide for their needs. However, she faces a financial problem in the growth of her business. She needs to buy more items to fill her store.

Shehnaz has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy more packs of biscuits, grains, and cleaning products to fulfill high customer demand for these products. She is positive about her future earnings and will spend part of her income on buying more items for her store.

loans.use: to buy more packs of biscuits, grains, and cleaning products.

loans.name: Haleema

texts.en:
Haleema is a 38-year-old vigorous lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She sews for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of available funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation.

Haleema intends to use these funds to buy more spools of threads in different colours as well as packs of laces, zippers and buttons, which will help her increase revenues and generate a healthier source of income. She is in her 6th loan cycle and has shown good repayment performance.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors as well as packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 41-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of cloth selling. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality cloth in her area. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. Recently, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase a bundle of cloth in different colors and designs. This will help her to increase her sales which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase a bundle of cloth in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Humaira

texts.en:
Humaira is a 46-year-old widow. She has four children. Being a single parent, she needs to fulfill her children's demands. Five years ago, she started her own business of cloth sales in her area. After the death of her husband, she didn’t lose hope, and instead contacted Kashf Foundation upon the advice of her neighbor to initiate her own business. 

Humaira buys cloth of different designs from the wholesale market in bulk and then sells them in her community. She counts a good client list; most of her clients are her neighbors. She has gradually improved her business, and now she is requesting a loan of 40,000 PKR. She is going to use this loan to buy an ample variety of cloth in a larger quantity to add to her current supply. She wishes to use the earned profits on her children’s education and well-being.

loans.use: to buy an ample variety of cloth in a larger quantity

loans.name: Naboth

texts.en:
Naboth is a thirty-year-old married man with one six-year-old child. He lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. He owns a retail shop which he started in 2001 with the intention of supporting his family financially and educating his child. His main challenges are price fluctuations and high competition.

He is requesting a loan to buy more stock such as bread, sugar and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy more stock such as bread, sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: Santa Teresita-32 Group

texts.es:
Erika es una mujer de 23 años de edad soltera sin hijos y su negocio es la venta de platos típicos cochabambinos (comida).
Ella es emprendedora, activa, luchadora, fuerte, firme, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su Negocio lo realiza en Cochabamba situado en el centro geográfico del país que colinda con seis de los otros ocho departamentos bolivianos. Fueron los Incas quienes le dieron el nombre que tiene, composición de los vocablos “Qocha” y “Pampa”, que significan laguna y planicie, que aluden a la abundancia de agua y a las suaves colinas aplanadas de clima tibio que caracterizan a la región. Los conquistadores hispanos, para no perder la costumbre de adaptar todos los dialectos al suyo, lo pasaron a pronunciar como Cochabamba.
El sueño de su vida es tener un negocio grande y estable, y para comenzarlo formó una banca de personas con necesidades similares y negocios parecidos para solicitar un préstamo para lograr sus metas. (la primera de la derecha, blusa a rayas color beis)
Ella es de tez morena, cabello largo negro peinado a la moda, estatura mediana, su lengua natal es el quechua (que es el más utilizado en donde vive) y utiliza el español para el comercio. Su negocio es la venta de comida típica de Cochabamba. Ella se encarga de comprar los ingredientes naturales y milenarios de la zona para cocinar platillos como: chicharrón de cerdo, escabeche, sillpancho, etc.
Es por esos motivos que Erika solicita un préstamo para la ampliación de su restaurante y con los beneficios incrementar el crecimiento de su negocio.
texts.en:
Erika is a 23 year-old woman who is single and has no children.  She has a business selling dishes that are traditional to this area (Cochabamba) of Bolivia.  She is enterprising, active, tenacious, strong, firm, responsible, and very hardworking.  She carries out her business in Cochabamba, located in the geographic center of the country that borders six of the other eight Bolivian departments.  The Incas gave it this name, a combination of the words “Qocha” and “Pampa”, which mean lake and plain.  The name alludes to the abundance of water and the soft flattened hills that characterize the region.  The Spanish conquistadores, in order to maintain the custom of adapting all of the dialects, came to pronounce the town as Cochabamba.

Erika's life dream was to have a big and stable business.  To start her business she formed a communal bank with people of similar needs and businesses to request a loan to achieve her goals.  (She is the first from the right, wearing a striped beige shirt).  She has a dark complexion, long dark hair styled fashionably, and a medium stature.  Her native language is Quechua (which is the most common where she lives), and she uses Spanish for business.  She has a business selling traditional Cochabamban dishes.  She is in charge of buying the natural and traditional ingredients from the area to make dishes such as: pork rinds, marinated pork, sillpancho (a dish made with flattened beef), and other dishes.  Erika is requesting a loan to expand her restaurant.  With the profits, she will increase the growth of her business.

loans.use: to expand her restaurant

loans.name: Harbert

texts.en: Harbert is a hardworking man living in Kagadi, Uganda. He gets his income from selling fuel and alcohol. He plans to set up another branch of a filling station despite stiff competition. Harbert is asking for credit to buy petrol and diesel to sell.

loans.use: to buy petrol and diesel to sell

loans.name: María Alicia

texts.es:
María de 44 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, es casada y su esposo trabaja como albañil, tiene dos niños los cuales están estudiando educación básica en la escuela de la comunidad, con ella solo viven sus 2 hijos y su esposo.


María trabaja cuidando pollos, pero también  trabaja en la alcaldía;  el cuido de los pollos lo realiza desde que era más joven, su madre  acostumbraba a tener siempre aves las cuales engordaba y sacaba a la venta en temporadas que estos tienen  más demanda; es decir, en la épocas de fin de año y de trabajar en la alcaldía tiene dos años, desde que entro el gobierno local a gobernar. Antes solo se dedica a los oficios domésticos de su hogar. La alcaldía donde trabaja le queda a unos 3 kilómetros de su casa y se transporta en bus para llegar y trabaja de 8:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m.


El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para cancelar unos muebles que saco en una comercial  y también pagará  parte de un crédito que tiene vigente. El crédito ayudara a que pague sus muebles y que su familia tenga más activos y que tengan una mejor calidad de vida. Porque, siempre como familia quisieron tener estos electrodomésticos.


El sueño de María es mejorar su vivienda o si se le da la oportunidad volverla a construir,  pero de otro material como bloque o ladrillo, y que sus hijos vivan más cómodos y más seguros  porque donde viven ahorita es de bajareque.
texts.en:
Maria, 44 years old, studied until the ninth grade, is married and her husband works as a mason. She has two children who study in public school. She only lives with her husband and children.

Maria works tending chickens and also works at city hall. She has been tending chickens since she was young, whereas she has worked at city hall for two years, when the local government came to power. Her mother used to always keep birds to fatten and sell during the peak season, i.e. at year's end.

Before she used to do only household work. The city hall where she works is located about three kilometers from her home, and she takes the bus to work from 8:00 AM to 4:00 PM. 

The loan she is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to pay off home furnishings and for her family to have spare cash to have a better quality of life. As a family, they always wanted to have these appliances. Maria's dream is to improve her home, and if she has the chance to rebuild it with other building materials like brick or cinder blocks, and for her children to live more comfortably and securely as the home they live in now is built from wood and clay.

loans.use: to pay off some furniture she bought from a store and also pay for part of a debt that is outstanding.

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar lives in Meghri with her family (in the photo): her husband and two children, a five-year-old daugther and a one-year-old son. 

Gohar and her husband run a farm. Specifically, they keep two cows and two calves. They gather milk, which Gohar uses in cheese production. Her husband sells it in local market. 

The requested loan of USD 3,000 is very important for Gohar to expand her farm. She plans to purchase a cow, a calf, renovation of the barn and forage for the livestock. She asks lenders' support for her farm and hopes for their goodwill.

As this is Gohar's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who don’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for a cow, a calf, renovation of the barn and forage for the livestock

loans.name: Abida

texts.en: Abida is a 46-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last five years. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. She earns insufficient income to support her family. Her husband supports her in her business. She is the mother of two children and is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy rice, sugar, oil and flour from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her seventh loan cycle. She has shown good credit behavior. She wishes to utilize part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil and flour.

loans.name: Nayamat

texts.en:
Nayamat is a 53-year-old vigorous lady; she has been providing the service of tailoring for many years and is quite skilled at her job. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. She has three children. 

Nayamat requires financial aid to meet the orders of her customers on time. Therefore, in her sixth loan cycle she has requested 40,000 PKR. With this loan, she intends to purchase a new stitching machine and more stitching material such as needles, spools of thread, etc. She wants to generate more income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine and more stitching material such as needles, spools of thread, etc.

loans.name: María Andrea

texts.es:
María tiene 55 años de edad, se dedica a los oficios domésticos ya que no cuenta con ningún tipo de estudio académico, es madre soltera de dos hijos que viven con ella y el mayor vive en el extranjero y le ayuda económicamente a ella y sus hermanos.

Desde muy pequeña, María ha tenido que trabajar muy duro para ayudar en su familia pues su situación económica no era muy satisfactoria, anteriormente trabajaba para una señora vendiendo comida en el mercado, por lo tanto tenía que levantarse muy temprano a lavar los platos, preparar la comida entre otras cosas, además su esposo que falleció les dejó unos terrenos en los cuales ella cultiva con ayuda de sus hijos.

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar semillas de frijol para sembrar una hectárea, y comprará los insumos para darle mantenimiento al cultivo.


Su sueño es tener una buena cosecha y venderla a buen precio, pagar su deuda y con las ganancias que tenga poder construir una mejor vivienda para estar en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
María is 55 years old, takes care of the household tasks since she didn't have any kind of schooling, and is a single mother of two children who live with her and the older one who lives abroad and helps her and his siblings economically.

Since she was very young, María has had to work very hard to help her family since the family's economic situation wasn't very satisfactory.  Previously, she worked for a woman selling food in the market, for which she had to get up very early to wash the dishes and prepare the food, among other tasks. In addition, her husband who died left them some land which she cultivates with the help of her children. 

She needs the loan to purchase bean seeds to plant a hectare and to purchase the supplies to care for the crop.

Her dream is to have a good harvest and sell it at a good price, pay off her debt, and, with the profits that she will have, be able to build a better house to be in better conditions.

loans.use: to purchase bean seeds to plant a hectare, and to purchase the supplies needed to care for the crop.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem has successfully built her general store business with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. Over time she has attained a good number of customers, and she makes good amount of income to contribute in the family income. 

Previously, with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. Now she is in her fifth loan cycle and has applied a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase stock of rice, biscuits, grains and oil. This will enable her to increase her sales to gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase stock of rice, biscuits, grains and oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Carlos Alfredo

texts.es:
Carlos es un joven de 22 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado ya que no tuvo la oportunidad de seguir, él vive con su madre ya que su padre los abandonó y sus hermanas ya se acompañaron, por lo tanto ahora él es el encargado de responder por su madre.


Desde muy pequeño, Carlos se ha dedicado a la agricultura, actividad que le enseñó su abuelo, hoy en día él cultiva maíz y ajonjolí y así es como obtiene ingresos para cu asa.


Él necesita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes ya que su cultivo necesita  un buen desarrollo.
Carlos planea cultivar más maíz, frijol, sorgo, y ajonjolí, además le gustaría formar su propia familia.
texts.en:
Carlos, 22, studied up to the ninth grade. He did not have the opportunity to continue studying. He lives with his mother, as his father abandoned them. His sisters are already living with their partners, so he is now responsible for taking care of his mother.

From a young age, Carlos has made a living in agriculture. He learned about this activity from his grandfather. Now he grows corn and sesame to earn an income for his household.

He needs this loan to buy fertilizer because his crops need to develop well. Carlos plans to grow more corn, beans, sorghum, and sesame. He would also like to start his own family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer because his crops need to develop well.

loans.name: José Tránsito

texts.es:
José tiene 48 años de edad, vive con su pareja y sus 3 hijos,  no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, pero ha aprendido a leer gracias a unos programas de alfabetización.

José trabaja en al agricultura desde muy temprana edad, y lo aprendió gracias a sus padres.


Él solicita este crédito para comprar fertilizantes ya que necesita darle la nutrición necesaria a su cultivo y poder sacar buena cosecha .
José planea cultivar mas granos básicos como maíz, frijol, ajonjolí y obtener mejores ganancias para ayudar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
José, 48, lives with his partner and three children. He did not have the opportunity to study, but he learned to read thanks to literacy programs. He has worked in agriculture from a young age. He learned about this activity thanks to his parents.

He is applying for this loan to buy fertilizer because he needs to give his crops the necessary nutrition to obtain a good harvest. José plans to grow more basic grains such as corn, beans, and sesame, and to earn a higher income to help his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer because he needs to give his crops the necessary nutrition to obtain a good harvest.

loans.name: Evalyne

texts.en:
Evalyne, 36, is a smallholder farmer in a rural agricultural town called Kericho. The cool weather, expansive tea plantations and rolling hills makes Kericho, arguably, the most beautiful countryside in Kenya. Like most farmers from the region, Evalyne has dairy cattle, poultry and a tea farm. She has depended on mixed farming for three years to provide for her child.

Evalyne is seeking a loan from Kiva through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. The additional cow will produce additional milk for sales, increasing milk volume. Typical grade cows produce 10 to 15 litres of milk on average per day. She stated that what is most enjoyable about farming is that it generates income! Her biggest challenge is a lack of capital. Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Lelian.'

Evalyne was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied, "It focuses on improving the lives of people in rural areas." This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session, to which she replied, "It is flexible and accessible."

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked how this loan would benefit her family, Evalyne replied, "It will expand our business."

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge Luis tiene 27 años de edad, es conviviente, con dos hijos a su cargo, vive en casa propia, en una zona rural del poblado de Nueva Arica, distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Jorge Luis se dedica a brindar servicio de jornalería, hace 10 años; él solicita préstamo para invertir en activo fijo; compra dos toros, qu le ayudarán a arar las tierras que trabaja por temporadas en cultivos cercanos de vecinos que lo contratan. Lo que le permitirá hacer un mejor trabajo, y por ende se hará más conocido por el valor agregado que le esta dando a su servicio y esto por consecuente le permitirá captar a más personas que quieran trabjar con él.
texts.en:
Jorge Luis is 27 years old, partnered, with two children in his care.  He lives in his own house in a rural area of the village of Nueva Arica, Cayaltí district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Perú. 

Jorge Luis has worked as a day laborer for 10 years. He asks for this loan to invest in fixed assets.  He will purchase two bulls which will help him to plow the fields where he works seasonally with the crops of neighbors who hire him, which will allow him to do a better job, with the goal of becoming more known for the additional value that he is giving with his service and, in turn, it will allow him to attract more people who want to work with him.

loans.use: to invest in fixed assets, he will purchase two bulls, which will help him to plow the fields where he works seasonally with the crops of neighbors who hire him.

loans.name: Martha Lidia

texts.es:
Martha tiene 57 años de edad, estudió hasta primer grado, actualmente está acompañada y tiene 2 hijos que no viven junto a ella, su pareja se dedica a la agricultura y se apoyan mutuamente.

Martha ha sido trabajadora desde muy joven, le ayudaba a su madre a lavar ropa ajena, actualmente tiene un negocio en su casa el cual es un molino maíz, el negocio lo tiene desde hace 5 años y decidió iniciarlo junto a su pareja con ahorros de ambos.

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar materiales de construcción y lámina ya que quiere mejorar su vivienda porque es época de lluvia y el agua ingresa a la casa ya que la lámina está picada.

Ella espera mejorar su casa poco a poco para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Martha is 57 years old, went to school up to the first grade, and currently is partnered and has two children who don't live with her.  Her partner works in agriculture and they support each other. 

Martha has been a worker since she was very young; she helped her mother to wash clothes they took in, currently she has a business in her house which is a corn mill. She has had this business for the past 5 years and decided to start it with her partner with their savings.

She needs the loan to purchase construction materials and metal sheeting since she wants to improve her house, because it is the rainy season and water comes into the house since the metal sheeting is full of holes.

She hopes to improve her house little by little for the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to purchase construction material and metal sheeting since she wants to improve her house.

loans.name: Cesar Helmer

texts.es:
Cesar Helmer tiene 52 años de edad, es casado, sin hijos, vive con su familia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Cesar Helmer se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, con más de 8 años de experiencia en el negocio, el mismo que está ubicado en la parte posterior de su mismo domicilio, él solicita préstamo para compra de más animales, dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor variedad y productividad en animales, con gran influencia en el negocio; Cesar Helmer piensa incrementar su stock de animales para poder atender las diversas gustos y necesidades de los clientes de la zona, y asi poder aumentar sus ingresos, mejorar sus ganancias y por ende su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Cesar Helmer is 52 years old, married, with no children, and lives with his family in a rural zone in Oyotún district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Perú.

Cesar Helmer works raising and selling animals, with more than 8 years of experience in the business, which is located in the area behind his house. He asks for the loan to purchase more animals. This investment will allow him to have more variety and animal productivity, with a big impact on the business. Cesar Helmer plans to increase his animal stock to be able to meet the various tastes and needs of his customers in the area and, in turn, be able to increase his income and improve his profits and, in the end, his quality of life.

loans.use: to increase and diversify his animal stock to offer to his customers.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Philip a dedicated and ambitious farmer who is based in Kapkelel, a remote village in Kericho, Kenya. He is happily married and blessed with 5 children who depend on him for their basic needs. For 5 years he has been practising mixed farming, and his primary sources of income have been milk, eggs and crops.

Although he has been able to bring up his family with income from selling a variety of food crops, he wants to diversify further and expand his tomato farming. Tomatoes are among the most highly consumed vegetables in Kenya. They are grown for fresh market, processing and the export market.

Philip is therefore seeking a loan to expand his tomato farming. Through the loan he will be able to comfortably take care of his family's escalating costs of living. Demand for tomatoes in Kericho is overwhelming, and with Philip's entrepreneurial skills, he is well placed to take advantage of the available market and make a healthy profit. Increasing his income will allow Philip to improve his living conditions and provide nothing but the best for his family.

loans.use: to expand his tomato farming

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Reinaldo

texts.es:
Reinaldo tiene 35 años de edad, estudió hasta 8º grado de educación básica, actualmente está soltero pero tiene un hijo el cual vive junto a él y estudia en la escuela.

Él es agricultor y desde que tenía 18 años se ha dedicado a dicha actividad, además tiene otra fuente de ingresos la cual depende de un molino de maíz que tiene en su casa, pensó poner este negocio cuando observó que todas las personas de la comunidad tenían que viajar muy lejos para moler el maíz.

Él necesita el crédito para comprar algunas piezas que el molino tiene dañadas, de lo contrario no funcionaran adecuadamente y no podrá seguir trabajando con el molino.

Su sueño es que su negocio mejores y cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hijo.
texts.en:
Reinaldo is 35 years old, went to school up to the 8th grade, and currently is single but has a son who lives with him and goes to school. 

He is a farmer and since he was 18 years old, he has worked in agriculture. In addition he has another source of income which depends on the corn mill that he has in his house. He thought of starting this business when he noticed that all the people in the community had to travel very far to grind the corn. 

He needs the loan to purchase some parts for the mill that are damaged, that don't function correctly and so he can't continue working with the mill. 

His dream is that his business improves and covers his son's basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase some parts for the mill that are damaged, that don't function correctly and so he can't continue working with the mill.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson is an old client of UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd. (MDI) through its Ishaka Branch. He is married with eight children and five attend school. He has applied for a loan of UGX 5,000,000 (five million shillings only) to buy goats and trees for business. His major source of income is farming, to which he has given his best to be able to get income to sustain his family. He gives the business eight hours per day six days a week.  In addition to this business, he also deals in timber as a way of supplementing his income. He started farming in 2006 in Kyagyenyi, Sheema District. His main objective of starting the business was to earn income. His clients are all categories of people. Wilson hopes to use the money to buy goats and trees for his businesses. His biggest challenge is competition from other farmers. He hopes to educate all his children in the future. He is a hardworking man and this has helped him a lot in conducting his businesses. He has high hopes that his businesses will do better with the loan.

loans.use: to buy goats and trees.

loans.name: Catalina Orbelina

texts.es:
La  joven Catalina  es una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive  con su  hijo y sus  esposo  en el  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es  la  pulpería desde hace más de 8  años.
Catalina el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de manteca, arroz, frijoles, carnes, azur, café, pan, harina, etc.  Con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más producto que ofrecer y poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mejor atención.
La  joven  Catalina espera cubrir las necesidades  que tiene y mejorar un poco su calidad  de vida y la de su familia. En unos años sueña que su negocio siga  creciendo  y se convierta en uno  de  los más grande y reconocido de la zona y que sus hijos  se conviertan en personas de bien y con mejores oportunidades en la  sociedad. 	



Choluteca, Honduras  – Agosto del 2014
texts.en:
Catalina is a responsible, hardworking, honest young woman. She lives with her son and her husband in the south of Honduras. Her business is a small grocery store, which she has had for more than eight years.

Catalina needs this loan to buy butter, rice, beans, meat, sugar, coffee, bread, flour, etc. With this loan, she hopes to increase her sales by having more products on offer and being able to offer her clients a better service.

Catalina hopes to cover her needs and to improve her quality of life and that of her family a little bit. In a few years, her dream is that her business will continue growing and become one of the biggest and most well-known in the area. She also hopes that her children will become good people with greater opportunities in society.

Choluteca, Honduras  – August 2014

loans.use: to buy butter, rice, beans, meat, sugar, coffee, bread, flour, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La señora. Victoria es una persona emprendedora, honesta y seria,   vive  con su esposo  y sus  3  hijos en el sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la compra y venta de cerdos y gallinas. 
Doña Victoria el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de gallinas  y  unos cerditos y así tener producto para la venta y atender mejor a sus clientes, también espera que los ingresos aumenten y poder seguir apoyando a su familia en el hogar.
Doña Victoria uno de sus sueños es que su negocio siga creciendo y consolidándose para que se convierta en el más grande y reconocido de la zona y poder seguir apoyando a sus hijos con sus educación. 


Choluteca, Honduras  – Agosto  del 2014
texts.en:
Victoria is an enterprising, honest and serious woman. She lives with her husband and three children in the south of Honduras. Victoria has a business buying and selling pigs and hens. 

Victoria needs this loan in order to buy hens and piglets in order to have products to sell and better serve her customers. She also hopes that her income will increase and that she will be able to continue support her family at home.

One of Victoria's dreams is for her business to continue growing and to consolidate it so that it may become one of the largest and best well-known businesses in the area. Victoria also wants to continue support her children with their education.

Choluteca, Honduras  – August 2014

loans.use: to buy chickens and piglets for her business.

loans.name: Maria Georgina

texts.es:
María es una muy ingeniosa mujer de 46 años de edad que desde joven siempre tuvo grandes aspiraciones y ganas de estudiar para salir adelante.
A temprana edad quedo en embarazo de su primer hijo y su esposo le dijo que se quedara en casa cuidando de ellos y para ella entrenarse le regalo una máquina de confección que aún conserva y con la que labora. 

 Se dedicó a la confección directa realizando prendas en espacios libres y vendiéndolas a familiares y amigos pues su deseo era de generar sus propios recursos. 

Su sueño es tener una fábrica grande, expandir su negocio y poder vender sus prendas en almacenes y centros comerciales y por este deseo trabaja diariamente entre 8 y 10 horas.

Solicita un crédito para la compra de telas, remaches, botones, hilos, y artículos para decorar sus prendas. 

El beneficio que le traerá es que podrá fabricar mejores prendas, con más detalles y llamativas para abarcar un mejor nicho de mercado.
texts.en:
María is a very clever 46-year-old woman. Since she was young she has always aspired to great things and has wanted to study in order to get ahead in life.

María fell pregnant with her first child at a young age and her husband told her to stay at home to look after him and the child. He also gifted her a sewing machine to learn to use. She still has this machine and uses it for her work.

María started working to make clothing items and then sell them to friends and relatives. María wanted to earn her own income through this work.

María's dream is to have a large factory, expand her business and be able to sell her clothes in wholesale units and shopping centres. She works between eight and ten hours per day in order to fulfil this wish.

María is applying for a loan in order to buy material, headpins, buttons, threads and items for decorating clothing items.

This loan will allow María to produce better and more exciting items of clothing. With this items, María will be to penetrate a niche market.

loans.use: to buy material, headpins, buttons, threads and items for decorating clothing items; María is looking to fulfil her dream of selling her clothes in shopping centres.

loans.name: Jainer

texts.es:
El  señor  Jainer  una persona emprendedora,  honesto  y seria, vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos  en el  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la  compra y venta  de  cerdos. 
Don Jainer el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de cerdos y así tener más productos para ofrecerle a sus clientes,  con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten y cubrir sus necesidades del hogar al mismo tiempo mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
Don Jainer uno de sus sueños es que su negocio siga creciendo y   para que se convierta en la más grande y  reconocido de la zona y seguir  apoyando a su familia y que sus hijos terminen sus estudios.


Choluteca, Honduras –  Agosto   del   2014
texts.en:
Mr. Jainer is an enterprising, honest, and serious person. He lives with his wife and their 4 children in the south of Honduras. His business is buying and selling pigs. 

Jainer needs the loan to buy pigs and, thus, have more products to offer to his clients. With the loan, he hopes that his sales will increase, and he hopes to cover his household necessities and at the same time to improve the quality of his and his family’s lives a little.

One of his dreams is that his business continues growing so that it can become bigger and well-known in the area. He also dreams of continuing to support his family and that his children finish their education.

Choluteca, Honduras – August 2014

loans.use: to buy pigs for his business.

loans.name: Bersio Alberto

texts.es:
Bersio tiene 45 años de edad, estudió Bachillerato, está casado y su esposa se dedica a cuidar niños, tiene dos hijos pero solo uno asiste a la escuela.

Bersio es albañil, actividad que aprendió por un tío que se dedicaba a lo mismo, su trabajo lo hace en el mismo municipio donde reside, en ocasiones se va a pie y a veces en bicicleta, el horario de trabajo es de ocho horas diarias .


Él necesita el crédito para comprar materiales y mejorar su casa, comprará ladrillo y cemento, de esta forma estará dando más seguridad a su familia.
  
Su sueño es seguir mejorando su casa, preparar a sus hijos en la escuela para que después saquen una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Bersio is 45 years old, finished secondary school, is married, and his wife works taking care of children.  He has two children, but only one goes to school.

Bersio is a bricklayer, a line of work he learned from an uncle who does the same. He does his work in the same municipality where he lives, and sometimes he goes on foot and sometimes by bicycle. His work schedule is eight hours each day. 

He needs the loan to purchase materials and improve his house. He will buy bricks and cement, in this way giving his family more security.

His dream is to continue improving his house and give his children an education so that they can later get a university degree.

loans.use: to purchase materials and improve his house; he will purchase bricks and cement.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Leah. She lives in the Kericho area of Kenya, renowned for its rolling hills carpeted in manicured tea plantations. 

Leah is a mother of 2 boys and she has been in the agriculture business for 10 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and tea. 

Leah has been relying on agriculture to make all her income. However, rising costs of farming inputs, such as for fertilizers, and fluctuations in market prices are some of the serious challenges that are cutting farmers profits significantly. Despite these tough conditions, Leah remains positive and passionate about her economic activity. 

Leah is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. This will enable her to expand the section of business least affected by harsh external conditions. Poultry farming is cheaper to run and the demand for chicken products is always high. 

With this loan, Leah will be able to increase the sales from her poultry business and make more profits. An increase in income for her is timely since it will enable her to tackle high farm-related costs next season. This will greatly improve the quality of work since the cost of every input will be adequately met. As a result, she will realize better quality produce and more yields. 

This loan will support Leah’s economic activity, and will change her family’s living standards indirectly.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.es:
Virgilio de 46 años de edad, estudió hasta 4° grado en la escuela de su cantón, no pudo continuar ya que su padre falleció y tuvo que dedicarse a trabajar para llevar el sustento a su familia,  actualmente está acompañado y tiene dos hijos, uno estudia bachillerato y el otro en la escuela.


Virgilio se ha dedicado a la agricultura desde que estaba muy joven,  ya que trabajaba en una hacienda como jornalero, y ahora siembra sus propios cultivos.

Él necesita el crédito para pagar el alquiler de del terreno donde siembra, y otra parte  para comprar insumos para darle mantenimiento a la cosecha.

Él sueña con seguir cultivando ya que de ello depende el sustento de su familia y con lo cual espera darles el estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Virgilio, 46 years old, went to school up to the 4th grade in a school in his canton. He couldn't continue since his father died and he had to work to support his family. He currently is partnered and has two children, one is in secondary school and the other is in primary.

Virgilio has worked in agriculture since he was very young, working on a large farm as a day laborer, and now he plants his own crops.

He needs the loan to pay the rent for the land which he cultivates, and another part to purchase supplies to care for the crops.   

He dreams of continuing growing crops since he supports his family from that and with that he hopes to provide an education for his children.

loans.use: to pay the rent for the land which he cultivates, and another part to purchase supplies to care for the crops.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is a businessman with a bar and accommodations. He is a new client aged 38 years and has applied for a loan of 5,000,000 UGX (five million shillings only) to be able to buy more stock of daily household use items like sugar, bread, cooking oil, rice and flour among others for his businesses. He is also a civil servant earning a salary to complement his monthly income. He started business in the year 2004 in a rural setting but has seen it grow from one level to another through his hard work. His business is located in Rwenkureijo, Bugongi- Sheema District. His customers are traders and their continued support and his tireless efforts have helped his business to grow. He started this very business to be able to have a source of income and in the long run to able to look after his two children aged six and three years old, who are both attending school at the moment. His major challenge is competition from other business people of the same category. However, competition has encouraged him to work hard by boosting his businesses and providing quality services to his clients. He hopes to have this challenge solved if given the loan money and he provides the best services.

loans.use: to buy retail stock of daily household use items.

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en:
Mabel would love to be a nurse. She is thus pursuing a two-year program at a private nursing institute in Accra. Her dream has been to become a Registered Nursing Officer in charge of a private clinic in the next five to ten years. Her guardian is responsible for her fees but her guardian has retired from active work and so this education loan will help Mabel achieve her dream career.

She feels sad whenever she sees the sick go through pain and for this reason wants to help the sick to relieve them of their pain and agony. Had it not been for the intervention of this loan, she would have had to pay her fees in small amounts, that is, as and when her guardian could afford to pay them. This, according to her, disrupts her studies, because the school authorities send her out of class sometimes when lectures are going on.

Her inspiration is from a Principal Nursing Officer in one of the public hospitals she visited. 

Ghana is rich in natural resources and also the people are hospitable.

loans.use: to pay tuition hostel fees.

loans.name: Tania Soledad

texts.es: Tania Soledad, mayor de edad madre soltera de tres hijos menores de edad y aun bajo su responsabilidad de origen Chinandegana ubicada en el occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser una mujer muy trabajadora, responsable, y con muchos deseos de superación personal, por falta de recursos económicos no pudo terminar sus estudios debido a que salio embarazada y se vio obligada a trabajar para salir adelante, hoy en día lucha día a día para brindarle un futuro mejor a sus hijos, es una microempresaria y administradora de sus propios negocios los cuales consisten en un taller de costura donde confecciona variedad de estilos de ropa, trajes de niños, chort, faldas, vestidos,al igual que realiza reparaciones de costura, tambien tiene una pequeña librería donde ofrece productos escolares como: cuadernos, lapices, borradores, cartulinas, crayones, marcadores, folderes, papel lografo, tambien tiene el servicio de fotocopiadora, al igual que ofrece venta de refrescos natural, jugos, gaseosas, golosinas, entre otros mas, sus compras las cuales realiza en mercados y distribuidoras de esta localidad y sus ventas son todas al contado tiene clientes fijos y eventuales, uno de sus sueños es poder ver convertidos a sus hijos en todos unos profesionales, mejorar su casa de habitación para agrandar mas su negocio, Tania esta solicitando un nuevo financiamiento para invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de productos de materia prima como: hilos, agujas, encanjes, botones, siperes, y útiles escolares entre otros y de esa forma cubrir con varios encargos que tiene. Tania agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: Tania Soledad, an adult single mother with three minor children still in her responsibility, is from Chinandegana which is located in the west of the country. She is characterized as a very hard-working, responsible woman with a lot of desire to improve herself.  For lack of economic resources she couldn't finish her schooling since she got pregnant and had to work to get ahead. These days she fights day by day to offer a better future to her children. She is a small businesswoman and runs her own businesses which are a tailoring shop where she makes a variety of clothing, children's outfits, shorts, skirts, and dresses, and she also does repairs.  She also has a small bookshop where she offers school supplies such as notebooks, pencils, erasers, poster board, crayons, markers, folders, chart paper, and also she has a copying service, and in addition she sells natural drinks, juices, soft drinks, candies, among other things. She makes her purchases in markets and wholesalers in the area and her sales are all in cash. She has regular customers and occasional customers. One of her dreams is to be able to see her children all become professionals, and improve her house to expand her business. Tania is asking for another loan to invest in working capital and in the purchase of raw materials such as thread, needles, lace, buttons, zippers, and school supplies among other things and, in this way, fill the various orders she has.  Tania is grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders offer people of limited resources and in poor countries like Nicaragua to have a dignified means of work.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make outfits and repair clothing, and school supplies among other things.

loans.name: Mahfoud

texts.en:
Mahfoud, a 26-year-old single man living with his family in the city of Haja, Yemen, is a very active and responsible young man. He has a Diploma in Computer Sciences. Due to high rates of the unemployment in the country, however, Mahfoud couldn't find a job to look after his family. 

In 2005, Mahfoud started his business as a tailor with financial support from his father. In the morning, he studied at the institute of computer sciences and in the afternoon and evening, he worked in his sewing store. He is a very hardworking young man whose neighbors describe him as honest and dynamic. 

In his store, Mahfoud sews all kinds of  men's clothes. He earns good profits, and to help in the expansion of his business, he has applied for a youth loan of 350,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a large amount of fabrics and sewing materials such as buttons, zippers, threads, etc. to meet all the demands of his customers. 

Mahfoud looks forward to expanding his business even more by opening other branches in the city of Haja.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of fabrics and sewing materials such as buttons, zippers, threads, etc. to meet all the demands of his customers.

loans.name: Ma'sum

texts.en:
Meet Ma’sum. Ma’sum is single and he lives with five of his family members in Cianjur, a small city located at the foot of Mount Gede Pangrango. 

He runs a small shop that sells snacks, drinks, mobile phone airtime credits, and utility bill payment services for his customers. He began working with Ruma two months ago because he wanted to increase his income. 

He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits. Nowadays, he can process up to 75-150 transactions per day. As the business continues, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as a working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone airtime credit transactions on weekends.

loans.name: Lizanias

texts.es: Lizanías,  tiene la edad de 70 años, está casada, vive solo. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de  una vaca para la producción de leche y que pueda tener una buena cría para el desarrollo y así tener un mejor ingreso en la producción de leche y la venta de terneros  para engordar, con este ingresos económicos  es para seguir invirtiendo en la compra de materiales para hacer mejoras en la propiedad, además d aumentar la cantidad y calidad de las vacas. Con esta compra pretende hacer más. Es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos Estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores y la tasa de interés mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Lizanías, 70, is married and lives alone. With this loan, he plans to buy a cow to produce milk and which he can breed for development. He will therefore have better earnings from milk production and the sale of fattening calves. With this financial income, he will continue investing in the purchase of materials to improve his property, as well as to increase the quantity and quality of his cows. With this purchase, he hopes to do more.

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He had not had any other loans from state banks before, but FUDECOSUR offered him a loan with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy two sewing machines and expand her production

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad lives with his wife in Bogor, a city located at the south of Jakarta. Ahmad runs a small car repair shop and mobile phone airtime credits and utility bill payment service. He joined Ruma because he wanted to increase his income by selling mobile airtime and processing bill payments. Nowadays, he can process up to 40 transactions per day. As the business continues to grow, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to enable him to process more airtime sales on the weekends. This loan would help him in running the mobile airtime business and consequently supporting his plan to seek more business opportunities in the future. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone airtime credit transactions on weekends.

loans.name: Marie

texts.es:
Marie tiene 43 años de edad, realizó sus estudios hasta 9° grado, está casada y su esposo es obrero, tiene un hijo de 16 años que está estudiando noveno grado, de ella solamente depende el hijo pues el esposo ayuda en los gastos del hogar.

Marie no tiene ningún tipo de negocio, solo se dedica a los oficios domésticos, pero sabiendo que necesita incrementar un poco los ingresos en su hogar buscó una oportunidad de trabajo en una compañía de celulares, ella distribuye los recibos de cobro pero solamente dos semanas por mes.


El crédito lo necesita para mejorar la vivienda, comprará materiales como arena, hierro, maya, entre otras cosas. Con  esto podrá brindar mejor seguridad a su familia.


Su sueño es tener mejor calidad de vida junto a su familia, y darle la educación a su hijo y tener salud para seguir adelante con sus metas.
texts.en:
Marie is 43 years old. She went to school up to the 9th grade, is married and her husband is a laborer.  She has a 16-year-old son who is in the ninth grade. The only person who depends on her is her son, since her husband helps with the household expenses. 

Marie doesn't have any kind of business. She only takes care of the household tasks, but knowing that she needs to increase the household income a bit, she looked for an opportunity to work for a cell phone company, she distributes the bill statements but only for two weeks out of each month.

The loan is needed to improve the house. She will purchase materials such as sand, iron, and wire mesh, among other things. With this she will be able to offer more security for her family.

Her dream is to have a better quality of life with her family and provide an education for her son and have the health to continue forward with her goals.

loans.use: to improve her house, she will purchase materials such as sand, iron, and wire mesh, among other things.

loans.name: María Esperanza

texts.es:
María tiene 58 años de edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos pero ya formaron sus propios hogares, solo vive con su esposo, ella no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar pero aprendió a leer y a firmar en los programas de alfabetización.

María se dedica  a la venta de lácteos lo cual le sirve para obtener ingresos y comprar lo básico para el hogar, ella tiene mucha experiencia en esta actividad ya que toda su vida se ha dedicado a esto, ella compra los lácteos y luego los revende..


este crédito lo necesita para comprar productos lácteos  y salir a vender a los habitantes de su comunidad y de esta forma obtener ganancias para sus gastos y cubrir cuentas pendientes.

Ella sueña con que todo le salga bien para seguir trabajando con los créditos.
texts.en:
María, age 58, is married and has three children, all grown and with their own homes. She lives with her husband. She never had the chance to go to school, but she learned to read and sign her name from literacy programs.

María is in the business of selling dairy products, which earns her money to buy the basic necessities for her home. She has a lot of experience in this line of work. She's spent her entire life first buying dairy products and then reselling them.

This loan will be used to buy dairy products, which she will then go out to sell among the residents of her community, earning money to cover her expenses and some outstanding bills.  She hopes that everything will go well and that these loans will let her keep working.

loans.use: purchase dairy products for sale

loans.name: Firman

texts.en:
Firman live with his wife and his only child in Tangerang, a city located to the west of Jakarta. 

Firman runs a small shop that sells stationery, home appliances, mobile phone airtime credits, and utility bill payment services. He joined Ruma because he wanted to increase his income by selling mobile airtime and processing bill payments. Nowadays, he can process up to 75-150 transactions per day. 

As the business continues to grow, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to enable him to process more airtime sales on the weekends. This loan would help him running his mobile airtime business. It would consequently support his plan to seek more business opportunities in the future. 

He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone airtime credit transactions on weekends.

loans.name: Karen Yesenia

texts.es:
Karen de 29 años de edad, estudió técnico en computación, está acompañada y su pareja es motorista de un microbús que como familia tienen para hacer viajes al aeropuerto, tiene una hija de 3 años de edad que por el momento no está yendo a la escuela.

Karen trabaja como promotora de alfabetización en un municipio, ya tiene tres años de dedicarse a este oficio, ella trabaja con estudiantes de los centros educativos para que esos jóvenes les den clases a las personas adultas que en su tiempo no tuvieron la oportunidad de estudiar, el lugar donde trabaja está a una distancia de 20 minutos y viaja a pie a visitar los círculos de alfabetización, esto lo hace de lunes a viernes de 8:00 am a 4:00 pm.


Ella necesita el crédito para comprar 25 metros de cielo falso con el respectivo aluminio para su vivienda y pagara a la persona que le haga el trabajo.

Sus sueños son tener siempre el trabajo, que su familia esté bien y que a su hija no le falte nada.
texts.en:
Karen, 29, studied to be a computer technician. She lives with her partner, who is a driver of a minibus which they own as a family to drive to the airport. She has a three-year-old daughter, who is not in school at this time.

Karen works as a literacy promoter in a municipality. She has had this job for three years. She works with students at educational centers so that those young people can give classes to adults who did not have the opportunity to study during their youth. Her workplace is 20 minutes away from her house. She travels on foot to visit literacy circles. She works from Monday to Friday from 8:00am to 4:00pm.

She needs this loan to buy 25 meters of dropped ceiling panels with the respective aluminum for her home, as well as to pay workers for this job.
 
Her dreams are to always have work, for her family to do well, and for her daughter never to lack anything.

loans.use: to buy 25 meters of dropped ceiling panels with the respective aluminum for her home, as well as to pay workers.

loans.name: Taufik

texts.en:
Taufik lives with his wife and his only child in Ciamis, a city located about 3 hours from Jakarta. 

Taufik runs a small stall that sells snacks, drinks, mobile phone airtime credits, and utility bill payment services. He joined Ruma because he wanted to increase his income by selling mobile airtime and processing bill payments. Nowadays, he can process up to 75-150 transactions per day. 

As the business continues to grow, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to enable him to process more airtime sales on the weekends. This loan would help him run his mobile airtime business and consequently support his plan to seek more business opportunities in the future. 

He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone airtime credit transactions on weekends.

loans.name: Boanerges

texts.es:
Boanerges tiene 46 años de edad, está casado y tiene tres hijos, él se dedica a la ganadería, compra el ganado y lo revende, desde muy pequeño aprendió este oficio pues su padre se lo enseñó.


Él necesita este crédito para comprar ganado y revender ya que de esa manera puede obtener ingresos para  mantener a su familia y comprar lo necesario del hogar.

Sus planes son tener su propio establo y ayudar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Boanerges is 46 years old, married, and has three children. He works in animal husbandry; he purchases cattle and resells it. He learned this work when he was very young since his father taught it to him.

He needs this loan to purchase cattle and resell it since in this way he can get income to support his family and buy household necessities. 

His plans are to have his own barn and help his children so that they can become professionals.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and resell it since in this way he can get income to support his family and buy household necessities.

loans.name: Idalia Lizceth

texts.es:
La  señora Idalia es una persona muy emprendedora, responsable y trabajadora que  vive con su esposo y sus hijos en una comunidad al sur  de  Honduras. Su negocio es la compra  y  venta de  cerdos el  cual  le brinda la mayor parte de sus ingresos.
Doña Idalia el préstamo lo necesita para comprar  más cerdos,  debido a que tienen bastante demanda por sus clientes y para poder cumplir con todos sus pedidos necesita el préstamo, porque no cuenta con el  capital necesario.
Doña Idalia el  ganado  lo  vende en los alrededores de su comunidad y sectores aledaños a esta entre otros lugares cercanos.  En unos años  sueña con que su negocio siga creciendo y le brinde los ingresos necesarios para tener un estilo de  vida mejor y  poder  seguir apoyando  a sus hijos.



Choluteca, Honduras –  Agosto  del 2014
texts.en:
Idalia is an enterprising, responsible, and hard-working person. She lives with her children and her husband in the south of Honduras. Her business is buying and selling pigs, which provides most of her income.  Idalia needs this loan to buy more pigs. She has plenty of demand from her customers, and to meet all her orders, she needs this loan as she does not have enough capital on hand.

Idalia sells her livestock around her community and in other neighboring areas, some nearby and some more distant. In a few years, she hopes to grow her business and she hopes it will provide enough income for her to improve her life and continue supporting her children.

loans.use: buy pigs for her business

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Meet Stephen. He is 22 years old. He comes from Thika, which is a town based Central Kenya. Stephen is a smallholder farmer who keeps dairy cattle and poultry. He is also an entrepreneur engaged in other small personal businesses. 

For the two years that Stephen has been doing farming, he finds milking to be the most enjoyable activity. However, he doesn't enjoy cleaning the dairy unit as much. There is no doubting his deep connection to farm animals though as he names and occasionally talks to his animals. 

Stephen is seeking a loan to purchase farm implements. Farming tools are very crucial to all farmers regardless of the nature of the agribusiness they are involved in. With your loan, Stephen will acquire farm implements that will make his work in the field much easier and efficient. These benefits will translate to efficiency, improved quality and profits.

Additional income as a result will help Stephen to foot the high farming costs that keep rising by the day. When asked, "How will this loan benefit your family?", Stephen replied "More income will help me buy more assets since I don't have a family."

loans.use: to purchase farm implements.

loans.name: Luz Elena

texts.es:
Luz Helena cansada de trabajar para otras personas aseando edificios y casa de familia decidió juntar un capital para comenzar con la venta de helados y apoyada con su hija quien le regalo una vitrina vende miscelánea como las que podemos observar en la foto. 

Ver vender a la señora Luz helena es una dicha tan servicial, tan cogedora que ella por si sola logra fidelizar a los clientes regalándoles una sonrisa y un amor que toca su ser e inconscientemente los incita a volver.

Buscando expandir su mercado y vender nuevos productos la señora Luz quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de productos de aseo personal como lo es desodorante, toallas femeninas, perfumes, cremas de mano, productos capilares etc. 

Con el crédito podrá seguir favoreciendo y expandiendo su mercado hacia su nicho principal las mujeres con las que ha logrado una buena conexión y la han apoyado en años difíciles cuando se separó de su marido y quedo con tres hijas a su cuidado.
texts.en:
Luz Helena—tired of working for others cleanings buildings and family homes—decided to collect money to begin selling ice cream, supported by her daughter, who granted her a shop window where she sells miscellaneous items like those shown in the photo.

When she sells, Luz Helena looks happy, very helpful, and very receptive.  She succeeds in building customer loyalty by giving her clients a smile and love, so that unconsciously, she encourages them to return.

She is looking to expand her store and sell new products. Luz Helena wants to request a loan to buy personal care products, such as deodorant, sanitary pads, perfumes, hand lotions, hair products, etc.

With the loan, she will be able to continue investing in and expanding her store around her main niche—women, with whom she has succeeded in developing a good relationship. They have also supported her in difficult years when she had separated from her husband and had three children in her care.

loans.use: to buy personal care products, focusing in particular on women, who are her niche.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 43 years old and is a hard working man. He lives in Kagadi, Uganda with 8 children. 

He has operated a boutique selling shoes and clothes since 1994 to generate funds to satisfy his family's needs. He hopes to buy a vehicle for personal use since there is a problem of poor roads and high transport costs making transport difficult. 

Patrick is requesting a loan to buy shoes, trousers, shirts and skirts for sale.

loans.use: to buy shoes, trousers, shirts and skirts for sale.

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Tom a young farmer from Kericho County in Kenya who has defied the common thinking of most Kenyans about agriculture. Tom is a proud owner of a small parcel of land on which he has been practicing mixed farming for the past 5 years. His primary sources of income have been milk, eggs and some variety of crops he plants. He also engages in some personal business to make ends meet.

Tom passionately loves farming and he says that he got interested in farming out of a desire to be a solution to food security that remains a thorn in the flesh for all the farmers in Kericho and Africa as a whole. From farming, he has been able to earn a decent income and he attributes all this success to hardwork and determination. Although he makes profits, he has always wanted to increase his farming and start a cereal-selling business. The main challenge he has been facing is lack of funds. He is seeking a loan to buy cereals.

Demand for cereals is overwhelming in Kericho and through your loan, he intends to buy different varieties of cereals and be able to satisfy the demand in his village and local market. With your loan, Tom will improve his living conditions through increased profits from selling cereals.

Tom has been practicing agriculture with a difference employing youthful energy, enthusiasm and knowledge attained through training from Juhudi Kilimo and he believes that his cereal-selling business will increase in leaps and bounds. There is no doubt that through your loan Tom's life is permanently going to change and he will assure his school-going children a secure future.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago un joven de 25 años de edad quien gracias a su madre que le facilito un espacio logro montar un negocio donde distribuye bebidas alcohólicas y comida básicamente para eventos especiales del sector siendo una de las pocas fami-empresas dedicadas a esta labor en su zona residencial de Girardot 

Siendo muy joven opto por independizarse pues conseguir trabajo se tornada muy difícil y los que conseguía era en condiciones pésimas, trabajando muchas horas por un bajo jornal y gracia a su madre ha sabido mejorar su calidad de vida y apoyar incondicionalmente a sus padres.

Solicita un crédito para la compra de cervezas y licores de la región como lo es el aguardiente  y también invertirá en insumos para realizar los banquetes que le piden para los eventos. 

Para Santiago el apoyo que puedan recibir es muy importante pues podrá crecer y generar empleos brindando un servicio óptimo y eficiente que logre un objetivo de permanecer en el mercado y ser líderes en el mercado.
texts.en:
Santiago is a young man of 25. Thanks to his mother's support in securing a space, he has succeeded in establishing a business providing alcoholic beverages and food for special events in his area. This is one of the few family-owned micro-businesses providing food and drink services for events in his neighborhood in Giradota.  From a young age, he opted to make himself independent as finding work was difficult and what work he could find offered poor conditions and long hours for a low daily wage. With his mother's guidance, he figured out how to improve his quality of life and become able to support his parents. 

He is seeking a loan to buy beer and local liquors, such as aguardiente, and also invest other materials he needs to put on the banquets his customers expect for their events. For Santiago, any support he can get is very important because it will allow him to grow his business and create jobs while offering a reliable and quality service. With this support, he hopes to realize his goal of establishing himself and becoming a leader in the market.

loans.use: to buy alcoholic beverages and food to put on special events in his neighborhood, like quinceañeras, weddings, and birthdays.

loans.name: Winda

texts.en: Meet Winda. Winda is single and she lives with more than six family members in Depok, a city located about at the south of Jakarta. She runs a small shop that sells snacks, drinks, mobile phone airtime credits, and a utility bill payment service for her customers. She began working with Ruma because she wanted to increase her income. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits. As the business runs, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as a working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone airtime credit transactions on weekends

loans.name: Buramba Tukwatanise Group

texts.en: Annet is a repeat client and a member of Buramba Tukwatanise Group having borrowed twice from UGAFODE through its Ishaka Branch. She is single with four children. She also has 2 dependents who stay with her since they have no parents. Her major sources of income are from farming and dealing in dry cereals. She has given her best to be able to get income to sustain her family. She gives this business 10 hours per day. In addition to this business, Annet does chicken production as a way of supplementing her income. She started her business in the year 2000 in Burumba ward, Ishaka Bushenyi District. Her main objective of starting her business was because dry cereals don’t spoil easily. Her clients are mainly the farmers and people with parties. She has applied for a loan of UGX 300,000 (three hundred thousand shillings only) to purchase more dry cereals for her business. Her biggest challenge is the unfavorable climatic conditions and debtors which both affect her income negatively. Her future plans are to pay school fees for her dependents and pay for medical services for them and herself. She loves what she does and this has helped her a lot in conducting her business. She thanks the institution at large for its continued support in financing her businesses.

loans.use: to buy cereals to sell.

loans.name: Santana

texts.es:
Santana tiene 40 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene dos hijas, una ya se acompañó y la otra aún vive en casa, Santana no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, pues sus padres se enfocaban mas al trabajo agrícola.

Santana tiene mucha experiencia en la actividad agrícola, desde temprana edad aprendió todos los procedimientos y técnicas que se utilizan en este trabajo.

Él necesita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes y aplicárselo a su cultivo de maíz y de ajonjolí.

Él desea cultivas mas maíz y ajonjolí pues espera tener mejores ingresos para ayudar a su familia a salir adelante y a su hija para que sea profesional.
texts.en:
Santana is 40 years old. He lives with a companion and he has two daughters, one of whom is in a relationship and the other who still lives at home. He didn´t have the opportunity to study; his parents were involved in agricultural work.

Santana has many years of experience in agriculture. From an early age he learned the methods and techniques that are used in this kind of work. He needs this loan to buy fertilizers and to apply them to his corn and sesame crops. He wants to produce more corn and sesame since he hopes to have greater income to be able to help his family to get ahead and to help his daughter to have a professional career.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and apply it to his corn and sesame crops.

loans.name: Katookye Abamwe Group
