Lydia has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Lydia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Ma. Evelyn

texts.en:
Ma. Evelyn is 54 years old and married with two children.

Ma. Evelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

Ma. Evelyn has borrowed and repaid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

Ma. Evelyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Alicia Esmeralda

texts.es:
Alicia de 38 años de edad, estudió hasta cuarto grado, está acompañada y su pareja es pescador, tiene 5 hijos pero solo 3 viven con ella, de los cuales uno trabaja y los otros dos estudian en la escuela.

Alicia posee una tienda en su casa desde hace tres meses, no tiene otras actividades económicas, antes se dedicaba a la venta de sardinas, además su hija le colabora a vender en la tienda, el horario de trabajo es de 8:00 Am a 7:00 Pm.

Ella necesita el crédito para surtir la tienda, comprará granos básicos y otro tipo de mercadería por lo que este préstamo le servirá para tener más variedad en la tienda.

Su sueño es mejorar los ingresos de su  negocio para que sus hijos continúen estudiando y tener más variedad de productos en la tienda.
texts.en:
Alicia is 38 years old and studied up to Grade 4. She is in a relationship and her spouse is a fisherman. She has 5 children but only 3 of them live with her. One of them works and the other studies at school. Alicia has had a store in her house for 3 months.She works from 8am until 7 pm and sometimes her daughter helps her sell in the store. She has no other business activities. She used to sell sardines.

She needs the loan to stock her store, buying basic grains and other kinds of merchandise which will help her have more variety in her store. Her dream is to increase the income from her business so that her children can continue to study and she can have more products in her store.

loans.use: to stock her store buying basic grains and other merchandise.

loans.name: Ricky

texts.en:
Ricky’s take on business is about as humble and unique as you’re going to find in this life. He believes that every business draws on the essential and undeniable glory of creation, and that by competing with other businesses to gain market share, a businessperson ignores the essential oneness and interdependence of all people.

It is this philosophy that makes his fragrance and perfume sales business unique. Instead of focusing on competition and profit, Ricky chooses to concentrate on providing the highest-quality product at a decent price. He sees his role as a fragrance salesman as “giving you back what you were created to have.”

Ricky has more than enough liquidity to satisfy his business needs for the foreseeable future; however, he chose to take out a Kiva loan to build a credit score more than anything else. 

Ricky will use his Kiva loan money to build credit, cover operating costs, and increase cash flow, in the event that he receives a large order that requires upfront investment to fulfill.

Ricky likes to smell good, and sees his business as a continuation of a long tradition of fragrance merchants. Will the help of generous Kiva lenders, Ricky will help keep the dream alive for a millennium to come.

loans.use: to build credit, cover operating costs, and increase cash flow.

loans.name: Vivencio

texts.en: Vivencio is a 39-year-old father who is raising his family in a rural community. He aimed to improve the living status of his family to give them a better life. He owns and operates his jeepney to generate income. To continuously operate his jeepney, he needs to avail himself of a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy the spare parts needed for the maintenance of his jeepney. He is hoping that he will receive his loan request to provide safe transportation to his passengers. Through his patience and hard work, he believes that he will be able to improve his business as well as their status of living.

loans.use: to buy the spare parts needed for the maintenance of his jeepney

loans.name: Safietou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe composé de 9 femmes issues du mème quartier  unies par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles a été formé depuis le 26 Dècembre 2011. Madame Safiétou est la responsable . Elle est agée de 52 ans mariée et mère de 07 enfants dont 4 garcons et 3 filles . 
Elle s'active dans la vente de poissons fumés et séchés  et de bégnets. 
Avec son nouveau crédit elle va se payer des paniers de poissons frais qu'elle va transformer et acheter des sacs de farine pour faite des beignets et le s revendre au détails au niveau de son quartier.
Elle dispose d'une bonne éxpérience et avec les bénéfices réalisés elle prend en charge les besoins alimentaires de sa famille.Elle va également acheter du ciment pour terminer la construction de sa maison.
texts.en:
This group is composed of nine women from the same neighborhood who maintain good social and professional relations. The group has been in existence since December 26, 2011. Mrs. Safiétou, the group's   leader, is 52 years old, married, and the mother of seven: four sons and three daughters.
She works as a vendor selling smoked and dried fish as well as fritters.

With her new loan, she will buy some baskets and fresh fish for cooking and also some bags of flour to prepare fritters to  retail in her neighborhood. She has  plenty of experience [in this line and of work] and provides for her family's food thanks to her revenues. She also will buy cement for finishing the construction works on her house.

loans.use: to buy baskets of dried and smoked fish for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins, vaccines and additional pigs to raise

loans.name: Louie

texts.en:
Louie is 25 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Louie is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Louie has been in this business for 5 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Lovella

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Lovella works hard to support her family.

She has a broom making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Lovella is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase more materials like nails, bamboo, wire, etc. for her broom making business.

Lovella has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more materials like nails, bamboo, wire, etc. for her business

loans.name: Noé

texts.es:
Noé de 49 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, son padres de  3 hijos; pero solo 2 viven con ellos.
 
Noé es agricultor, trabajo que aprendió de sus padres, desde entonces se ha dedicado a esta labor, siembra maíz, maicillo y frijol en un promedio de 7,000 metros cuadrados por cada cultivo,  el lugar donde realiza este trabajo está a una distancia de 25 minutos de su casa caminando.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para el pago del alquiler del terreno, comprar fórmula, sulfato, foliares y el pago de las personas que le ayudan a trabajar. 

Sus planes son siempre seguir cultivando, ya que este rubro es el que le ha permitido sacar a su familia adelante y asegurar la calidad de vida y seguridad alimentaria para su familia. Así como para otras personas que compran sus granos y cancelar los compromisos adquiridos.
texts.en:
Noé, age 49, studied until the second grade.  His wife devotes herself to housekeeping. They are the parents of three children, but only two live with them.

Noé is a farmer, work that he learned from his parents. He has been devoting himself to this work since that time, planting corn, sorghum, and beans, on an average of 7,000 square meters [1.73 acres] per crop. The site on which he carries out his work is about 25 minutes walking distance from his house.  

The loan that he is requesting from CrediCampo is for renting the land, purchasing formula, sulfate, and foliar applications, and paying workers.

His plans are to always continue farming, as this work has allowed him to provide for his family and guarantee their quality of life and the security of their food.

loans.use: to pay for renting the land, to purchase formula, sulfate, and foliar applications, and to pay workers.

loans.name: Sopheary

texts.en:
Sopheary is a 24-year-old married woman with a small child. She has had a driving school since 2010. Her husband is a driving instructor. All of them live in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. Together, they can earn approximately $40 per day. 

Sopheary would like to request a loan to buy more instruction tools and process driving licenses for learners. This loan will help her operate her school smoothly. In the future, she is going to expand her driving school.

loans.use: to buy more instruction tools and process driving licenses for learners

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marissa is 30 years old, and her two children are in school.

Marissa has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. Marissa requested an 18,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to purchase more raw materials for her business.

Marissa has been in this business for eight years. Marissa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials for her business

loans.name: Aziz

texts.ru: Азиз кредитуется первый раз. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 долларов США, потому что он должен за учебный договор в университете. Азиз поступил на 1 курс национального Университета Таджикистана. Он учится в факультете Механика и математика. Азиз начал учебный год с такой надеждой, что он получить много нового для себя и будет развевать себя интеллектуально. Азиз живет с родителями. Он очень их любит. Азиз еще не женат и он мечтает жениться на хорошей девушке. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Aziz takes a loan for the first time. He requests a loan in the amount of 1,000 US dollar, because he needs to pay his tuition at the university. Aziz started his first year at the national Tajik University. He studies at the faculty of Mechanics and mathematics. Aziz started the academic year with the hope that he would learn many new things and develop intellectually. 

Aziz lives with his parents. He loves them very much. Aziz is not yet married and he dreams of marrying a good girl. He awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Suhrob

texts.ru: Сухроб живет вместе с родителями. Его отец Саидмурод. Он бизнесмен. Его мать Саломат и она занимается шитьем женской одежды. Сухроб окончил среднюю школу и для того чтобы продолжить учебу, он поступил в Аграрный Университет Таджикистана. Теперь он студент первого курса. Сухроб хочет окончить университет успешно и работать в аграрной системе и развевать этот сектор. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 950 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Suhrob lives together with his parents. His father is called Saidmurod. He is a business man. His mother is called Salomat, and she works with sewing women's clothing. 

Suhrob finished high school and in order to continue his studies, he started at the Agrarian University of Tajikistan. He is currently a first year student. Suhrob would like to graduate from university with success and work within agriculture and develop this sector. He requests a loan in the amount of 950 US dollar to pay his tuition. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Ermilinda

texts.en:
Due to financial hardship, Ermilinda aimed to improve her small retail store to earn a higher income and sustain the necessities of her family. She is 41 years old and blessed with two children attending school. She and her husband want their children to earn a degree so that they will be employed someday. 

With this regard, Ermilinda wants to access financial assistance from Kiva lenders to improve her business. She is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to purchase more noodles, canned goods, assorted biscuits, candies, beverages, seasonings and soft drinks to resell. She believes that this financial assistance will enable her to improve the business.

loans.use: to purchase more noodles, canned goods, assorted biscuits, candies, beverages, seasonings and soft drinks to resell

loans.name: Nemesia

texts.en:
Nemesia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 29,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase additional materials like fabric, threads, zippers, etc., for her tailoring business.

Nemesia has been in this business for five years. Nemesia earns additional income from pig fattening.

Nemesia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like fabric, threads, zippers, etc., for her business

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena works hard to support her family. Nena is married and has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines.

Nena requested a 14,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional raw materials for her business.

Nena has been in this business for seven years now.

Nena would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional raw materials for her business

loans.name: Muborakkhon

texts.ru: Муборакхон обращается в ИМОН за займом первый раз. Она очень добрая женщина. Муборакхон в последнее 3 года работает в больнице медсестрой. До этого она работала в средней школе медсестрой. Муборакхон окончила Медицинский колледж. Ее муж работает строителем в Российской Федерации. Муборакхон воспитывает 3 детей. Ее старший сын является студентом 1 курса. Она должна оплатить за учебный договор своего сына и с такой целью она запрашивает займ на сумму 700 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора своего сына. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Muborakkhon turned to IMON for a loan for the first time. She is a very good woman. For the last three years, Muborakkhon has worked as a nurse at a hospital. Before this, she worked as a nurse at a high school. Muborakkhon graduated from a medical college. Her husband works as a carpenter in the Russian Federation. 

Muborakkhon is raising three children. Her eldest son is a first year student. She needs to pay her son's tuition, and with this aim she requests a loan in the amount of 700 US dollar. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for her son's tuition

loans.name: Maria Ana

texts.es:
La señora María es una persona emprendedora,  honesta  y seria, vive con sus 3 hijos y 5 nietos  en el  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la  compra y venta  de  gallinas. El préstamo lo necesita para la compra de más gallinas y una vaca para su negocio y poder ofrecer a sus clientes más producto.
Doña María con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener y cubrir así sus necesidades con los ingresos que obtenga y poder seguir apoyando a su familia.
Doña María  espera que  en unos 2 años  su negocio siga  creciendo y  consolidándose  para que se convierta en la más grande y  reconocido de la zona a su a su vez seguir apoyando a sus hijos y nietos.

  
Choluteca, Honduras – Agosto del  2014
texts.en:
Señora Maria is an entrepreneurial person, honest and serious. She lives with her three children and five grandchildren in the south of Honduras. Her business is buying and selling chickens. She needs the loan to purchase more chickens and a cow for her business so that she can offer her customers more products. 

With the loan, Doña Maria hopes that the sales in her business will increase so that she will have what she needs to cover her necessities with the income that she obtains and she will be able to continue supporting her family.

Doña Maria hopes that in about two years her business will continue growing and strengthening so that it becomes the largest and best known in the zone, and on her part, she can continue to support her children and grandchildren.

  
Choluteca, Honduras – August, 2014

loans.use: to buy chickens and a cow for her business.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca lives in Suai. She is married, and her husband is a farmer. She earns a good income from her business. She is a businesswoman. She is now applying for a loan of $800. She is taking this loan to buy other materials such as cotton, cloth, sewing needles and other things. Francisca started her business in 2005 with working capital of $150. She hopes to open a big store in the future. She is happy with the loan that offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her because with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin she can increase her business. She also has animals like cows, pigs and chicken.

loans.use: To buy cotton, cloth, sewing needles and other things.

loans.name: Hormecinda

texts.es:
Hormecinda tiene 40 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene dos hijos a su cargo, vive en casa propia; domiciliada en una zona rural, del centro poblado Nueva Arica, distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Hormecinda se dedica a la venta de golosinas, gaseosas, chupetes (tienda general) y adicionalmente cría y vende animales de corral; hace 10 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, solicita préstamo para invertir en activo fijo(construcción); compra de adobe, calamina etc. para mejorar su vivienda (su sala) y de esta manera tener un espacio más amplio y comodo donde atender a sus clientes, lo que le permitirá captar a más clientes y por ende hará que sus ingresos crezcan, al igual que sus ganancias y por ende su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Hormecinda is 40 years old. She has a partner and has two children in her care. She lives in her own house, located in a rural zone of the Nueva Arica population center in the district of Cayaltí, the province of Chiclayo, and the region of Lambayeque on the northern coast of Peru.

Hormecinda sells candies, soft drinks, pacifiers (general store), and in addition she raises and sells barnyard animals. For ten years her business has been located in her home. She is applying for the loan to invest in a fixed asset (construction) by buying adobe, metal roofing, etc., to improve her home (her sales space) and in this way have a bigger and more comfortable space for serving her customers, which will allow her to attract more customers and in the end her income will grow, along with her earnings and, in the end, her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to invest in a fixed asset (construction) by buying adobe, metal roofing, etc., to improve her home (her sales space)

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 61 years old and married with 10 children.  

Nenita is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Nenita requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

Nenita has been in pig fattening for five years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Nenita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Naty

texts.en:
Naty is 42 years old, married and blessed with seven children. While she takes care of her young children, she runs a sari-sari, or small retail store, in her community to supplement the family’s income.

Naty would like to build up her store's stock, but she hasn’t enough capital to do so. For this reason she is applying for a 5,000 PHP loan through ASKI to buy more merchandise and groceries such as school supplies, canned goods, snack foods, medicine, noodles, beverages and soft drinks to resell. She is hoping that she will obtain her loan so she can improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise and groceries to sell

loans.name: Necifora

texts.en:
Necifora is a 58-year-old with two children. She settled to earn her living in Tangub City, Philippines, together with her family. Over the past five years, Necifora  was able to put up a retail  business that absolutely met their needs. Necifora approximately receives an adequate amount from her business operations.

Necifora joined GDMPC last year to have an easy access to financial services. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC in addition to her capital. The money taken is intended to buy additional grocery goods to sell. She wants to expand her business and improve the general living conditions of the family. 

Necifora's picture was taken in front of her store with her vehicle used for the personal transportation of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita works hard to support her family. Rita is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Rita requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Rita has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Rita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is fifty years old, married and has six children, one of whom is still in school. For the past five years she has raised cattle to earn an income.

Josephine has borrowed and successfully repaid twenty loans through NWTF. She is now applying for a 12,000 PHP loan to buy vitamins and other supplies for her cattle. She is incrementally building her business so as to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and other supplies for her cattle

loans.name: Ana Rosa

texts.es:
Ana de 24 años de edad, es una joven que estudió hasta 7ºgrado, está acompañada y su compañero de vida se dedica a ser albañil, tiene un hijo que estudia 2º grado y solo ellos viven en su casa.

Ella es comerciante, desde hace dos años se dedica a vender ropa y zapatos, anteriormente se dedicaba a ser empleada doméstica en casa ajena, el horario de su trabajo es de 8:00 am a 3:00 pm, el trabajo lo realiza en la comunidad  y los fines de semana trabaja en su casa.

Este préstamo lo necesita para comprar mercadería para su negocio, como zapatos, camisas de mujer y niños, esto le ayudará a mejorar y tendrá mejores ingresos económicos.

Su sueño es convertirse en una gran comerciante por mayoreo.
texts.en:
Ana, who is 24 years old, is a young woman who went to school through 7th grade. She has a life companion who works as a mason. She has a son who is in second grade, and only these three live in their house.

She is a businesswoman. For two years she has sold clothing and shoes. In the past, she worked as a domestic employee in someone else's house. Her work schedule is from 8:00 am to 3:00 pm. She does her work in the community, and on weekends she works in her house.

She needs this loan to buy merchandise for her business, such as shoes and shirts for women and children. This will help her to improve and she will have better economic income.

Her dream is become a great wholesale dealer.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business, such as shoes and shirts for women and children

loans.name: Kashif

texts.en:
Kashif is a 37-year-old married person, living along with his family in the area of Gujrat, Pakistan. He is a poor farmer and is cherishing his family by hook or by crook. 

He has to pay a fair amount to use a rental tractor for preparing the soil to plant the seeds to collect the harvest. He wants to buy a tractor of his own with the contribution of savings, but he does not have cash in hand to buy a new tractor.

This is the reason Kashif has contacted Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan and requested a loan. He has been motivated after receiving this amount. He hopes for productive turnover after utilizing this amount. 

Kashif thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a tractor with the contribution of savings for agricultural purposes.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Jean has been engaged in a general store for four years. She is a responsible and industrious woman who aims to have a better way of life someday. Jean's other source of income comes from buying and selling bananas and the farming business. She and her husband have been working hand in hand to increase their income. To realize their dreams, Jean is asking for additional capital of PHP 7,000 which will be used in buying grocery items such as sugar, cooking oil, eggs, soft drinks and school supplies. She is hoping that through this loan amount, she can further improve her sales and save some for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as sugar, cooking oil, eggs, soft drinks and school supplies to sell

loans.name: William

texts.en:
This is William, 44, a resident of Cavite, Philippines.  He is married to Julieta and has three children. One of the children is in High School and two are in Elementary School. By the grace of God, he  has managed to support all his children’s educational needs.  As of the present time, he is working hard to be able to continue supporting his family’s household needs and his children’s education.

William has operated a watch repair shop for 15 years now.  He is the main technician and has three employees. His shop offers repair and check-up of all types of watches. He also sells different types and brands of watches. His shop is located adjacent to his house. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 1,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. 

With the growth of his watch-repair business, he now wants to venture into the tailoring business. He is applying for a loan in the amount of 50,000 PHP to buy a sewing machine and new tools and supplies for his watch repair shop.

William believes his business is growing and he will be able to give his children a good and quality education through all his hard work.  He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his watch repair and to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins, and vaccines for her hogs

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Gemma is 41 years old and both of her children are in school.

Gemma has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Gemma has been in this business for 24 years. In the future, Gemma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 28 years old, married and has three children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past two years she has raised pigs in the Philippines.

Joy has borrowed and successfully repaid a previous loan through NWTF. She is now applying for a 6000 PHP loan to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is incrementally building her pig business so as to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma has faithfully paid back her previous loan, which she used for her business. She has been operating her own rug-making business for years and she earns well from this. Having a bigger responsibility requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her children. She has to work hard, with the determination of having better income, to provide her children with better education. 

To improve her profit, Gemma would like to apply for a new loan. With PHP 15,000, she could purchase more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials for her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Gemma hopes that her business will continue to flourish. She wants her children to always be in good condition and their family to always be happy. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more raw materials such as fabric, thread, etc.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Hard work and patience have been Marites’s guiding principles in running her tailoring business. She is 50 years old and has four children. Her spouse is a farmer. 

Marites is requesting an 11,000 PHP loan to buy garments, thread, and needles for her tailoring business. She is determined to improve her financial stability. Elena is hoping that lenders will grant her requested loan amount so that she can keep her tailoring business profitable and be able to offer quality products to all her costumers.

loans.use: to buy garments, thread, and needles for her tailoring business

loans.name: Gemmalyn

texts.en:
Gemmalyn has operated her variety store for more than ten years. She is 32 years of age, married to a farmer, and blessed with three children. Gemmalyn is also engaged in hog raising and a farming business. The couple aims to uplift their living condition and have a stable source of income.

In realization of her goals, she decided to borrow additional capital in the amount of PHP 7,000. She will use this amount to buy stock of merchandise and frozen foods. She believes that through this amount of loan, she could further generate better income and improve her living condition.

loans.use: to buy stock of merchandise and frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins and additional pigs to raise

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo has been raising pigs and harvesting crops to make a living. Aside from this, he also vends buco juice and snacks in the market, and earns well from this. His business activities were doing well, and yet recently, he still has financial needs for fertilizer to restore farm nutrients. 

He has successfully repaid his previous loans used for these activities. Recently, he took a new loan from GDMPC to buy organic fertilizer. 

In the future, Danilo wants to save as a reserve for future emergencies and to purchase more farmland.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 65 years old and lives in Maloro, a part of Tangub City in Misamis Occidental. For many years, she has continually run a transportation service. Rosario earns well and has successfully repaid her previous loan that she used for pedicab repairs and maintenance. With the savings from her loan, she was able to buy another vehicle. Rosario bought a motorcycle as an addition to her business. Her new motorcycle is not fully brand new but it works well. 

Rosario is requesting a loan to buy new set of tires to replace the old used tires on her motorcycle. In the future, she hopes to continue her business improvements as well as improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy a new set of tires

loans.name: Saqab

texts.en:
Saqab is the age of 30; he is the father of one child. He lives in Gujrat, Pakistan. He sells dairy products like milk, curd, and butter. He owns a small dairy farm consisting of buffaloes and cows. He daily sells milk to different tea stalls. He is an honest man. He manages his household necessities from his earnings from milk sales.  He speaks with a calm, monotonous tone which is impressive and he easily wins the trust of his clients. 

He was in need of one buffalo to increase his income through his milk sale business. So, he applied for a loan. In this way, he would be able to increase his milk sale business.

Saqab thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for his milk sale business

loans.name: Hashim

texts.en:
Hashim is a 26-year-old young and energetic man, living along with his parents in the area of Gujrat, Pakistan. 

He is a hardworking and independent person who is helping his family by providing tailoring services. He adopted this profession to do as a part-time job along with harvesting. He very well knows the techniques of stitching. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. His sewing machine has become out of order, due to continuously working, and he wants to buy a new one.

He has requested a loan to buy a sewing machine. In addition to repaying the loan, he will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

Hashim thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for tailoring purposes.

loans.name: Sagheer

texts.en:
Sagheer is the age of 38 and lives in Gujrat, Pakistan. He is an honest and hardworking man. He is also a responsible father of two children. He is a farmer by profession and owner of large areas of cultivation land. He cultivates seasonal crops on his land and gets fruitful outputs from his crops. 

In his land area, there is no canal system for watering, and therefore he decided to irrigate his land by a tube well. He prefers the irrigation by tube well because this rainy season is not so effective for water requirements of the land. For this purpose, he has to bear some additional amount. Therefore, Sagheer has requested a loan from Kiva field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

He is very thankful to Kiva and its partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to irrigate his agriculture land by a deep tube well operation.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 39 years old and married with five children. With two of her children currently in school, Teresita works very hard to provide for them.

Teresita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, cooking oil, detergent soap, shampoo, etc.

Teresita has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items, such as canned goods, noodles, cooking oil, detergent soap, shampoo, etc. 

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, cooking oil, detergent soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Jhonnatan

texts.es:
Jhonnatan tiene 19 años de edad, estudió hasta 1er año de bachillerato, está acompañado y tiene un hijo de 9 meses, su pareja es ama de casa y viven con la madre y hermana de él.

Jhonnatan se dedica a la albañilería desde hace 10 años, este trabajo lo aprendió de su tío, además se dedica a ensayar a los jóvenes de la banda escolar, su horario es variado ya que los trabajos los realiza en diferentes horas en la comunidad.

El crédito lo necesita  para poner un negocio de frutas y verduras en el mercado, este crédito le será de gran ayuda ya que él no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para echar andar este negocio.

                                                 Su sueño es comprar su propia casa y tener sus propias cosas.
texts.en:
Jhonnatan is 19 years old and studied through the first year of high school. He has a partner who is a housewife, and a nine-month old son. They live with his mom and his sister.

Jhonnatan has worked in construction for the last ten years, a trade he learned from his uncle. He also trains the youngsters of the school band. His schedule varies daily since he works several jobs at different times in the community.

He needs the loan to set up a fruit and vegetable stand in the market. This loan will be a great help since he does not count with enough funds to set up the business. 

His dream is to buy a home and to have his own things.

loans.use: to set up a fruit and vegetabel business at the market.

loans.name: Zafar

texts.en:
Zafar is a 35-year-old married man, living in the area of Gujrat, Pakistan, along with his family. He is the father of three children. He is a cattle trader and does most of his trading from within his home area. He breeds cattle in his yard as well, and sells the bull calves to the butchers. He has to feed the calves for one or two years until they have grown up and are healthy, which is very lengthy and an expensive procedure. He also sells buffaloes as well. He buys buffaloes at a low price and sells them to the people for a profitable price.

He has been producing milk and breeding from the buffaloes. His production of milk and the breeding procedure have been affected because he is unable to cope with the demand. 

Zafar wants to buy a buffalo to keep his income and his business constant, but he has already invested his all savings into miscellaneous expenses of the dairy farm. He does not have sufficient cash in hand to buy a buffalo to continue his business smoothly. 

Therefore, Zafar requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so he would be able to purchase a new buffalo for his business. He hopes that lenders will support him and this loan will prove productive for his business as well.

He is very impressed with the Kiva loan cycle system; he is thankful to the lenders.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
La señora Teodora es una persona honesta y responsable vive con  sus  hijos en un municipio al sur de Honduras. Su negocio es  la  elaboración y venta de  tortillas. 
Doña Teodora necesita el  préstamo para la compra de maíz, leña y cal que son la materia prima que necesita para elaborar su producto, con el préstamo espera que sus ventas aumenten al tener más producto  en  esta  temporada alta  a su vez espera  cubrir sus necesidades y las de su familia.
Doña Teodora en unos años sueña con que  su negocio este posicionado como el  más grande y  conocido en su municipio  y poder seguir apoyando a  sus hijos  a que se conviertan en personas de bien. 


Choluteca, Honduras – Agosto   del   2014
texts.en:
Teodora is an honest and responsible person who lives with her children in a township in southern Honduras. Her business consists of the manufacture and sale of tortillas.

Teodora needs the loan to purchase corn, wood and lime, which are the raw materials needed to produce her product. 

With the loan she hopes her sales will grow by having more product during this high season while at the same time she hopes to cover her needs and those of her family. 

Teodora dreams that within in a few years, her business will be positioned as the largest and best known in her municipality and for her to be able continue supporting her children to become good people.

loans.use: purchase corn, wood and lime for her business.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Estrella is 44 years old and has four children who are currently in school.

Estrella has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Estrella requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional box of fish to sell in her fish stall.

Estrella has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Estrella would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase an additional box of fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Zagham

texts.en:
Zagham is a 37-year-old married person living with his family in the area of Gujrat, Pakistan.  He is a farmer by profession and cultivates various crops according to the weather, climate, season and demand. He has been using a tractor equipped with plows to prepare the field to collect his harvest but now the tractor is out of order due to continuously working. He wants to fix it as soon as possible but he does not have cash in hand because he has already spent most of his savings to buy seeds and manure.

Therefore, Zagham has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so he can fix his tractor and can continue his cultivation.

Zagham thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to fix the tractor for preparing soil.

loans.name: Leslie

texts.en:
Leslie is 50 years old and has six children. She is widowed and has one child who is still in school.

Leslie is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 40,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Leslie has been in pig fattening for 37 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Imran

texts.en:
Imran is 32 years old, married and the father of three children. He lives in Gujrat, Pakistan. He has owned a milk sales business for the last eight years.

The income generated by his present herd is insufficient to cover all of his household expenses, so he wants to increase his milk sales business. He has been doing it for the last eight years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in his locality. 

Currently, he has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to increase his milk sale business. This will help him to increase his sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for him. Imran thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase his milk sales business

loans.name: Felisidad

texts.en:
Felisidad is married and works hard to support her family. For the past six yers, she has operated a food vending business in the Philippines.

Felisidad is requesting a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. She would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Tupendane B Group

texts.en:
PHALEX, who is in his late 20's, is married with two children.  One is still at school and the other one is still small.  He has been running a genge duka business for five years now. He works from 07 am to 11 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be PHALEX's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to start selling duka products like sugar, salt, beans, rice, wheat, flour, baking flour and cooking oil. He also brought on the genge, which are fruits and vegetables. He has paid back all his loans successfully.  He is really doing fine with the loan.  He used the profit to pay school fees, start building his house, and covered household expenses. 

He will use this loan to buy sacks of beans and also increase the fruit and vegetable stock.  He dreams of making his genge duka big.

PHALEX will share this loan with his loan group, "Tupendane B", which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of beans and also increase the fruit and vegetable stock..

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is married, with two children. She is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. Leonora's husband is a farmer and she helped him cultivate fruits and other crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for over 30 years, and every month she earn well from this work. 

Aside from this, she gets daily income by preparing and selling suman (rice cakes) in their village. She also cater orders for any occasions and snacks. 

She has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients to prepare suman to sell.  

In the future, she hopes to support her children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to prepare suman

loans.name: Tangini Group

texts.en:
Asha, who is in her early 40’s, is married with three children who are still going to school.  She has been a food vendor for 18 years now.  She works from 5 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.  

This will be Asha's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use this loan to increase the food stock.  She dreams of giving a good education to her kids. Asha will share this loan with her loan group "TANGINI," which consists of ten members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase the food stock for her business.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 49 years old and has seven children. She is married, and has one child who is currently in school.

Evelyn is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock and other supplies for her business.

Evelyn has been raising livestock for three years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Florenda requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

She has been in this business for five years now.

Florenda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Galya

texts.en:
Galya lives in Ashotavan village with her husband and son. The latter is an army officer, and Galya's husband works at the local village municipality.

Galya has been involved in farming for 20 years already. Still, she has been working very hard to have a profitable, and at the same time, beautiful farm. Currently, the farm includes cows, calves, sheep, hens and five colonies of bees. Near the house where her family lives, Galya owns arable land where different fruits and vegetables are grown (potato, cabbage, and nut, apple and pear trees). 

Galya has now applied for this loan of USD 1500 to be able to purchase forage for the livestock and fuel for gathering the harvest. She hopes that lenders will support her to develop her farming business further.

loans.use: to pay for forage for the livestock and fuel for gathering the harvest

loans.name: M.irfan

texts.en: M. Irfan is 32 years old and living in Gujrat, Pakistan. He is a responsible father of one child. He is a farmer by profession and owner of large areas of cultivation land. He cultivates seasonal crops on his land and gets fruitful outputs from his crops. Mostly, he likes to cultivate his rice crop. On his land, there is no canal system for watering but the rice crop needs much water for irrigating purposes. Therefore, he decided to irrigate his land by the tube well system. He decided to irrigate with the tube well because this rainy season is not so effective for the water requirements of his rice crop. For this purpose, he has to bear some additional expenses. Therefore, M. Irfan has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. He is very thankful to Kiva and its partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to irrigate his agriculture land with a tube well system

loans.name: Zubair

texts.en:
Zubair is a 45-year-old married man, living along with his family in the area of Gujrat, Pakistan. He owns a small industry at home where he makes candles by hand. All of his family members help him regarding candle making. He supplies his handmade candles to different markets, shops, and stores. Nowadays a lot of load shedding happens in this area and the demand for candles suddenly increased.

He wants to make the maximum candles according to demand, but he does not have enough paraffin wax in stock. Now raw material is required in large quantity but he does not have enough cash in hand to buy paraffin wax.

Therefore, Zubair has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the help of the loan amount, he will buy paraffin wax so he can cope with the increase in demand. 

Zubair thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy paraffin wax for making candles to sell.

loans.name: Bayarsaikhan

texts.en: Mr. Bayarsaikhan, 34 years old, lives with his wife and four children in Kherlen, the an easternmost town of Mongolia. He has been working as employee bus driver at a local immigration agency since 2013. His wife renders taxi service to local people if possible, but usually stays at home looking after their children. Their eldest son only goes to high school and others stay at home, helping their mom with household work. He is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to buy building materials in order to build a garage. A quality garage will ensure that the car won't lose its appropriate service and will maintain longer survival. Cars that lose their quality emit lots of pollutants.

loans.use: to build a garage in order to maintain the quality of his car.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en: Vicente is a college student and lives with his family at Solana, Cagayan. He is a second year student taking up a Bachelor of Science in Accounting Technology. In order to sustain their needs and school, his mother operates a retail store for income, while his father is a farmer. The family’s income is not sufficient for all their needs, that is why he is now asking for an educational loan of PHP 10,000 to pay his tuition fees. This loan will be a great help in attaining his dreams for his family.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has five children.

For the past nine years, Josephine has been raising livestock for a living. She also earns additional income from farming vegetables.
Josephine is requesting PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy vitamins, vaccines, and other supplies for her livestock.

Josephine is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, vaccines, and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 52 years old and married with three children. Lolita works very hard to provide for them.

Lolita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like sanitary pads, bath soap, noodles, soft-drinks, coffee, cereals, etc. to sell.

Lolita has been in this business for 19 years and sells a variety of items such as sanitary pads, bath soap, noodles, soft-drinks, coffee, cereals, etc. 

Lolita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like sanitary pads, bath soap, noodles, soft drinks, coffee, cereals, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marilou is 43 years old and two of her children are currently in school.

Marilou has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more materials for her business.

Marilou has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Marilou would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her business

loans.name: M.younas

texts.en:
M. Younas is 35 years old, married and the father of two children. He lives in Gujrat, Pakistan. He is a milkman by profession. He has been running a milk sales business for the last 11 years.

The income generated by his present herd is insufficient to cover all of his household expenses, so he wants to increase his milk sales business. He has been doing it for the last 11 years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in his locality.
 
He decided to increase his current milk sales business. Therefore, he has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to increase his milk sales business. 

This will help him to increase his sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for him. M. Younas is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase his milk sales business

loans.name: Bolor-Erdene

texts.en: Mr. Bolor-Erdene, 29 years old, lives with his wife and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been rendering taxi service to local people since 2006. His wife stays at home, looking after their two daughters, ages 4 and 1 year. His previous loan resulted in his family living in a five-walled Mongolian traditional ger. Now he is requesting a loan of 900,000 MNT to buy spare parts for his car. Using spare parts, he will repair his car and be able to continue to render taxi service to local people, which is the main family income.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to repair his car.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more snack foods, assorted candies, canned goods, noodles, mineral waters, soft drinks and beverages to resell

loans.name: Sokhon

texts.en: Sokhon is 54 years old, and a widowed woman with two children.  She is a porridge seller and has been in this selling business since 1998. One of her children is a garment factory worker. They all live in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. Together, they can earn approximately $20 per day. Now Sokhon would like to request a loan to buy unhusked rice to sell. This loan will help her to earn more income. In the future, she is going to renovate the stall for selling porridge and build fences around her house.

loans.use: to buy unhusked rice to sell.

loans.name: Maria Berlyn

texts.en:
Maria Berlyn is 31 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Maria Berlyn has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Maria Berlyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: María Marleny

texts.es:
María tiene 34 años de edad, estudió hasta 6°grado, no pudo continuar por motivos de escasos recursos económicos y decidió dedicarse mejor al trabajo de la artesanía,  está casada y su esposo se dedica  al trabajo de la agricultura, tiene 1 hijo que está estudiando 6°grado y es el único que depende de ellos.


María tiene 25 años de experiencia en el trabajo de artesanía y lo aprendió desde muy pequeña, fueron sus padres quienes se lo enseñaron, decidió dedicarse a esto ya que es una forma para obtener ingresos y salir adelante.


El crédito lo necesita para comprar materia prima de artesanía y seguir adelante con su trabajo, ella comprar materiales de buena calidad para mantener satisfechos a sus clientes.

Su sueño es que su negocio de productos artesanales crezca y que sea una buena fuente de ingresos para ella.
texts.en:
María is 34 years old. She studied up to Grade 6 but could not continue due to a lack of resources. She decided that it was better for her to work in handicrafts. She is married and her husband works in agriculture. She has one child who is studying in Grade 6 and he is the only person dependent on them.

María has 25 years of experience working in handicrafts. She learned when she was quite young as her parents taught her. She decided to work in this field as it is a way of making income and getting ahead.

María needs a loan to buy raw materials for her handicraft and continue with her work. She buys good quality material to keep her customers satisfied. Her dream is for her handicraft business to grow and be a good source of income for her.

loans.use: to buy raw material for her handicrafts.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is a married woman, and a mother of four children from Leyte, Philippines. Merlyn is a fish vendor and has been in the business for more than nine years now. This is the source of her income. Her husband is a cycle rickshaw operator.

Merlyn is applying for a loan to buy more fish to sell, and spare parts for cycle rickshaw like chains, nuts and bolts. With this, she will be able to sell more to fish to her customers, while her husband can continue to earn money by transporting passengers with his cycle rickshaw. Merlyn dreams of expanding her business and making it a sustainable source of income. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell and spare parts for their cycle rickshaw like chains, nuts and bolts.

loans.name: Melchora

texts.en: Melchora is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional materials and gears for her fishing/fish vending business. Melchora has been in this business for 22 years. She also earns more income from raising pigs. Melchora has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and gears for her business.

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik lives in Brnakot village of Syunik region with her husband. He provides transportation service using his own truck. Hasmik herself takes care of the household. She runs a small farm, which includes a livestock of two cows, three calves and hens. Hasmik also cultivates wheat, haricot and potatoes, and together with her husband sells the gathered harvest in the local markets. 

The requested loan of USD 1,500, to purchase forage for feeding the livestock, is very important for Hasmik and her farm.  As this is Hasmik's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance-loan program provides loans to people who didn't have access to credit products before, because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en: Luz is 50 years old, married, and has four children. She is managing a mini-grocery for income. She has been in her business for over 10 years and manages it well to increase her income. She hopes to continue improving her sales and meet customers’ demands for good and affordable products. In order to buy more merchandise to sell, she is asking for additional capital of PHP 50,000. She will use her loan to buy soft drinks, eggs, noodles, assorted biscuits and soap to sell. Luz hopes to keep improving her income and to save funds for family emergency purposes. She promises to keep extending friendly services to all her customers.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, eggs, noodles, assorted biscuits and soap to sell.

loans.name: La Mision Group

texts.es:
Taureliano, tiene 36 años de edad, es soltero, no tiene hijos, vive con sus padres y hermanos en una aldea del municipio de Azacualpa, Intibucá. Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura al cultivo de papa, maíz y frijoles.  Lleva 18 años de tener sus propios cultivos, esta producción la vende en el mercado local de la zona. El préstamo que solicita es en forma grupal y es el segundo ciclo en la institución. Personalmente solicita un monto de 7,000 lempiras para comprar abono, insecticida, fungicidas y mano de obra para aplicación y asistencia al cultivo de papa y granos básicos. Su plan es mejorar el cultivo, la producción y su calidad de vida.
El grupo se llama La Misión, esta formado por 11 personas que viven en la misma comunidad y se dedican a la agricultura. Solicitan un préstamo por 60,500 lempiras grupal y lo invertirán en la compra de abonos, insecticidas, fungicidas y mano de obra para sus cultivos. En la foto se identifican de izquierda a derecha: sentados esta Belisario, Leonardo, David, Emilia y Taureliano, de pie esta Jesús, Isaías, Julio, Justo, Adrián, y Vilma a la derecha.
texts.en:
Taureliano is 36 years old, single and has no children. He lives with his parents and siblings in a village in the municipality of Azacualpa, Intibucá. He has always worked in agriculture growing potatoes, corn and beans. He has been growing his own crops for 18 years and he sells his product in the local market. The loan he is requesting is part of a group loan and it is their second cycle in the institution. For himself he is requesting 7,000 HNL to buy fertilizer, insecticide, fungicide and to pay for labor to apply to and assist his potato and basic grain crops. His plan is to improve his crops, production and his quality of living.

The group is called "La Misión" and is composed of 11 people who live in the same community and work in agriculture. They are requesting a loan of 60,500 for the group and will invest in the purchase of fertilizer, insecticides, fungicides and to pay for labor for their crops. In the photo from left to right are: Belisario, Leonardo, David, Emilia y Taureliano. Standing are Jesús, Isaías, Julio, Justo, Adrián and Vilmato on the right.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides, fungicide and pay for labor for his crops.

loans.name: Zafar

texts.en: Zafar is the age of 36 and he is father of three children. He lives in Gujrat, Pakistan. He provides local, rural transport facility to the people of his society. For the last twelve years he has been running a horse-cart for rural transport services. Now he wants to provide transport services by running an auto rickshaw. He hopes that by running an auto rickshaw, he will be able to get more income to financially support of his family. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of a new auto rickshaw. Therefore, Zafar has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help him to cover the cost of a new auto rickshaw. Zafar is so very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy an auto rickshaw for rural transport services.

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.ru: Дилафруз жизнерадостная женщина. Она с юных лет помогала маме обеспечению семьи, так как ее отец умер рано. Ее мама вырастила 4 детей одна. После замужества тоже ей пришлось трудиться упорно, чтобы зарабатывать на жизнь. Ее муж был трудовым мигрантом в Российской Федерации в течение многих лет. Несколько лет назад он вернулся на Родину и начал заниматься скотоводством. Родители мужа живут с ними. Ее свекровь болеет. Доход Дилафруза и ее мужа, которые они получают от скотоводства, не хватает и для лечения и для обеспечения 3 детей со всеми необходимыми средствами. Второй сын Дилафруза окончил среднюю школу и поступил в университет в этом году. Дилафруз должна оплатить за его учебный договор и с такой целью она запрашивает займ. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Dilafruz is a cheerful woman. She helped her mother take care of the family from a young age, since her father died young. Her mother brought up four children on her own. After her own marriage, Dilafruz had to work hard to earn money to support her family. Her husband was a migrant worker in Russia for many years. He returned to his native land a few years ago and began raising livestock. Her husband's parents live with them and her mother-in-law is ill. Dilafruz and her husband's income from livestock is not sufficient for medical treatment and taking care of three children. Dilafruz's second son finished high school and entered university this year. Dilafruz needs to pay for his tuition and applied for a loan. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: To pay for her son's tuition

loans.name: Arshad Ullah

texts.en: Arshad Ullah belongs to Sialkot. He is 56 years old, married, and has five children. He is a hardworking farmer. He has been farming for many years now and he learned agricultural farming from his father. His wife is a housewife and also helps him with farming. They irrigate land to grow different variety of crops like wheat, rice, potatoes etc. Regular supply of water is important to grow a good crop. Water is supplied through tube wells installed near to their field. The tube wells needs fuel like diesel.   Arshad Ullah has therefore requested a loan to help him with the fuel costs. He is hopeful that he will grow a bumper crop and earn a good amount of money to save for the future. His dream is to provide his family with a good life.

loans.use: to buy fuel for tube wells.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Cirila is 45 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Cirila has a general store business in the Philippines. Cirila requested a loan of PHP 19,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks such as beers, soft-drinks, sanitary pads, diapers, eggs, canned goods and other groceries to sell.

Cirila has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks such as beers, soft-drinks, sanitary pads, diapers, eggs, canned goods and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is 28 years old and has one child. She owns and operates a farm and a piggery to earn a living. She has been working in their farm for more than five years and earns well for the family. With this generated income, she is able to maintain and sustain her business. Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC to purchase feeding supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living situation of her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase feeding supplies

loans.name: Rima

texts.ru: Риме 41 год, воспитывает 3 дочерей школьного возраста. Рима на протяжении 23 лет занимается животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду Римы в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 23 овцы, ежемесячная прибыль от хозяйства составляет около 21,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Рима обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Рима планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, а также хочет достроить дом.
texts.en: Rima is 41 and has three school-age daughters. She has been raising livestock for 23 years. Thanks to her hard work she currently has 23 sheep and earns 21,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to continue expanding her business, Rima applied for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) with Bai-Tushum Bank to buy young bulls to fatten and resell. She plans to use the profits to invest in her business and finish building a house.

loans.use: To purchase young bulls to fatten and resell

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 45 years old and married with five children. With one child currently in school, Corazon works very hard to provide for them.

Corazon runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

She has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, sugar, seasonings, sanitary pads, detergent soap, etc. 

Corazon would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stocks of snack foods, noodles, canned goods, beverages, seasonings, laundry soaps, assorted biscuits, candies and soft drinks for resale

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik is a young farmer from Sisian town. She lives there with her husband and two little children (ages 9 and 5 years old). Her husband is an army officer. 

Hasmik has been involved in the farming business for four years. She keeps livestock of calves, sheep, pigs and piglets, as well as cultivates potatoes and some grass. 

Realizing how important the agricultural income is for the family, Hasmik has applied for this loan. The loan of USD 3,000 will greatly support her to develop her farm by purchasing five more calves and forage for the livestock.

loans.use: to purchase five calves and forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Carlos Ernesto

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 34 años de edad, estudió hasta  5° grado, no pudo seguir por la situación económica, está acompañado y su pareja le ayuda  en el cultivo de maíz y a cuidar el hogar, tiene dos hijos y ambos están en la escuela.

Carlos se dedica a la agricultura, él siembra maíz y plátano oficio que aprendió de sus padres, además hace maderas. Para llegar al lugar donde siembra debe caminar 30 minutos, su jornada de trabajo comienza de 6:00Am hasta las 12:00 de mediodía. 


El préstamo será utilizado para invertir en la siembra de una hectárea de plátano, comprará la semilla, 3 sacos de abonos y pagará mano de obra.

Sus sueños son terminar su casa, que sus hijos se preparen pues él no tuvo la oportunidad y comprar un terreno para cultivar ya aque ahora alquila.
texts.en:
Carlos is 34 years old. He went to school up to the 5th grade. He wasn't able to continue because of his financial situation. He is married and his spouse helps grow the corn and care for the home. He has two children and both of them are in school.

Carlos works in agriculture. He grows corn and plantains. he learned this trade from his parents. He also works with wood. To get to where he plants he has to walk 30 minutes. His work day starts at 6:00 a.m. and goes until 12:00 noon. 

The loan will be used to invest in planting a hectare of plantain. He will buy seeds, 3 sacks of fertilizer and pay for labor.

His dream is to finish his house, for his children to be educated because he wasn't able to, and to buy land to farm because he rents now.

loans.use: to invest in planting a hectare of plantains. He will buy seeds, 3 sacks of fertilizer and pay for labor.

loans.name: Santina

texts.en: Santina lives in Suai and she is a businesswoman. Now she is applying for a loan of $600 from Tuba Rai Metin to increase her business. Her business is selling clothes. She will take a loan to buy other clothes such as children's clothes,  jackets and shoes and other things to sell. Santina started her business in 2013 with her own working capital of $400. She is earning a good income from selling her clothes because many people like to buy them. She is happy with the loan that Tuba Rai Metin offered to her because with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin she will improve her business in the future. Santina has animals like cows, pigs, chicken and goats.

loans.use: to buy children's clothes, jackets, shoes and other things.

loans.name: Akhtar

texts.en: Akhtar is 40 years old, living in Gujrat, Pakistan. He is a responsible father of three children. He is a farmer by profession and owner of large areas of cultivation land. He cultivates seasonal crops in his land and gets fruitful outputs from his crops. Mostly he likes to cultivate rice crop. In his land area, there is no canal system for watering but rice crops need a lot of water for irrigation purposes. Therefore he decided to irrigate his land by tube well system. He needed the irrigation by tube well because this rainy season was not effective in meeting the water requirements of rice crops. For this purpose Akhtar has requested for a loan from KIVA’s field partner,  BRAC Pakistan. He is very thankful to KIVA and its partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to irrigate agriculture land by tube well system

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en: Anabelle is 19 years old, single and lives with her parents in Solana. She is taking up computer science and she is currently in her third year. Her mother is a seamstress and sometimes lacks financially to sustain her education. That is why she is asking for an educational loan of PHP 15,000 to pay for her tuition fees and daily allowance at school. She hopes to help her family earn a living when she has already graduated and is able to have a stable job.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees and daily allowance at school

loans.name: Dora Ester

texts.es:
Dora de 53 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, ella es casada y su esposo se dedica a trabajar como agricultor sembrando granos básicos como maíz, maicillo y en ocasiones hortalizas como chile, tomate,  frijol y ejote , es madre de 4 hijos pero de estos solo uno está a su cargo  y está estudiando Lic. Laboratorio clínico en la universidad.


Dora se dedica a trabajar  en la agricultura con su esposo, pero lo que más hace es cuidar pollos de engorde. Trabajando con pollos tiene experiencia de unos 8 años aproximadamente, aprendió los cuidos que se le dan a estos porque ella siempre le han gustado las aves de corral, un día decidió pedir asesoría técnica para mejorar sus ganancias  fue así como adquirió más experiencia en esa área. Antes se dedicaba junto a su esposo a producir dulce de atado, esto lo obtenía de la caña de azúcar que sembraban.  Los pollos los tienen cerca de su casa, no camina para llegar y todo el día pasa pendientes de ellos.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar fertilizantes, herbicidas y pagara parte de la mano de obra para que le ayuden a realizar las labores agrícolas que requiere el establecimiento de sus cultivos.  El crédito ayudara porque dice que de otra manera no sería posible comprar todo lo que necesita para los cultivos. Esto traerá una mayor producción lo que ayudara a mejorar sus condiciones de vida.


El sueño de Dora es volver a sembrar la parcela de caña que antes tenían con la familia, ya que un hijo  que está en Estados Unidos está dispuesto a apoyarla para establecer el cañal nuevamente, porque les era de doble propósito porque sacaban la cosecha y hacían el dulce; pero también sacaban el follaje para el ganado con lo que obtenían ingresos para los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en:
Dora, aged 53, studied up to third grade. She is married, and her husband makes a living working as a farmer. He grows basic grains—such as corn and sorghum—and, sometimes, garden produce such as hot peppers, tomatoes, beans, and green beans. Dora is a mother of four children, but only one of whom depends on her. He is currently pursuing a bachelor's degree in clinical laboratory science at the university.

Dora makes a living working in agriculture with her husband, but, for the most part, she takes care of broiler chickens. She has about eight years of experience working with chickens. She learned how to take care of them because she has always liked poultry. One day she decided to ask for technical advice to improve her profits, and this is how she acquired more experience in that area. The chickens are a short distance from home, and she spends the whole day taking care of them. Prior to this, she and her husband used to produce "dulce de atado" [blocks of solidified sugarcane honey wrapped in corn husks and tied with natural fiber rope], which was made from the sugarcane they used to plant. 

She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and herbicides, and pay for labor to help her do all the farm work required to grow her crops. This will result in higher yields, which will help improve their living conditions. The loan will be helpful because she says that without it she would not be able to buy everything she needs for the crops. 

Dora's dream is to regrow the parcel of sugarcane that she used to have with the family. One of her children, who lives in the United States, is willing to help her regrow the sugarcane plantation because the harvest used to serve a double purpose: to produce the "dulce" but also to be used as livestock feed, which provided them with income for their household expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides, and pay for labor to help her do all the farm work required to grow her crops.

loans.name: Lamara

texts.en:
Lamara, a teacher working at the local school, is also involved in agriculture. She has been running a family farm for 18 years. The farm currently includes 50 sheep and some hens. Together with her husband, Lamara also cultivates wheat, beans and potatoes. From selling the harvest at the local market, Lamara and her husband earn income which is very important for the family's daily living. 

The requested loan of 3,000 USD is very important for this family and will be used to purchase 10 more sheep and feed for the livestock. This loan will help Lamara to develop her farming business and make it more profitable. 

Lamara and her whole family hope for lenders' goodwill.

loans.use: to pay for 10 sheep and feed.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar es un veterano con mucha experiencia en el campo.
 
Es humilde y sencillo, tiene un gran don de gente y energía suficiente para trabajar y producir.

El tiene un negocio de aserrío que consiste en la compra de arboles en pie que posteriormente corta y vende la madera a los distribuidores del municipio de El Carmen De Viboral, trabaja todos los días para vender su madera y obtener algunas ganancias.

Gracias a sus años de experiencia y enseñanzas que le dio su padre desde niño, tiene plena capacidad para trabajar y para asesorar en estos temas a los demás aserradores de la zona que necesiten ayuda con su producción.

El solicita el crédito para comprar lotes de arboles en pie en distintas fincas, de esta manera inyectara capital a su actividad y mejorara su producción de una manera significativa.

Su trabajo influye en mucha gente y permite un comercio de madera constante para el consumo comercial e industrial.

Tiene mucha fe en su negocio y grandes esperanzas en las personas solidarias que apoyan a los campesinos trabajadores.

Apoya a un humilde agricultor para que pueda sacar adelante su negocio!
texts.en:
