Oscar is a veteran at working out in the field, so he has a great deal of experience. He is humble and modest. Oscar has great people skills and has enough energy to continue working and producing.

He has a lumber business that involves buying tree trunks and cutting them so that he can sell the wood to distributors in the town of El Carmen de Viboral. Oscar works every day so that he can sell the wood and generate some income.

Thanks to his years of experience and the lessons that he learned as a child from his father, Oscar is fully capable of working and advising other lumber mill owners in the area who need assistance with their production.

Oscar is requesting a loan in order to buy tree trunks from different farms. This will inject capital into his business so that he can improve his production significantly. His work influences many people and facilitates the constant sale of wood for commercial and industrial use. Oscar has a great deal of faith in his business and high hopes in the generous people who support farm workers.

Support a humble farmer so that he can get ahead in his business!

loans.use: to buy tree trunks that can be turned into lumber.

loans.name: Fredy Arturo

texts.es:
Fredy de 35 años de edad, estudio 8º grado, está acompañado. Su esposa se dedica a criar pollos de engorde para venderlos por libra, con él viven 2 hijos. Fredy es albañil, tiene 20 años de dedicarse a la agricultura; lo aprendió por medio de sus padres quienes le inculcaron desde pequeño y a estas actividades le ayuda su hijo mayor. 

El crédito lo utilizara para comprar fertilizantes, pesticidas y herbicidas para su cultivo de maíz y para que su cultivo se desarrolle en buen estado. Él planea que su cultivo se desarrolle en buen estado y que tenga un alto rendimiento.
texts.en:
Fredy is 35 years old. He studied until 8th grade and is married. His wife makes a living by raising chickens to fatten up and sell by the pound. Two children live with him. Fredy is a bricklayer and has made a living from agriculture for 20 years. He learnt it from his parents who taught him from a young age and his oldest son assists him with this work. 

He will use the loan to purchase fertilizers, pesticides and herbicides for his maize crops so they grow in good conditions. He aims to ensure that the crops are grown in good conditions so he will have a high yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and herbicides for his maize crops

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita supports the family through her business raising livestock in the Philippines. Mark is 20 years old and is the 6th of six children in the family.

Mark (son of Florita) is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Elementary Education and is currently in the 2nd year of this 4-year course.

Florita, Mark's mother, is borrowing 8,000 PHP to pay for Mark's tuition fees for the second semester of the school year 2014-2015.

When he graduates, Mark plans to help his family to improve their way of living.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees for her son (Mark).

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is thankful for the previous loan that Kiva granted her. She was able to buy additional stocks of eggs needed to increase her product inventory. Her earnings were a big help for her youngest child's education and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 8,000 PHP loan for her to purchase more eggs. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her youngest child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Marcelina dreams for her business to grow more and she hopes to venture into new business opportunities. She also desires that her youngest child will finish his degree sooner. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more eggs, which are needed for her business

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 40 years old and married with two children. With one child currently in school, Marites works very hard to provide for them.

Marites runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Marites has been in this business for 1 year and sells a variety of items such as cereals, coffee, juice, eggs, biscuits, cooking oil, snack foods, canned goods, etc. 

In the future, Marites would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Valmore De Jesús

texts.es:
Valmore de 57 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, es casado. Su esposa se dedica al comercio. 

Valmore se dedica a la agricultura, tiene 20 años de dedicarse a este negocio, lo aprendió por medio de su papa quien le inculco desde pequeño a trabajar en la tierra. 

Con el se involucran sus hijos.  El cliente invertirá el dinero en mejorar la finca de café, en mano de obra y abono. Sus sueños son que su finca se desarrolle en buen estado y que al final tenga un gran rendimiento.
texts.en:
Valmore, 57 years old, finished high school and is married.  His wife works in business.  

Valmore earns a living in agriculture, work he has been doing for 20 years.  He learned this from his father who from a very young age, taught him to work the soil.  His children work with him.   Valmore will invest the loan money in improving his coffee farm, paying for labor and fertilizer.  His dreams are that his farm will develop well and that in the end he will have a great harvest.

loans.use: to improve his coffee farm, buying labor and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed for hogs, vitamins and additional pigs to raise.

loans.name: Menelva

texts.en:
Menelva is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Menelva is 33 years old and has three children who are in school.

Menelva has a native basket making business in the Philippines. Menelva requested a12,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase more raw materials for her business.

Menelva has been in this business for 1 year. In the future, Menelva would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Blanca Mirian

texts.es:
Blanca es una joven de 23 años de edad, estudió hasta 6° grado ya que salió embarazada y tuvo que dejar la escuela, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos y son los únicos que dependen de ella.

Blanca trabaja en los oficios domésticos,además trabaja en el campo en las actividades agrícolas y ha sido la necesidad que la ha llevado a aprender el trabajo, su horario de trabajo es de 6:00 A m a 12 del mediodía.
     

El préstamo sera utilizado para comprar lámina y madera para hacer una casa y  poner una un negocio de pupusas. 

Su sueño es que sus hijos logren prepararse en una profesión, construir su propia casa de ladrillo pues ahora vive en casa de un tío, además le gustaría tener un terreno para cultivar.
texts.en:
Blanca is a 23-year-old young woman, who studied until the 6th grade since a pregnancy forced her to drop out of school. She is a single mother and has 2 children that depend on her.

Blanca takes care of the house chores and works in the agricultural activities of the fields. She had to learn about this job due to necessity. Her work schedule is from 6:00 am to 12:00 pm. 

The loan will be used to buy galvanized sheet and wood to make a house and establish a stand of pupusas (a typical dish from El Salvador).

Her dream is that her children have a professional career and build her own brick house, since she currently lives at her uncle’s house. She would also like to have her own land to cultivate.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheet and wood to build her own house and establish a stand of pupusas.

loans.name: Gulam

texts.en:
Gulam is a 54-year-old married man, living with his family in the area of Gujrat, Pakistan. He is a farmer by profession and likes to cultivate wheat every season. He has been hiring a wheat harvesting machine and paying a huge rent for it. He has sold his last season’s wheat crops and wants to buy his own machine but is still some amount short. Therefore, Gulam has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of the loan he will buy a wheat harvesting machine so he can abstain from the huge rent. 

Gulam thanks Kiva and their field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a wheat harvesting machine.

loans.name: Pedelisa

texts.en:
Pedelisa works hard to support her family. Pedelisa is married and has a repair shop business in the Philippines.

Pedelisa requested a 16,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase additional equipment and other tools for her business.

Pedelisa has been in this business for 30 years now.

Pedelisa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional equipment and other tools for her repair shop business.

loans.name: Recie

texts.en: Recie is 43 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by farming banana in the Philippines. She has been farming bananas for 10 years and also earns additional income from poultry. Recie is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
Reina tiene 34 años de edad, estudió hasta 4° grado, debido a la pobreza abandonó la escuela y se acompañó a los 15 años,  actualmente es madre soltera de 3 hijos, de lo cuales 1 ya se acompañó y los otros están en la escuela, también con ella viven sus padres y una sobrina.
 

Reina se dedica a los oficios domésticos, elaboración de pupusas, planchando y lavando ropa ajena, trabaja en un comedor pero desde hace un año comenzó a vender ropa con su padre. Ella tiene que trasladarse hasta otra ciudad a comprar la mercadería, se levanta desde muy temprano para preparar el desayuno a sus hijos y mandarlos a la escuela, seguidamente sale a vender ropa a su comunidad.


El crédito lo necesita para comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas, faldas, ropa interior, sostenes, calcetines, calzoncillos y trajes para niños y niñas.

Su sueño es comprar un terreno y construir su propia casa, que sus hijos estudien y se preparen para que no le pase lo mismo que a ella.
texts.en:
Reina is 34 years old and studied only until the 4th grade; due to poverty, she left school and found a partner at age 15. She is currently a single mother of three children: one is grown up, while the others are in school.  Her parents and a niece live with her.

Reina does domestic chores, makes pupusas, irons and washes clothes for others, works in a soup kitchen, and for the last year  she has been selling clothing with her father. She has to travel to another city to buy the merchandise, getting up very early to prepare breakfast for her children and send them to school, then she sells clothes to her community.

The loan will be used to buy pants, shirts, blouses, skirts, underwear, bras, socks, underwear and costumes for boys and girls.

His dream is to buy land and build her own home and also to have her children study and prepare themselves so what happen to her doesn't happen to them.

loans.use: buy pants, shirts, blouses, skirts, underwear, bras, socks, underwear and costumes for children.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en: Filomena is a married businesswoman with a kiosk. She is applying for a loan of 1,000 USD. She is taking this loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk, such as coffee, sugar, biscuits, aqua, shampoo, milk SGM, perfumes, candles, candy, sardines, soy sauce, ketchup, and other things. Filomena started her business in 2010 with working capital of 500 USD. She hopes to open a big store in the future with the loan offered to her by Tuba Rai Metin. She is happy because with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin she can have a high management in the future.

loans.use: to buy coffee, sugar, biscuits, aqua, shampoo, milk SGM, perfumes, candles, candy, sardines, soy sauce, ketchup, and other things.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian is 28 years old and married with one child. She is in the agricultural business, and fattens pigs in the Philippines. Vivian has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs. Vivian has been in pig fattening for one year now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Vivian would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mudassir

texts.en:
Mudassir is a 32-year-old married man, living along with his family in the area of Gujrat, Pakistan. He is a farmer by profession and likes to cultivate wheat every season. He has been hiring a wheat harvesting machine and paying huge rent for it. He has sold his last season’s wheat crops and wants to buy a machine of his own, but is still short by some amount.

Therefore, Mudassir has requested for a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of the loan amount, he will buy a wheat harvesting machine so that he can abstain from the huge rent. Mudassir gives thanks to Kiva and the field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a wheat harvesting machine.

loans.name: Shaha

texts.en:
Shaha lives in a small village with her family and is the mother of four sons. Her husband works in construction and one of her sons lives in Germany and sends money to them to help support the family. Together with her husband, she is involved in agricultural work. They have a cow and would like to add an additional one in order to sell even more milk and diary products. 

She is requesting the loan in order to purchase the second cow. Shaha considers this loan helpful because it will directly enable her to increase her income. She and her family are very grateful for this opportunity and want to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to purchase another cow in order to sell even more milk and diary products.

loans.name: Khurshed

texts.ru:
Хуршед 22-летний студент. Он учится на третьем курсе Таджикского Государственного Университета Права, бизнеса и политики. Хуршед одновременно работает. Он уже год как предоставляет услуги мастера по ремонту домов. 
Хуршед живет в городе Худжанд с женой, матерью и сестрой. Его жена домохозяйка, а мать работает в банке.
Хуршед сейчас хочет оплатить за учебу в университете. Он просит кредит в размере 2000 долларов США для оплаты за три года вперед за 3, 4 и 5-й курс. Хуршед хочет сделать предоплату, так как цена на образование год за годом повышается.
texts.en:
Khurshed is a 22-year old student. He is in his third year of studies at the Tajik State University of Law, Business and Politics. Khurshed also works while studying. For one year he has been providing services  as a home contractor.

Khurshed lives in the town of Khujand with his wife, mother and sister. His wife is a homemaker, and his mother works in a bank.
Khurshed would like to pay his university tuition. He is applying for a loan in the amount of 2,000 USD to pay in advance for his third, fourth and fifth year of study. [At Soviet universities, as well as at many European universities before the Bologna reform, college education typically required five years of full-time study. This practice seems to be still in place in Tajikistan--Translator's Note]. Khurshed would like to pay in advance since the costs of tuition keep rising every year.

loans.use: to pay his university tuition for three years in advance.

loans.name: Franz Michael

texts.es: El señor Franz de estado civil soltero, no tiene dependientes económicos, vive en la casa de su tía a quien ayuda en la crianza de ganado Vacuno y Ovino, cortando forrajes, él es muy trabajador y se dedica a la actividad de comercio, compra y venta de ganado bovino en una feria  de Punata de la ciudad de Cochabamba, actualmente solicita un crédito para la compra de ganado, de esa manera podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y generar mayores ingresos para que a futuro pueda construir su propia casa, ya que tiene un gran interés de superarse en la vida.
texts.en:
Franz is single and does not have any dependents. He lives in his aunt's house and helps her to raise cattle and sheep, cutting fodder for them. He is very hardworking and also works in sales, buying and selling cattle at a market in the area of Punata in Cochabamba, Bolivia.
 
Franz is currently asking for a loan to buy cattle, so that he can improve his quality of life and make extra income and so that in the future he can build his own home. He is very motivated to do better in life.

loans.use: buy cattle.

loans.name: Jafar

texts.ru: Чафар молодой и энергичный человек. Ему 18 лет. После окончания средней школы он поступил в Таджикский Государственный Университет Политики и Бизнеса. Он теперь является студентом 1 курса Юридического факультета. Чафар холостой и живет с родителями. Он подрабатывает в свободное время. Чафар решил получить займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он будет погашать займ за счет своего дохода. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие. Будущем он мечтает стать хорошим специалистом и служить своему народу.
texts.en: Jafar is an energetic young man. He is 18 years old. After graduating from secondary school, he was admitted to the Tajik State University of [Law,] Politics and Business. He is now in his first year of study at the faculty of law. Jafar is single and lives with his parents.  In addition, he works part-time. Jafar has decided to apply for a loan to pay for his tuition. He will be paying off his loan from the income he earns. He is counting on your kindness and hopes for your compassion. In the future he hopes to become a highly qualified professional and serve his people.

loans.use: to pay for tuition.

loans.name: Andrés

texts.es:
Andrés tiene 57 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado en la escuela, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene 3 hijos pero ya no viven en casa.

Él se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 13 años, este trabajo lo aprendió con su padre, pero anteriormente se dedicaba a la albañilería, actualmente piensa sembrar una hectárea de maíz, el lugar donde trabaja tiene una distancia de 15 minutos desde su su casa y se traslada caminando.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar insumos agrícolas, específicamente veneno y fertilizantes y otra parte lo utilizará para arreglar el techo de su casa.

Su sueño es cubrir sus necesidades básicas sin ningún problema y en un futuro mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda para no tener problema en invierno
texts.en:
Andres is 57 years old and studied through 3rd grade in school. He lives with his common-law wife, who takes care of the home, and he has three children who all live on their own.

Andres has been working in farming since he was 13 years old. He learned this work from his father, but previously he also worked in carpentry. Currently, Andres would like to sow a hectare [about 2.5 acres] of corn. The land he works is about 15 minutes from his house and he walks there to work.

Andres needs this loan to buy farming supplies, specifically pesticide and fertilizers. He will also use part of the loan to fix the roof of his house. His dream is to be able to cover all the basic household expenses without any problems and in the future to improve the infrastructure of his house so that he has no problems in the winter months.

loans.use: buy farming supplies, specifically pesticide and fertilizers, and fix the roof of his house.

loans.name: Ahmet

texts.en:
Ahmet lives in very bad conditions with his wife and two children. In order to earn a living, he works as a guard while his wife is a cleaner in a bakery. Both of them work hard for very little money and hope to be able to improve their lives some day as well as their children’s future. The house that they live in is very old and has not been repaired or improved for many years, if even at all. 

The conditions are unsanitary and very unhealthy. Ahmet would like to receive a loan in order to make the necessary improvements to his home to provide a better standard of living and improved living conditions. He and his wife are very happy for this opportunity and promise to pay on time.

loans.use: to make the necessary improvements to his home to provide a better standard of living and improved living conditions

loans.name: Anton

texts.en:
Anton wants to buy a dairy cow and the loan he is requesting from you will help him achieve this goal.

Anton is 47 years old and a married father of six children; the youngest is 10 years old and the oldest is 22 years old. To earn a living for his family of eight, he has been running a minibus for transportation of villagers, from the villages around, to the nearby city. In addition to this, he’s been working in agriculture/livestock with help from his wife as well. As of the moment, he has five sheep, chickens and pigs, and a dairy cow that is seen in the picture. As for planting, he has rented out some land from other villagers, since his land is small. Basically, he plants and sells grains and vetch for animals as well as seasonal veggies such as beans, onions, cabbage, and mostly tomatoes.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow in order to increase income for his family of eight

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy needed hog feed, vitamins, and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en: Nilda is requesting a loan of $650 to improve her business. Her husband is working in HRO and they have one child. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as slippers, candies, sugar, coffee, cooking oil, biscuits, aqua, eggs, detergent. and other things to sell including soft drinks and hard drinks. Nilda opened her kiosk in 2011, with her own working capital of $25.00. She is happy with the loan offered by Tuba Rai Metin, for her to have more working capital to buy more goods. And, with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she will improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy slippers, candies, sugar, coffee, cooking oil, biscuits, aqua, eggs, detergent, and other things to sell including soft drinks and hard drinks

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
This is Maria Fe. She is 30 years old and currently resides with her husband, Ryan, in Cavite, Philippines. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for two years, and she profits well from this. Having a bigger responsibility requires more effort to provide for her family's needs, especially for her children. She and her partner have to work hard and are determined to have a better income, to provide their children with a better education.

In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To improve sales, Maria Fe would like to apply for a loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. At an amount of 25,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos), she could purchase larger quantities and more varieties of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely sends you her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance, in advance.

In the future, Maria Fe hopes for her business to grow bigger and bigger. She dreams of improving her family's way of living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God, which she studies. 

*All CCT (Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business

loans.name: Charlyne

texts.en:
Charlyne is 40 years old and married with two children who are both in school. Charlyne works very hard to provide for them.

Charlyne runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Charlyne has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, noodles, and other groceries. 

In the future Charlyne would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell

loans.name: Richel

texts.en:
Richel is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Richel is 40 years old and has three children who are in school.

Richel has a buy and sell tobacco business in the Philippines. Richel requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock of tobacco to sell.

Richel has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Richel would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of tobacco to sell

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila is 43 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Sheila works very hard to provide for them.

Sheila runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Sheila has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, noodles, and other groceries. 

In the future Sheila would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna lives in Agarakavan village of the Aragatsotn region. She lives there with her husband and they are involved in agriculture. The farm that they run is small; it includes only two cows and arable land, where barley and grass are cultivated. 

The requested loan of 700 USD will be a huge support for Susanna and her husband to purchase forage and feed cows. This family hopes for lenders' support and goodwill.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the cows

loans.name: Andressa

texts.en:
Andressa works hard to support her family. Andressa is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Andressa requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell in her fish stall.

Andressa has been in this business for 11 years now.

Andressa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Jamilah

texts.en:
Jamilah is 33 years old and married. She lives with her husband and their children. She has two sons, ten years old and three years old. Her husband is a fisherman. He works to find the fish and sell it.

She has asked for a loan from KPP-UMKM Syariah for 8,000,000 rupiah. This loan will be used for the improvement of access to water and sanitation for their family. She will build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet at their home. 

The sanitation will make her and her family’s health better. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet at their home.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a 24-year-old married man, living with his family in a rented house in Hodeidah city, Yemen. He studied until secondary education. Due to the miserable condition of his family, Mohammed couldn't complete his studies. He didn't surrender to that miserable condition, but decided to seek any business that would help him earn enough money to look after his family. 

In the beginning, he worked in different commercial stores in Hodeidah city. Over time, Mohammed could accumulate a good amount of money and started his own business selling stationary and accessories such as pens, wall clocks, perfumes, roses, gifts, and other materials in his store in the center city of Hodeidah. He started his business more than five years ago. He started his business with a small amount of capital. In time, his business increased more and more. Mohammed is very thankful for his hard work. 

For further expanding his business, he applied for a youth loan of 200,000 YER (Yemen rials) from AMB to purchase more stationary and materials for his store for further retailing in his business.

Mohammed looks forward to expanding his business more through opening other branches inside the city. He hopes to open a savings account in AMB in order to purchase a bus and rent it out with a monthly income.

loans.use: to purchase more stationery and materials for his store.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel has been selling barbecue in her village to support her husband's income from his employment. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for her small business. Maricel always finds ways to augment their situation. With her business, she has sustained their daily expenditures and has purchased some home improvements. 

To increase sales, she took a new loan recently to buy raw ingredients to prepare barbecue to sell. In the future, she wants to improve the general living situation of the family.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to prepare barbecue

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Cecilia is 40 years old, and two of her children are currently in school.

Cecilia has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Cecilia requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Cecilia has been in this business for 22 years. In the future, Cecilia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Ritu Shg Group

texts.en:
Ritu Self Help Group consists of 10 women from a village in Odisha. They formed a group to help themselves to share their problems and to solve their problems among themselves. One of them is Jayanti, who was selected as the president of Ritu Self Help Group. The lady standing second from the left side in the photo is Jayanti. 

Jayanti is 28 years old and is staying with her husband and her 5-year-old child. Her child is in school. She hopes to see her child as an officer in a company. 

She has three acres of land in her village, and she is using her land to grow sugarcane. Her husband is supporting her in this activity. She, along with her group, has requested a loan of 120,000 INR, which will help her to purchase the required resources for sugarcane cultivation. She says a portion of the loan will help her to purchase sugarcane plants, fertilizers, and insecticides, and to cover operational expenses like labor charges.

loans.use: to purchase sugarcane plants, fertilizers, and insecticides, and to cover operational expenses like labor charges.

loans.name: Mijael Enoc

texts.es: Mijael tiene 29 años de edad le gusta leer, hacer deportes y apoyar actividades comunitarias en sus tiempos libres, labora en una institución del gobierno en el departamento de tesorería como Operador de Efectivo, con sus ingresos apoya económicamente a su madre, es un joven que se preocupa por ser un gran profesional, es Lic. en Economía y en la actualidad estudia una maestría en Economía Pública y del Desarrollo en una universidad pública, solicita el apoyo del crédito para poder cancelar las mensualidades de la maestría ya que se encuentra en la etapa final.
texts.en:
Mijael is 29 years old. In his free time he likes to read, play sport and support activities in his community. Mijael works as a cash trader in the treasury department of a government institution. With his earnings he is able to support his mother financially. 

Mijael is a young man who would like to be a great professional. He has a Bachelor degree in Economics and he is currently studying a Master of Public Economy and Development at a public university. He is applying for a loan to pay for his final monthly tuition fees.

loans.use: to pay monthly tuition fees

loans.name: Jecyl

texts.en:
Jecyl is 26 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living from her pig fattening business in the Philippines. Jecyl is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jecyl has been in pig fattening for two years; she also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Jennifer has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Jennifer has been in this business for five years now. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Zulfiqar

texts.en: Zulfiqar is 45 years old. He is married and lives with his family in Sialkot. He is blessed with three children. He is a farmer. He grows different types of crops in all seasons of the year, including wheat, rice, potatoes, and different types of vegetables. Timely water supply, manure, and anti-parasite sprays are important to grow better crops. Better crops mean better earnings. He therefore needs to buy manure and sprays for his crops. In order to arrange the financing, he has applied for a loan from BRAC Pakistan, a Kiva partner. He is thankful to them for their support.

loans.use: To buy manure, anti-parasite sprays, and urea for agricultural purposes

loans.name: Messes

texts.en:
Messes is 30 years old and married with six children. With four children currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Messes runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 10,000 PHP  loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like canned goods, shampoo, detergent soap, eggs, biscuits, etc., to sell. She has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Messes wants to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like canned goods, shampoo, detergent soap, eggs, biscuits, etc., to sell

loans.name: Rube

texts.en:
Rube works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Rube has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for three years now.

Rube would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more assorted clothes for resale

loans.name: Bertha Luz Marina

texts.es: A sus 55 años Bertha es madre soltera, tiene 1 hijo y 4 hijas  de los cuales 3 de sus hijas aun están con ella, vive arrendando desde hace 38 años que reside en Ecuador, ya  que es una señora de nacionalidad colombiana,  ella se dedica a la elaboración de pan, pastas, galletas y demás productos de panadería, para luego ofrecerlos en los colegios y escuelas de la ciudad donde habita, el dinero del crédito lo va a utilizar en la compra de harina y demás insumos para elaborar el pan, comenta que sus productos los elabora en un horno viejo que le presta una amiga y que así es como se gana la vida, lo que Bertha aspira es seguir trabajando para mejorar sus ventas, aumentar sus ingresos  y de ahí dar la educación a sus hijas.
texts.en: At 55 years old Bertha is a single mother. She has one son and four daughters, of whom 3 of her daughters are with her now. She has been leasing for the 38 years that she's lived in Ecuador, though she is a woman of Colombian heritage. She makes breads, pastas, cookies, and other bakery products, to later offer them at the high schools and grade schools of the city where she lives. She will use the money from the loan to buy flour and other ingredients to bake bread. She states that she makes her products in an old over that her friend loaned her, and in this way she earns her living; Bertha's goal is to continue working to improve her sales, increase her income, and hence provide an education for her daughters.

loans.use: to buy flour.

loans.name: Lowela

texts.en:
Lowela is married and lives in Misamis Occidental with her family. 

To make a living and to support her husband's income, she sells cosmetic products in their community. She has been doing this for many years and earns well from it. She has taken out a loan from GDMPC Microcredit to buy more cosmetic products to resell. 

In the future, she wants to own a business which will earn a better income for the family.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetic products to sell

loans.name: Amada

texts.en:
Amada is 60 years old and married with two children, and she works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Amada has borrowed and paid back 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns additional income from raising livestock.

She aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Angelie

texts.en:
Angelie is 26 years old and single.

She earns a living with her pig fattening business in the Philippines, and she is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She has been in pig fattening for 2 years and also earns additional income from fish vending.

Angelie is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Gladys Yolanda

texts.es:
Gladys es una señora de 31 años de edad, es ama de casa y su nivel de estudio fue hasta el 8° grado, por problemas de la economía no pudo continuar sus estudios y decidió acompañarse ahora es madre de 2 hijos de 9 y 14 años de edad, de los cuales están estudiando y son los que dependen de ella, su compañero de vida se dedica a cortar caña, mientras de Gladys se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace 4 meses, trabajo que lo aprendió de su mamá quien siempre se ha dedicado a esto, Gladys decidió dedicarse a este negocio por la necesidad y por ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar, el negocio lo tiene en su casa por lo tanto no viaja para administrarlo, su horario de trabajo es de 5:00 am a 7:00 pm. 

El préstamo de que esta solicitando en la institución, es para comprar materiales como lamina y madera, para ampliar un poco mas el corredor de su casa y así tener mas espacio para la venta de tortillas, y para que los clientes se sientan mas cómodos, con esto ella podrá obtener un poco mas de ingresos para ayudar en su hogar a su esposo y a sus hijos.

El sueño de Gladys es, ampliar mucho más su negocio de tortillas y que sus hijos estudien mucho para que sean profesionales y personas de bien para un futuro.
texts.en:
Gladys is 31 years' old and is a housewife. She attended school until 8th grade but because of economic problems she couldn't continue her studies and she decided to enter into a long-term relationship. Now she is a mother of 2 children of 9 and 14 who are studying and depend on her. Her life partner makes a living cutting sugar cane and for the last 4 months Gladys has made a living selling tortillas, a job which she learned from her mother who has always made a living doing this. Gladys decided to get into this line of work because she needed to help her husband with their household expenses. She runs her business from home so she doesn't travel to manage it. Her working hours are from 5:00 am to 7:00 pm. 

She is requesting this loan from the institution to buy materials like laminate and wood to expand the corridor of her house a little more so she has more space to sell tortillas and to make it more comfortable for her customers. By doing this she will be able to make a slightly bigger income to help her husband support their house and children. 

Gladys' dream is to expand her tortilla business much more and for her children to study a lot so they become professionals with good prospects for the future.

loans.use: to buy laminate and wood to expand the corridor of her house a little.

loans.name: Adnan Ali

texts.en:
Adnan is 22 years old and he is a young and enthusiastic entrepreneur with a milk selling business. He is a dairy farmer in Sialkot and he rears dairy cows. His major challenge is to maintain a stable supply of milk to provide to his customers. Currently he is short of animal feed and urgently needs funds to buy more feed for his dairy cows.

Adnan is a role model to many youths in his area since he is able to raise finances and improve his standard of living. A loan from Kiva will enable him to increase the milk production from his animals and to have adequate funds to sustain his animals, pay back his loan and make savings for his future.

loans.use: To buy more feed for his dairy cows.

loans.name: Sharafjon

texts.en:
Sharafjon is a young and successful boy who lives with his parents. 

He is a student on his first course at the National University of Tajikistan. He is a smart boy and dreams of being a top specialist. 

Sharafjon is borrowing 1,400 USD from IMON to pay for his university tuition because his parents don't have enough money to cover these costs.

He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for his university tuition

loans.name: Daisy

texts.es:
Daisy es una mujer de 23 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos y su negocio es la venta de utensilios desechables.
Ella es emprendedora, soñadora, alegre, sencilla, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ’16 de Julio’ que se caracteriza por el clima frío, con un promedio variable de 0º C a 15º C y masas de aire frío provenientes del norte que causan olas de frío principalmente en invierno. El viento circula a una velocidad de 7 a 77 Km. por hora.
Daisy es de tez morena, cabello largo negro, estatura mediana, su lengua materna es el aymara y utiliza el español para el comercio. Su trabajo es la venta de utensilios desechables para cocina como ser: vasos, platos, cubiertos, bandejas, etc. Labor que realiza desde hace cuatro años de lunes a domingo. Ella desea incrementar su mercadería para tener una mayor oferta y mejorar sus ingresos económicos realizando la compra por mayor de envases plásticos.
Es por esos motivos que Daisy solicita un préstamo para la compra de utensilios desechables y con los beneficios mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Daisy is a 23-year-old woman. She is single and has no children. She works selling disposable utensils.

Daisy is a dreamer. She is also an entrepreneurial, joyful, simple, responsible and hardworking woman. She works in an area called “16 de julio”, which has cold weather, usually between 0 ºC and 15 ºC [32 ºF and 59 ºF]. The wind blows from the north and brings cold waves, especially during the winter. The wind speed ranges from 7 to 77 km/h [4 to 48 mph].

Daisy has dark skin, long and black loose hair and is of medium height. Her mother tongue is Aymara, but she uses Spanish at work. She sells disposable kitchen utensils, such as cups, plates, cutlery and trays. She has been doing this for four years, Monday to Sunday.

Daisy wants to increase her stock in order to have more to offer and increase her income. She wants to buy disposable utensils in bulk, so she is requesting a loan. With the profits, her living conditions will improve.

loans.use: to buy disposable utensils and improve her living conditions.

loans.name: Sarba Mangala Shg Group

texts.en:
Kusumprabha is pictured above. She is the lady standing with her hand raised. She has united the women in her village to form Sarba Mangala Self Help Group so they can work along side each other to grow their businesses and contribute to the welfare of their family and their village. 

For work, Kusumprabha owns a tent house, a staple shop in her community that provides colorful coverings for weddings, engagements, and other festivities. A talented seamstress, Kusumprabha makes and mends all of the tents herself from cloth. With her portion of the group loan, she will buy some new colors and replace some of her cloths that have worn out. In addition, she rents out other necessities for festivals and would like to use her loan to buy an updated sound system for her customers so that she can rent it out at a higher price. She hopes to use the earnings from her tent house to continue to send her children to good schools, which get more expensive as they grow older. The other women in her group are mostly in dairy farming and own other small shops in the village.

loans.use: to buy an updated sound system to rent and more cloth to make tents to rent

loans.name: Dhana Manga Shg Group

texts.en:
Parbati, a citizen from a rural village located in the Koraput district, is 26 years old and lives with her husband and her two children. For the last four years, she has been engaged in farming a paddy and selling vegetables. Her husband supplements their income by working as a laborer. With the current business, she can earn about 5,000 INR per month, and that is a very low amount to cover her monthly expenses. 

Parbati, along with nine other women from her village, formed a group and she was elected as group president. She and her group members have requested a loan of 100,000 INR. She will use her portion to purchase fertilizers, pesticides, and seeds and to pay for a work force. She hopes to earn more income after getting the loan so she can improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizers, pesticides, and seeds and to pay labor fees.

loans.name: Ever Benjamín

texts.es:
Ever es un joven de 23 años de edad, estudió técnico en computación, por el momento es soltero y no tiene hijos, él vive con su padre y tres hermanos, su madre ya falleció y ninguna persona depende de él.

Ever trabaja como facilitador o docente de clases de computación en un curso que está siendo impartido por parte de la alcaldía de la comunidad, otra fuente de ingresos es la siembra de granos básicos, anteriormente trabajaba en un restaurante de comida china. El lugar donde trabaja actualmente está a 2 km y medios de su casa y se transporta a pie y los horarios de trabajo son variables porque a veces trabaja en la tarde y otros días por la mañana.



El crédito lo necesita para comprar una vaca lechera, ya que a veces se pierde el rastrojo de los cultivos que prepara su padre pero al tener la vaca le servirá de alimento para la misma.

Sus sueños son impartir clases en educación básica o media, para ello tiene que pasar a ser empleado por parte del gobierno, también sueña con tener un cyber para brindar un buen servicio a la comunidad educativa.
texts.en:
Ever is a 23 year old man. He studied computer science and at this time is single and has no children. He lives with his father and three brothers. His mother passed away, and he has no dependents. 

Ever works as a facilitator or instructor for computer classes in a course given by the community's town hall. Another source of income is growing basic grains. Previously, he worked in a Chinese restaurant. The place where he works now is 2 km and a half from his house and he gets there on foot. His work schedule is variable and sometimes he works in the afternoon and other times in the morning. 

He needs the loan to buy a dairy cow, since sometimes his father's crop stubble goes to waste, buy with a cow it can used for feed.  

His dream is to teach classes at the elementary or middle school level. To do that he has to become a government employee. He also dreams of having a cyber cafe to offer a good service to the education community.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow, because sometimes his father's crop stubble goes to waste, but it will serve as feed for the cow.

loans.name: Radilla

texts.en: Radilla, 35 years old, is from Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City, Philippines. Radilla has three children.  She owns and operates a small retail store at home to support their daily needs. For years, she has been able to manage the store smoothly and earns well with this. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for the business and saved for their future needs. Recently, she took a new loan to buy additional grocery goods to sell.  With the probable revenue to be gained, Radilla hopes to sustain their livelihood and sell more products to increase the regular income she receives.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods  to sell

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Madai Gardenia

texts.es: La señora Gardenia es soltera, no tiene dependientes económicos, vive en la casa de su madre y la ayuda en la crianza de su ganado vacuno lechero cortando forrajes, ella es muy trabajadora, se dedica a la actividad agrícola y cultiva en los terrenos de su padre en Punata, actualmente solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas, de esa manera podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y retomar sus estudios para seguir superándose en la vida.
texts.en:
Gardenia is single and does not have to sustain anyone. She lives with her mother and helps her to raise dairy cows by collecting the hay. She is a hardworking woman who works in agriculture, growing different crops in a piece of land that belongs to her father, located in Punata.

Gardenia is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies. This will help her to improve her living conditions and retake her studies in order to get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en:
Edelyn is 29 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Edelyn is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

Edelyn has been in pig fattening for one year and earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: New Saikul Women Shg Society Group

texts.en: Nemneilhing is the featured member of the group pictured with her hand raised. She lives with her two sons and two daughters who are still dependent on their mother. The eldest son, being a spiritual person, goes to Theology College while the other three are in college and are still striving in their ambition to become professionals. All of them are supported by her from the meager income she generates from her petty businesses. From the earlier loans she availed from Kiva, she started a business making local dishwashing and detergent powder to sell. She was making a small profit through that business that hardly sustained her family. So she bought cattle (goat) for rearing from the loan she availed from Kiva in the next cycle, hoping that she would earn more from it. She has been making the maximum use of the loans she avails from Kiva. With the help of Kiva, she has been supporting her children in their education within her capability, she said. At present, the loan she is taking will be used for buying inventory of women’s wear to sell. Women’s wear nowadays sells very quickly and is the best choice of doing business. Every mother desires their children to become someone reliable in their old age. She believes that her hard work will become fruitful one day and she has faith in her children that they will achieve and satisfy her desire in the near future. Last but not the least, she expressed her gratitude to WSDS and Kiva for being involved in their lives.

loans.use: To buy inventory (women's wear) to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy galvanized sheeting, rods and nails to change the roof on her house.

loans.name: Melba Elizabeth

texts.es: Melba de 25 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijas de 2 y 8 años de edad. Ella es una mujer tenaz que cada día sale a vender diversidad de verduras  tales como: pipianes, ayote, güisquiles, etc. Dicha actividad la realiza de manera ambulante en el mercado municipal. En la vivienda de Melba hace falta encementar el piso y cambiar el techo de la vivienda ya que este se encuentra deteriorado por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, grava, lamina galvanizada, y madera, además necesitara cancelar mano de obra necesaria para encementar el piso de su vivienda y cambiar el techo de la misma.
texts.en:
Melba, 25, lives with her life partner and two daughters aged 2 and 8 in a house of their own. She is a tenacious woman who works everyday selling different types of vegetables, such as ayote, pipian and güisquil [different types of squash]. She works as a street vendor and at the local marketplace.

Melba needs to improve the floor and change the roof of her house, which is in bad conditions. She is requesting a loan at FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, galvanized metal sheets and wood, and to pay for the labor needed to put down a cement floor in her house and change the roof.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, galvanized metal sheets and wood, and pay for the labor needed to fix the floor and the roof.

loans.name: Herminigilda

texts.en:
Herminigilda is thankful for the previous loan granted to her, as she was able to buy gardening materials and supplies needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a 30,000 PHP loan. She will be using the loan to buy gardening materials like wire, baskets and supplies such as seeds and fertilizer needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Herminigilda hopes to grow her ornamental business to sustain the needs of her family. She dreams that her child will finish her studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and garden inputs

loans.name: Paola Gabriela

texts.es: Paola es casada y tiene un hijo de 3 años, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde que su hijo era recién nacido ya que vio la necesidad de tener algún ingreso para poder darle lo indispensable a sus niño, ella hace su venta por catalogo, por pedidos y ofreciendo a sus clientes, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de mercadería en ropa para mejorar su negocio, la aspiración de Paola es aumentar su negocio y de ahí tener algo de ahorro para la educación de su hijo ya que en este año ingrese a la escuela.
texts.en:
Paola is married and has a 3-year-old son. She has been selling clothes since her son was a newborn. She found it necessary to have an income in order to give her son what he needed. She offers her products using a catalogue, from which her customers can place orders.

Paola will use this loan to buy clothes and improve her business. Her goal is to expand her business and be able to save some money to pay for her son’s education; he will soon start school.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es: Nicolasa de 41 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 3 hijas de 16, 13 y 6 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida, gracias a la venta de verduras como: güisquiles, tomates, pipianes, ayote, etc. La actividad antes mencionada la realiza en el mercado municipal desde hace 12 años, por lo que es bastante buscada por los clientes al igual que sus productos. Nicolasa desea cambiar las puertas y el techo de su vivienda, ya que se encuentran bastante deterioradas, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina galvanizada, madera, puertas, y pagará mano de obra para cambiar el techo y las puertas de su vivienda lo antes posible.
texts.en: Nicolasa is 41 years old. She lives in her own house with her life's companion and their 3 daughters, aged 16, 13 and 6. She is an enterprising woman who earns her living selling vegetables such as guizquil squash, tomatoes, pipian squash, ayote squash, etc. She has done this activity in the town market for 12 years. She is much sought after by customers and so are her products. Nicolasa wants to change the doors and the roof of her house because they haver deteriorated. That is why she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to buy galvanized sheeting, wood, and doors, as well as to pay for labor to put on the new roof and the doors as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheeting, wood, and doors, as well as to pay for labor to put on a new the roof and doors for her house.

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.en:
Lucrecia is a married woman with 11 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lucrecia is 47 years old and six of her children are currently in school.

Lucrecia has a buy and sell of scrap materials business in the Philippines. Lucrecia requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more scrap materials for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Lucrecia has been in this business for three years. In the future, Lucrecia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more scrap materials for her business

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 26 years old and married to Everlyne who adds additional income to the family. They still do not have any children. Joseph runs a tailoring business that has been in operation for two years, earning an income of 18,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). 

He is now servicing his first loan of 20,000 KES from Vision fund Kenya and intends to use the entire loan amount to buy more stock of the latest clothing fabric for dressmaking.

The profit he earns will be used to help the vulnerable people living within the community. He hopes for growth in his business

loans.use: to buy more stock of the latest fabric for dressmaking

loans.name: Aida's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois a été mise en place le 05 Février 2014 jour de  son inauguration. Il est composé de  femmes qui voulu intégrer le programme de bancs villageois afin de bénéficier d’un appui financier pour développer leurs activités. Elles vivent toutes dans le même village depuis plusieurs années et entretiennent des relations de solidarité et d’entre aide mutuel. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce et la culture saisonnière sous pluie.

Madame Aida (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle gère une boutique dans son village où elle vend des denrées de première à savoir : du riz, de l’huile, du sucre et divers produits de consommation savon et détergents. Elle s’approvisionne au marché hebdomadaire. Elle pratique aussi la culture d’arachide pendant l’hivernage.
 
Avec son nouveau prêt, elle va acheter un carton de divers condiments et bouillons, un sac de sucre, un bidon et des paquets de bougie.

Les bénéfices lui permettent d’assurer un appui à son mari dans la prise en charge des besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
This banc villageois was inaugurated on 5th February 2014. It is made up of women who wished to join the banc villageois program in order to benefit from financial support to develop their businesses. They have all lived in the same village for many years and are joined through the bonds of solidarity and mutual aid. Their main businesses involve small-scale retail and seasonal rain-fed agriculture.

Aida (the woman standing to the far right with her hand raised) is the group's star borrower. She runs a stall in the village where she sells everyday items such as rice, oil and sugar, as well as various consumer goods like soap and detergent. She gets her supplies from the weekly market. She also grows peanuts during the winter period. 

With this new loan, she plans on purchasing one box of various condiments and stocks, one sack of sugar, one container and some packs of candles.
 
The profits from this will allow her to support her husband in meeting their family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase one box of various condiments and stocks, one sack of sugar, one container and some packs of candles

loans.name: San Martin Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SAN MARTIN” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rosario es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de salchipapa, tienda de barrio, venta de fruta, servicio de construcción, tejido de mantas, venta de material de limpieza, venta de medicamento natural, costura de chamarras, venta de CD’s.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rosario es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un familiar que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  venta de medicamento natural; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió con el primer crédito obtenido en Pro Mujer, pues el manejo de los productos los adquirió de su pareja que trabaja con estos productos. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de medicamento natural por mayor) que adquirirá de Perú y posteriormente lo comercializará a pedido de las clientes en la ferias de la Ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito y las capacitaciones que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The San Martin Communal Association will begin its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Cascada center . The San Martin group is made up of eight members and is headed by a governing committee, of which señora Rosario is the president. The businesses of the members of the communal association are varied and include the sale of food, sale of salchipapa (a kind of local kabab), a small general store, sale of fruit, construction services, weaving of shawls, sales of cleaning products, sale of natural medicines, manufacture of jackets and sales of CDs. 

The loan they are taking out will benefit these small entrepreneurs, one of whom is señora Rosaria. She says that she joined Pro Mujer five years ago, at the invitation of of a relative who was a client of the institution. At present, señora Rosario  has a business in the sale of natural remedies.  She began this business with the first loan that she obtained through Pro Mujer. She received her knowledge of the products from her partner, who worked with natural remedies.

The loan that she will obtain this time is for an increase in capital (for the purchase of natural medicines from Perú on a wholesale level).  Later, she will sell these products to her clients in the markets of El Alto (La Paz). This kind of work enables her to generate resources to assist her family, since she now is in a relationship with a man and has a child. When she was asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, she replied that she was pleased with the loan and with the training that the insttitucion offers her.

loans.use: to purchase natural medicines at wholesale cost

loans.name: Diminga's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois a été mise en place le 05 Février 2014 jour de  son inauguration. Il est composé de  femmes qui voulu intégrer le programme de bancs villageois afin de bénéficier d’un appui financier pour développer leurs activités. Elles vivent toutes dans le même village depuis plusieurs années et entretiennent des relations de solidarité et d’entre aide mutuel. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce et la culture saisonnière sous pluie.

Madame Diminga, (debout à l’extrême droite avec la main gauche), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de sept enfants dont  trois garçons et quatre filles. Elle s’active dans l’élevage et la vente de porc. Elle achète de jeune porc les engraissent pour la revente dans un pays frontalier. Elle à une bonne maîtrise de cette activité pour l’avoir pratiqué pendant des années.  

Avec son  nouveau prêt, elle va renforcer le nombre de porcs par l’achat de 03 jeunes porcs pour engraissement puis vente.

Les bénéfices me permettent de renforcer son épargner pour obtenir durant les prochains cycles de prêts plus importants.
texts.en:
This banc villageois was inaugurated on 5th February 2014. It is made up of women who wished to join the banc villageois program in order to benefit from financial support to develop their businesses. They have all lived in the same village for many years and are joined through the bonds of solidarity and mutual aid. Their main businesses involve small-scale retail and seasonal rain-fed agriculture.

Diminga (the woman standing to the far right with her hand raised) is the group's star borrower. She is a married mother to seven children; three boys and four girls. She earns a living through raising pigs. She buys her pigs from a bordering country. She is very experienced in this field as she has practised it for a great many years.

With this new loan, she plans on increasing the number of pigs she owns by purchasing three young pigs, which will then be fattened and resold.

The profits from this will allow her to grow her savings so that she can apply for larger loans during the next loan cycle.

loans.use: to increase the number of pigs they own by purchasing three young pigs, which will then be fattened and resold

loans.name: Jose Tomas

texts.es: .José de 45 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposa y sus 2 hijos de 16 y 18 años de edad. Él es un hombre que todos los días sale a ganarse el sustento de su familia gracias a su trabajo, además su esposa le aporta para el gasto económico familiar gracias a su pequeña venta de productos de primera necesidad. José desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda y arreglar un cerco perimetral de la misma. Por lo anterior José solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: alambre de púas, postes de cemento, lamina galvanizada, polines y pagar mano de obra necesaria para cambiar el cerco perimetral y el techo de su vivienda
texts.en: José is 45 years old and lives in a house that he owns with his wife and two children, who are 18 and 16 years old. José goes out every day in order to earn a living to support his family. His wife also supports the family economy thanks to her small business selling staple foods.  José needs to replace the roof of his home and repair the perimeter fence. In order to carry out this work, José is applying for a loan from FUSAI to buy wire, cement posts, metal sheets, and purlins, and to pay labourers.

loans.use: to buy wire, cement posts, metal sheets, and purlins, and to pay labourers to repair the perimeter fence and replace the roof of his home.

loans.name: G.s. El Aguacatal Lll Group

texts.es: Doña María, tiene 64 años de edad, es soltera por viudez, tiene 3 hijos, vive con su nuera y dos nietos, en una aldea del municipio de Victoria, Yoro.  Ella fue maestra de educación por unos años, luego se dedico a la agricultura con la producción de café.  Este cultivo lo tiene en un  terreno aparte en una zona apta para café.  Ofrece el café en grano en el mercado local.  El préstamo que solicita es por 6,000 lempiras y es en forma grupal, el cual invertirá en la compra de abonos para fertilizar la finca y pago de jornaleros para limpieza y mantenimiento de la misma. Su plan es mejorar la producción y darle mejor calidad de vida a su familia. El grupo a que pertenece se llama El Aguacatal III, integrado por 4 personas, que se dedican  a la agricultura de café y residen en la misma comunidad. El préstamo total es por 22,000 lempiras y lo invertirán en la fertilización de la finca. En la foto esta a la izquierda María Alba, María Serapia, Alma y José a la derecha.
texts.en:
María is 64 years old and a widow. She has three children and lives with her daughter-in-law and two grandchildren in a small village in Victoria municipality. María was a schoolteacher for a number of years and then went to make a living growing coffee. She grows her crops on a plot of land separate to her house, in an area that is good for growing coffee. María sells the coffee grains at the local market. María is applying for a loan of 6000 Lempira as part of a group loan. María will use her loan to buy manure and fertilise her coffee farm, and to pay for labourers to clean and look after the farm.

María's group is called "El Aguacatal III" and has four members who live in the same community and make a living growing coffee. The total group loan is for 22'000 Lempira and it will be invested in fertilising farms. 

In the photograph, from left to right, are María Alba, María Serpaia, Alma and José.

loans.use: to buy manure and to pay labourers to fertilise a coffee farm.

loans.name: Santos Ernesto

texts.es: Santos de 37 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposa y sus 2 hijos de 16 y 14 años de edad. Él es un hombre trabajador que desde hace 20 años se esfuerza por llevar el sustento a su familia, su esposa le apoya en la economía familiar, por medio de una venta de productos de primera necesidad. Santos desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda, ya que este se encuentra en mal estado. Por lo anterior Santos solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
37-year-old Santos lives in his own house with his wife and two children who are 14 and 16 years old.  He is a hard-working man who for 20 years has made an effort to provide for his family.  His wife helps with the family finances by selling basic need items.  

Santos wants to change the roof on his house because it is in poor condition.  For this, Santos asks for a loan from FUSAI in order to buy sheet metal, wood, and nails to change the roof on his house.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal, wood, and nails in order to change the roof on his house.

loans.name: Shiella

texts.en:
Shiella is 35 years old and single.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Shiella is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

Shiella has been raising pigs for 5 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida has previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she utilized to buy gardening materials and supplies needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.She also has other source of income from the taxi that she owns.

She would like to apply for a 25,000 PHP loan, now. She will utilize the loan to buy gardening materials like wire and basket and supplies such as seeds and fertilizer needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her sustain their daily needs. She is thankful and was encouraged to improve her business this year. 

Zenaida hopes to own another taxi to grow her business and dreams of a prosperous life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for  fertilizer and other farm supplies needed in growing pineapples and bananas.

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is 38 years old, married, with four children.  She works hard to provide for her family. Maribeth runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF, to buy additional stocks like canned goods, snack foods, detergent soap, cooking oil, noodles, etc. for sale at her general store.

Maribeth has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this one. She has been managing the general store for 3 years, and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Maribeth aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like canned goods, snack foods, detergent, soap, cooking oil, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Pedro Gerardo

texts.es: 71 años de edad tiene este señor que se caracteriza por ser muy trabajador, son 11 años que Pedro se dedica al comercio de objetos reciclables, o como él le llama la chatarra, Pedro es viudo y tiene 11 hijos de los cuales solo una que tiene 16 años aun lo acompaña y asiste al colegio, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chatarra para luego revenderla y así obtener los ingresos para cubrir los gastos de educación de su hija, lo que Pedro aspira es ver a su hija terminado sus estudios.
texts.en:
This 71-year-old gentleman is a very hard worker. For 11 years Pedro has been selling recyclable objects, or as he calls it - junk. Pedro is a widower and has 11 children. Only one of them, who is 16 years old, still lives with him and attends school.

He will invest the loan in the purchase of recyclable materials which he will later sell, thus earning the income he needs to cover his daughter's education. Pedro aspires to see his daughter finish her studies.

loans.use: to buy junk

loans.name: Canesius

texts.en:
Conesius is 28 years old, married with a 2 year old child. He has been farming for 5 years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizer for rice production. The profit from the business will be used to build a store of production.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer for rice production.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: Rosemarie is a responsible housewife, who supports her husband in their farming business. She is 44 years old and blessed with three children. Due to financial hardship, they aimed to expand their pineapple and vegetable plantation to have a high production. Having insufficient capital, she would like to avail herself of a loan of PHP10,000.00, to buy fertilizer and herbicides needed in her crop production. Through their patience and hard work, they hope that they will have a plentiful harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides for her crop production

location.town: Brgy. Mantanibong, Baretbet, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcay

loans.name: Charmie

texts.en: Charmie has been helping her husband operating their own repair shop while she runs her retail store. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for the business, the business is doing well to sustain their needs. Recently, she took a new loan to purchase more grocery goods to sell in order to offer more to her costumers.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es: El señor Rodolfo tiene 57 años de edad, de estado civil divorciado, alcanzo a estudiar la primaria, no cuenta con dependientes económicos a cargo y actualmente vive en el domicilio de su cuñado en calidad de cuidador en la ciudad de Cochabamba. La actividad económica del señor es prestar servicios de transporte urbano(taxi) con su propio vehículo, cuenta con experiencia de más de 30 años en el rubro. Manifiesta ser trabajador y responsable, ahora solicita un crédito para la reparación y mantenimiento de su vehículo que es su herramienta de trabajo, esto le permitirá ofrecer un mejor servicio y generar mayores ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rodolfo, 57, is divorced and has a primary education.  He has no dependents and currently lives at his brother-in-law's residence and works as a care-giver in the city of Cochabamba.  He earns a living as a taxi driver and uses his own vehicle.  For over 30 years he has been working in this business sector.  

Rodolfo claims to be a hard-working, responsible person.  He is requesting a loan for repair and maintenance of his vehicle which is his work tool.  This will allow him to offer better service in order to generate more income to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: To pay for repair and maintenance of his vehicle.

loans.name: Lesisterly Giomar

texts.es:
