Lesisterly Giomar tiene 19 años de edad, vive en casa familiar, vive con su mamá y su hermana no cuenta con ningun hijo en su poder, Lesisterly Giomar vive en la parte rural del distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú; contando con servicios de agua y luz.

La actividad que realiza Lesisterly Giomar es el servicio de transporte de pasajeros por mototaxi, cuenta con 2 años de experiencia en el rubro, la actividad lo realiza en el distrito de Pucará y caserios aledaños, además Lesisterly Giomar se dedica a realizar trabajos como grabaciones, bajar musica para celulares, ayudante de sonido, ingresos adicionales que permiten solventar la deuda sin ningún inconveniente. El destino del crédito será para invertir en hacer arreglos a su unidad móvil, con ello asegurará el funcionamiento de su herramienta de trabajo y asi podrá seguir generando ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Lesisterly Giomar is 19 years old and lives in his family's home with his mom and sister. He does not have any children. Lesisterly Giomar lives in the rural area of the Pucará district in the Jaén province, in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountain range of Perú. He has water and light services.

The job that Lesisterly Giomar does is the service of transporting passengers by motorcycle taxi. He has two years of experience in this field.  He works in the district of Pucará and the adjacent hamlets.  Also, Lesisterly Giomar makes a living doing work like recording, downloading music for cellphones, and being a sound assistant; additional income that allows him to settle his debt without any problems.  

The purpose of the loan is to invest in making repairs to his motorcycle taxi.  With it, he can assure the function of his work tool and thus be able to continue generating income and improve the quality of his life.

loans.use: to make repairs to his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 64 años de edad, es casado, sin hijos, vive con su familia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Carlos se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, con más de 8 años de experiencia en el negocio, negocio que está ubicado en su mismo domicilio, él solicita préstamo para compra de más animales, dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor variedad y productividad en animales, con gran influencia en el negocio; Carlos piensa incrementar su stock de animales para poder atender las diversas gustos y necesidades de los clientes de la zona, lo que le permitirá aumentar sus ventas ya que podrá captar a un número mayor de clientes, mejorando sus ganancias, y por ende su calidad de vida y la de su esposa.
texts.en:
Carlos is 64 years old, married, and has no children.  He lives with his family in a rural zone of Oyotún, in Chiclayo Province in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

Carlos has been raising and selling animals for more than eight years, and his business is located at his house. He is asking for a loan so he can buy more animals to have more variety and increase productivity, which will greatly impact on his business. He wants to increase his stock of animals so he can cater to the diverse tastes and needs of his customers in the area. This will allow him to increase his sales and gain new customers, improving his earnings and consequently his quality of life and that of his wife.

loans.use: to buy animals to increase and diversify his stock.

loans.name: Jose Rosalio

texts.es: Jose, tiene 50 años de edad, es casado, tiene 5 hijos y vive en una aldea del municipio de Jesús de Otoro, Comayagua. El se dedica a la agricultura desde hace mas de 10 años, donde produce y vende café. Esta producción la vende en el mercado local. Esta solicitando otro préstamo que es por 12,000 lempiras, con el cual va continuar con el mantenimiento a su finca de café, comprara fertilizantes y abonos para poder sacar mejor producción. Su plan de mantener en buen estado su finca es para poder ayudar a sus hijos con las necesidades básicas.
texts.en: Jose, 50, is married and has five children.  He lives in a village in the Jesús de Otoro municipality in Comayagua.  For over ten years he has worked in agriculture, producing and selling coffee.  He sells the coffee at the local market.  The loan he is requesting, in the amount of 12,000 HNL, is to provide maintenance for his coffee farm.  He will buy fertilizers and manure in order to obtain a better crop.  His plan is to keep up the farm so he can help his children with the basic necessities.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and manure for his coffee farm.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Vilma works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock. Vilma is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like pork, chicken, hotdogs, seasonings, etc. for her food vending business.

Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like pork, chicken, hotdogs, seasonings, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Selaphine

texts.en:
Selaphine, aged 41 years, is married with 2 children aged between 10 and 12, and both of them go to school. She has been farming for 5 years.  With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizers to use in rice production. The profits from the business will be used to buy more land to expand her business.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer to use in rice production.

loans.name: Eliana Elizabeth

texts.es: Eliana es una jovencita muy responsable, hace 3 años  salió del colegio y por falta de recursos económicos de su madre no ha podido ingresar a la universidad, ella vive con su madre y con sus 3 hermanas que están estudiando, comenta que una amiga le conto que la venta de productos OMNILIFE es buen negocio y es así que hace un año empezó ofreciendo estos productos a sus amigas y a otras personas, el dinero del crédito lo necesita para comprar productos OMNILIFE y mejorar sus ventas, Eliana aspira mejorar su negocio y de ser posible ahorrar dinero  para cubrir los gastos que implica ingresar a la universidad.
texts.en: Eliana is a very responsible young woman. With her mother unable to pay for it, Eliana left school three years ago and has not been able to be admitted to university. Eliana lives with her mother, and three sisters who are studying. Eliana says that a friend of hers told her that selling Omnilife products is a good business. Eliana therefore started selling these goods to her friends and other people. She needs this loan in order to buy Omnilife goods and increase sales. Eliana hopes to improve her business and, if possible, save money to cover the costs of studying at university.

loans.use: to buy Omnilife products.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es: La señora Maria es una persona muy trabajadora, de estado civil soltera, vive en la Ciudad de Tarija. Tiene una hija pequeña quien depende de su apoyo económico. La señora solicita un crédito con el fin de poder ampliar su negocio de video juegos en red, para poder obtener mejores ingresos a futuro y de esa forma brindar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia; ya que a mediano plazo quiere vivir de manera independiente, porque actualmente vive en la casa de sus padres.
texts.en: María is very hard-working. She is single and lives in the city of Tarija. María has a young daughter who depends on her mother financially. María is applying for a loan in order to be able to expand her business selling online video games and earn a higher income in the future. By doing this, María can offer her family better living conditions. In the medium-term, María would like to live independently as she currently lives with her parents.

loans.use: to expand her video game business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita has faithfully paid back her previous loan, which she used for her business. She has been in the coconut selling business for eight years. Having a big family requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her children. The couple has to work hard with the determination to have better income to provide their children with better education, which they don't currently have. 

To improve sales, Teresita would like to apply for another loan in the amount of 19,000 PHP to buy more coconuts to increase her sales and earnings. She is encouraged and thankful for the good turnout of her business.

Teresita hopes to grow her business so she could give her children a good and quality education and help others in need.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more coconuts needed in her business.

loans.name: Anival

texts.es:
Anival tiene 42 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico de dos niveles, vive con su conyuge, no cuentan con ningun hijo en su poder, viven en la parte rural del distrito de San Felipe contando con servicios de agua y luz; este distrito queda en la provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Anival es realizar trabajos de carpinteria metalica como puertas de metal, escaleras, ventanas entre otros, Anival cuenta con 7 años de experiencia en el rubro, los trabajos los realiza en su mismo caserio y caserios aledaños. El destino del crédito será para invertir en compra de materia prima como fierro, angulos entre otros, para poder cumplir con todos sus pedidos pendientes, con ello le generará mayores ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su esposa.
texts.en:
Anival is 42 years old. He lives in his own home, which is made of rustic materials and has two levels. He lives with his partner and does not have any children in his care. He lives in the rural part of the district of San Felipe with water and power utilities. This district is in the province of Jaén in the Cajamarca region in the mountains in the north of Perú.

Anival's business involves metal carpentry work like metal doors, stairs, windows, and other things. Anival has 7 years of experience in this area. He does work in his village and in neighboring villages. He will use the loan to invest in primary materials like metal, braces, and other things so that he can fulfill pending orders. This will allow him to earn more money so that he can improve his and his wife's quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of primary materials like metal, braces, and other things to fulfill pending orders.

loans.name: Maa Durga Shg Group

texts.en:
The responsible Maa Durga Self Help Group is made up of ten members. All the members of Maa Durga Self Help Group are women from the district of Koraput in Odisha, India. One of them is Mania, who was selected as their president. 

Mania, the lady standing with her raised hand in the photo, is 30 years old and lives with her children. She is engaged in the activity of selling goats and cow’s milk in her village and the nearby market. She purchases goat kids and rears them, and when they grow up, she sells them to the butcher. 

Mania, along with her group, has requested a loan of 130,000 INR. She will use her portion to purchase more goat kids and a cow for getting a greater amount of milk to earn more profit. She has a very good relationship with her customers because she completes their orders on time. She and all the group members want to give a better standard of living to their families and also want to save some money for their future.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing goat kids and a cow.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is 49 years old and widowed. He is a farmer who lives in a rural community with his four children. Despite the  hardship of living, he has the determination to uplift the living status of his family. 

He aims to expand his rice plantation to ensure a high production. Having inadequate capital, he would like to avail a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizers and herbicides needed for his rice farming business. Through this financial assistance he believes that he will be having a plentiful harvest this coming harvest season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides needed for his rice farming business.

location.town: Brgy. Mantanibong, Baretbet, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcay

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is 51 years old. He is a single parent of five children. He has a consulting business firm and runs a Zoona mobile money business in Lusaka, Zambia.

Edward provides the service of receiving and sending money to people throughout the country.  He says the community benefits from his business because his shop is located at a bus stop so customers can easily transact their business with him.

The business helps him to provide for his children and pay bills. He also explains that he enjoys the business because he has the chance to interact with different people every day.

He is requesting a Kiva loan so that he can boost his business of mobile money transfers. He says the loan will help him to serve more customers and earn more profits, this will assure that he stays capable of providing for his family and customers.

loans.use: To boost his business for mobile money transfers.

loans.name: Florecita

texts.en:
Florecita works hard to support her family. 

Florecita is married and has a buy-and-sell dried coconut meat business in the Philippines. Florecita has been in this business for 10 years now. 

Florecita requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell.

Florecita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell.

loans.name: Mahmadibrohim

texts.en:
Mahmadibrohim is a young and smart man. He was born in 1996. Mahmadibrohim is not married and lives with his parents. He is a first course student at the Medical University of Tajikistan. 

Mahmadibrohim always wanted to be a doctor. He tries to study well and graduate university with excellent marks. Mahmadibrohim often goes to the library. He reads a lot of books. 

He is borrowing from IMON because he must pay for his tuition. He is asking for a loan of 1,000 USD to pay for university tuition. He awaits your mercy and generosity.

loans.use: To pay for tuition.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is married with three children. He earns a living from his transportation services. For many years, Nelson has earned well and sustained their living. He also bought some home improvements, like appliances. 

To maintain better safety and service, he borrowed a loan from GDMPC Micro Credit to purchase spare parts and tires. He hopes to generate additional income for the purpose of renovating the house and seeing his children's success.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tires

loans.name: Hernan

texts.en:
Hernan has been providing transportation services in his community for over seven years, earning well to sustain his living. He successfully repaid his previous loan used for vehicle repair and buying tires, and the business is still doing well. Currently, he borrowed a new loan to cover his license renewal.

In the future, he wants to sustain his transportation business, and he wants to save his profit to use when he gets old.

loans.use: to cover his license renewal

loans.name: Teolinda

texts.es:
Teolinda es soltera, reside en una comunidad rural donde su población es tranquila y se dedican a la ganadería, comercio y crianza de ganado menor, dicha comunidad esta ubicada en la provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad a la que se dedica Teolinda es a la venta de cerveza y venta de salchipollo desde hace más de 2 años de experiencia. Teolinda realiza sus ventas en la casa de su hija ya que su casa se encuentra ubicada en una zona donde hay mucha competencia, siendo la casa de su hija un lugar estratégico para realizar sus ventas. el destino del crédito será para mejora de su vivienda, pues ella desea construccir una pieza para su dormitorio, psra poder tener un tener un lugar más comodo y seguro donde descanzar, mejorando de esta forma su caldiad de vida.
texts.en:
Teolinda is single and lives in a quiet rural community where the population is engaged in cattle, trade, and small livestock. The community is located in the province of Morropón in the region of Piura on the northern coast of Peru. 
Teolinda has made her living for the past two years selling beer and salchipollo [a snack made with hotdog franks, french fries, and chicken topped with condiments]. Since there is a lot of competition in her own neighborhood, Teolinda conducts her business from her daughter’s house, as it has a strategic location. 
The purpose of the loan will be to make improvements to her home; she wants to construct a piece of furniture for her bedroom so that she can have a more comfortable and safe place to rest, which will improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to make improvements to her home; she wants to construct a piece of furniture for her bedroom.

loans.name: Eutiquia

texts.en:
Eutiquia is 64 years old, married, and has five children. Eutiquia works very hard to provide for them.

Eutiquia runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, bread, sanitary pads, canned goods, shampoo, etc.  

Eutiquia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Eutiquia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Pelagie

texts.en:
Pelagie is 51 years old. She is married with eight children aged between 4 and 27, and all of them go to school. She has been farming for 23 years. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizers for rice production. The profit from the business will be used to pay workers and to pay the school fees of her children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under-served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for rice production.

loans.name: Abdulaziz

texts.ru: Абдулазиз добрый человек. Он родился в 1994 году. Абдулазиз живет со своими родителями на северной части Таджикистана. Он года назад приехал в столицу, чтобы поступить в Национальный Университет Таджикистана. Он поступил успешно и вот уже третий год как он учится там. Во время каникулы он приезжает домой, в свой кишлак и помогает своим родителям откармливать скот и выращивать картошку. Абдулазиз должен оплатить за учебный договор 3 курса и поэтому он запрашивает займ на сумму 1300 долларов США. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Abdulaziz is a kind person and was born in 1994. He lives with his parents in the northern part of Tajikistan. A couple of years ago he moved to the capital to go to the National University of Tajikistan. He did well and is already in his third year there. He comes home to his village for vacation and helps his parents feed the cattle and grow potatoes. Abdulaziz needs to pay for his third year tuition and has applied for a loan of $1300 USD. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for his tuition

loans.name: Gedion

texts.en:
Gedion is a 37-year-old married man. He settled down to earn his living in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines, together with his children. 

Over the past five years, Gedion has been able to run his retail store to meet the primary demands of the market. The business is doing well and is giving enough cash inflow to cover the family's day-to-day expenditures.

Recently, he took a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell in order to increase sales. With the acquisition of in-demand basic commodities, Gedion expects an increase sales so as to expand his business and improve the general living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Hidelercita

texts.es:
Hidelercita es una persona muy luchadora, tiene 38 años de edad, es soltera y vive en San Martin junto a su familia. Es madre de familia de un joven adolescente, por él siempre se ha esforzado en todo para poder sacarlo adelante y brindarle una educación de calidad. Desde hace más de 1 año trabaja en un Servicio de transporte de Carga y le va muy bien porque es muy responsable, trabajadora y con muchos deseos de superación.
Hidelercita quiere reparar el techo de su vivienda, es por ello que está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá realizar estas reparaciones que tanto necesita su casa para que su familia pueda vivir con mayor seguridad y comodidad, así seguirá esforzándose día a día para más adelante poder ver a su hijo convertido en un gran profesional.
texts.en:
Hidelercita is a very determined person. She is 38 years old, is single, and lives in San Martin with her family. She is the mother of a young adolescent, and she has always put forth great effort in everything that she does to move him forward and provide him with a quality education.

For the past year, she has worked in the cargo transportation business and it is going very well because she is very responsible and hardworking, and has a great desire to improve herself.

Hidelercita would like to repair the roof of her home. She is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, with the support that they have provided, she will be able to make the repairs that her home needs so that her family can live with greater security and comfort. This way, she will be able to continue working hard from day to day to see her son become a great professional.

loans.use: repair the roof of her home.

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en:
Jean Claude is aged 26 years. He is married with two children aged 2 and 5; one of them goes to school. He has been farming for four years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizers for rice production. The profit from the business will be used to buy equipment used to cultivate rice.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for rice production.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda works hard to support her family. Leonarda is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Leonarda has been in this business for 20 years now.

Leonarda requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Leonarda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Rosette

texts.en:
Rosette is 47 years old. She is married and has six children between 7 and 23 years old, and all of them go to school. 

She has been farming for 18 years. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizers for rice. The profits from the business will be used to pay workers who are preparing the swamp for cultivation of rice.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for rice.

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru: Фируза молодая швея в возрасте 26 лет. Она живет в городе Куляб с мужем и детьми. Фируза талантливая способная женщина. Она умеет кроить и шить. Вот уже 5 лет как Фируза у себя дома берет заказ на пошив женских национальных платьев. Она с вдохновением занимается собственным делом. Сейчас Фируза хочет расширить свою деятельность и для этого просит кредит. Она собирается приобрести модернизированную швейную машинку. С помощью такой машинки Фируза будет брать больше заказов и количество ее клиенток увеличится.
texts.en: Firuza is a young seamstress, aged 26. She lives in the city of Kulob with her husband and children. Firuza is a talented and capable woman who can cut and sew. She has been taking orders for traditional dresses from home for over five years. She is enthusiastic about running her own business. Firuza currently wants to expand her business and is asking for a loan to do so. She decided to purchase a modernized sewing machine. With the help of this machine, Firuza will be able to take on more clients and complete more orders.

loans.use: to purchase a modernized sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase supplies for preparing food.

loans.name: M.aslam

texts.en:
M. Aslam is 48 years old and married to Sialkot. They have five children. He is hard working.  He runs a dairy business for which he has 10 years of experience. He prepares feed for his cows and feeds them every morning. His wife is very supportive and helps him all the way. Since he has a big family, he finds it difficult to make savings. 

With the intention to continue to prosper and to keep his cattle in good health, M. Aslam has requested a loan to purchase livestock feed. He hopes to improve his living conditions. One of his plans for the future is to increase his number of cattle.

loans.use: to buy feed for his dairy cows.

loans.name: Victoria Elizabeth

texts.es: Victoria es una señorita trabajadora,  es soltera y tiene un hijo de 4 años de edad y se encuentra asistiendo  a  la escuela, vive  con su  madre y ahí mismo vende cuyes asados cuando le hacen pedidos, son 3 años que se dedica a la crianza de cuyes, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra cuyes para seguir con su negocio de comercialización de cuyes y de venta de cuyes asados, lo que Victoria aspira es mejorar su negocio, aumentar sus ingresos pero todo lo hace para darle bienestar de su hijo.
texts.en:
Victoria is a hard-working young lady. She is single and has a 4-year-old child and is going to school.

She lives with her mother and from home she sells roasted guinea pigs on order. She has been raising guinea pigs for three years. She is going to buy more guinea pigs with the loan to continue with her business.

Victoria strives to improve her business and increase her income, and she does it all for the well-being of her child.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs.

loans.name: Wilber Andres

texts.es:
wilber Andrés tiene 57 años de edad, es casado, sin hijos a su cargo, vive en casa propia; domiciliado una zona rural del distrito de la Florida, de la provincia de San Miguel, region de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

wilber Andrés se dedica a la venta de abarrotes; hace 5 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, él solicita préstamo para invertir en capital de trabajo; compra de mercadería para su negocio(golosinas, arros, azúcar, entre otros) para suritr su tienda y de esta manera poder satisfacer todos los gustos de sus cientes, poder captar a nuevos clientes y asi lograr que sus ventas se incrementen, aumenten sus ganancias y por ende su calidad de vida mejore y la de sus esposa.
texts.en:
Wilber Andrés is 57 years old, is married, and does not have children in his care. He lives in his own home, which is located in a rural district in La Florida, in the San Miguel province, Cajamarca region, in the northern mountain region of Peru.

Wilber Andrés makes a living by selling groceries and has done this for the past 5 years. His business is located in his home. He requests a loan to invest in working capital and purchase merchandise for his business (snacks, rice, sugar, etc.) to stock his business so that he can satisfy his customers' tastes and attract new customers. This way, his sales will increase, his income will increase, and his and his wife's quality of life will improve.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (snacks, rice, sugar, etc.) to stock his store so that he can satisfy his customers' tastes.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en: Dorothy has been selling a variety of cereals for the past thirteen years, and she earns a monthly income of KES 15,000. She is applying for her first loan, of KES 30,000, from VisionFund Kenya, after being introduced by a credit officer. She plans to use the entire loan to add more stock of new freshly harvested cereals, such as dry maize, millet, peas and beans.  She is 26 years old and married to John, who also supports the family with additional income. She plans to use the anticipated profits to expand her business and provide full support to her family, especially for their basic needs. Dorothy hopes to grow her business and become a successful a businesswoman in the future.

loans.use: to add more variety of cereals, such as dry maize, millet and peas, to sell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 40 years old. She is married and has five children, between 5 and 23, all of them going to school. She has been farming for eighteen years. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizer for rice. The profit from the business will be used to pay the school fees of her children and to expand her business. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer for rice.

loans.name: Hermine

texts.en: Hermine lives in the city of Vedi, in the Ararat region. She lives with her husband and children and her retired mother-in-law. She has a big family and, with her beloved husband, she works very hard to sustain their family’s needs. They have four school-aged children; a daughter and three sons. Hermine is involved in very big and hard agricultural activities; that is, she cultivates tomatoes, cucumbers, peppers, eggplant, greens and potatoes. She herself takes everything she grows to a local wholesale market to sell to customers or to resellers. She also has a grape orchard, and she says she has already gathered a perfect harvest of grapes, which she sells very profitably. She handles the farming and the sale of farm products alone, since her husband works every day with no holidays and returns home late at night. Hermine is eager to receive this Kiva loan in order to buy some agricultural implements (as the tools that she has are old and worn out) for the autumn cultivation season.  She wants to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy some agricultural implements for the autumn season cultivation, as well as fertilizer.

loans.name: Vahan

texts.en: Vahan lives in Kapan city, in the Syunik region. Vahan studied to be a musician, but he has unfortunately never been able to use his education. Now he works at the Kapan combine as a crane operator. Vahan is married and has three sons. His oldest son, like his father, chose a musical education, and he now works at his specialty. Vahan’s second son is in the army, and the youngest is school-aged. Vahan’s wife is also employed, and she works at the kindergarten. So, in order to provide for his big and lovely family, Vahan also uses his fine farming skills. HIs specialty is in raising poultry: he has forty chickens. He sells farm eggs and poultry. His vegetable garden also brings in some income to cover his numerous financial needs. He cultivates potatoes, beans, tomatoes and cucumbers, which he takes to the city wholesale market three times a week. Vahan is a very active person, with a lot of initiative, always thinking of doing something new to provide more income for his big family. He hopes to use this loan to buy fodder for his chickens, and he has also decided to buy rabbits and try breeding them on his farm.

loans.use: to buy fodder for his chickens and to buy rabbits and try breeding them on his farm.

loans.name: Abdurashid

texts.en: Abdurashid is a kind man. He is 42 years old. He is married and has three children. His wife is a very hardworking woman. She is a busy farmer. Abdurashid is a highly educated person. He has worked for more than 18 years in a state organization. Abdurashid helps his wife in growing food products. They work hard to earn a living and promote the education of their children. Abdurashid’s son has applied to the university this year. So, Abdurashid needs to pay for his son’s education, but he does not have enough money. He is applying for a loan of US$700 to pay for his son’s educational expenses. He seeks your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for his son's university tuition.

loans.name: Abdulqawi

texts.en:
Abdulqawi is a 24-year-old married man with one child who is living with his family in a rented house in Dhamar, Yemen. He is still a secondary school student. His sister is a secondary school graduate and plans to study at university next year. Along with his sister, Abdulqawi wants to learn many computer programs to help them in their studies. 

Unfortunately, they don't have a computer. In order to learn computer programs like Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Photoshop, etc., he must purchase a laptop. He doesn't have enough money to purchase one but believes it is very necessary and important for him and his sister to enable them to learn all computer programs. For this reason, he applied for a youth loan of 100,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a laptop to use it, along his sister, to learn the computer programs to help them in their studies. 

Abdulqawi looks forward to purchasing an internet line for his house to help him in his studies and to connect with all the world. He hopes to provide his family with a better future and send his child to private school.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop to learn computer programs.

loans.name: Luz Angelica

texts.es:
Luz Angelica tiene 32 años, es madre soltera, vive en casa familiar junto a sus padres y hermanos; cuenta con 01 hijo de 02 años, vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganaderia, ubicada en el distrito de Saña, provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Luz Angelica se dedica a la venta de alimentos preparados y a vender cerveza. Actualmente ha apertuardo un negocio en un céntrico local en Saña. El préstamo lo necesita para invertir en compra de 01 congeladora para atender la demanda de bebidas frías en local, con ello tendrá una mejor atención a clientes y así poder generar ingresos para una mejora en calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luz Angelica is 32 years old, is a single mother, and lives in her home with her parents and siblings. She has one 2-year-old son. Residents of her community make a living in commerce, agriculture, and cattle raising. It is located in the district of Saña in the Chiclayo province, in the Lambayeque region on Peru's northern coast.

Luz Angelica makes a living by selling prepared foods and beer. She has opened a business in a central location in Saña. She needs the loan to purchase a freezer to tend to the demand for cold beverages in her store. With the freezer, she will be able to provide better service to her customers so that she can earn money to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of a freezer to tend to the demand for cold drinks in her store.

loans.name: Erwin

texts.en:
Erwin is so thankful that he was granted a 50,000 PHP loan which he used to purchase scrap materials needed in his business. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and for his family's personal, household and business expenditures. 

He would like to apply for another loan in the amount of 50,000 PHP to purchase recyclable materials like metal, copper, plastic and other materials. He is encouraged by the good returns of his business.

The profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain the family's daily needs and educational expenses of his child. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart. 

Erwin dreams to have his own equipment and hopes to give his family a good future. He meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his life and business every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for recyclable materials.

loans.name: Beyatta

texts.en:
Beyatta, aged 36 years, is married with 5 children aged between 2 and 13. 3 of them go to school. 

She has been farming for 16 years. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizer for rice production. 

The profit from the business will be used to pay workers through preparing her land for farming activities.


The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. 
Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer for rice production.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Claudine is 39 years old. She is married with 3 children aged between 5 and 11. All of them go to school. 

She has been farming for 11 years. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizer for rice.

The profit from the business will be used to improve her rice productivity.


The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. 
Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer for rice.

loans.name: Señor De Puquin Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE PUQUIN”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco. 
La socia es la Sra. Ines; ella es  soltera  tiene 39 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja con su negocio de venta de productos de primera necesidad, la socia vende lo que son arroz, azúcar, leche entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio  el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, y otros.
Los socios que salen adjuntos a la foto pidieron  permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo. 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de artesanía, hoteles, venta de ropa.
 La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The “SEÑOR DE PUQUIN” communal bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province and department of the same name.

Ines, one of the members, is 39 years old and has two children. She works in her business selling basic foods. She sells rice, sugar, and milk amongst others. She has been in the business for quite some time and things are going well for her thanks to the determination she brings to her work each day. She wants to be able to continue to work in this way to continue to support her family. Ines is requesting the loan to buy rice and other things.

The members that appear in the attached photos asked permission to arrive late to the meeting due to their work. The other members work at a handicraft business, hotels and selling clothing.

Ines is grateful to those who form part of this dream through this loan and promises to pay the installments of her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy rice, etc.

loans.name: Erick Alex

texts.es:
Erick es un joven emprendedor, soltero, tiene 23 años y vive en Ica junto a su familia.
Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante, gracias al apoyo de sus padres estudió la carrera de Administración y hoy ejerce su profesión en una prestigiosa empresa, le va muy bien porque es muy trabajador, responsable, y porque siempre trabaja con ética y aplica diariamente todos los valores inculcados por sus padres.
Erick está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar una laptop para su trabajo, de esta manera podrá realizar los reportes y otra información solicitada. De esta manera más adelante puede postular a otro puesto de trabajo y así mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Erick is a young entrepreneur. He is single, is 23 years old, and lives in Ica with his family. He is a person with a great desire to move forward. Thanks to his parents' support, he studied Administration and now works in a prestigious business. It is going well for him because his is very hardworking and responsible, always works with ethics, and applies the values that his parents taught him every day.

Erick is grateful for Kiva lenders because, with their support, he will be able to purchase a laptop for his job. This way, he will be able to do reports and other requested information. This way, he will be able to apply for another job in the future so that he can improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop for his job.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles, aged 34 years, is married with two children aged 2 and 3, not yet going to school. He has been farming for five years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizers for rice. The profit from the business will be used to buy expand his business through buying a plot of land.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for rice production.

loans.name: Intan Ii Group

texts.en:
Cycle 2 of Intan II group has ended, everything went well, and the trip was smooth, with payments of each member once. Their lives became more developed; especially, their family economy is improving and their children can attend school well, so the members want to apply for a loan for the next cycle.

There is no change in the group membership of Intan II. They were helped by Kiva's lending program, growing their businesses, and it was useful at once to life in their environment. They plan loans in Cycle 3 for this. They will use it to buy the means of production and increase the types of business. All members of the group Intan II thank you for the loans that have been given in two previous cycles. 

Intan II Group  is led by a woman named Turyati. She has one child who is still at school and is currently a single parent to two children. She has business credit sheets. With this loan, Turyati hopes  to add other types of businesses, such as clothes and bags credit, because there is a lot of competition in the sell sheets. She hopes that in the next five years, they can have their own stall. These loans can also be expected to increase the business and earnings of each of the members of the group Intan II.

loans.use: to buy clothes and bags

loans.name: Rahayu Group

texts.en:
Cycle 2 is running smoothly and well, so all members of the group would like to apply for a third loan. Rahayu group has come back to Kiva for the third cycle due to immense benefit of Kiva's loans in growing their businesses; their economies have started to thrive. Their children can go to school, daily needs can be met piecemeal. Rahayu group members wanted to increase their businesses, as they meet more and more competition. They hope that loans from Kiva in cycle 3 can improve their businesses by adding new types of food, supplementing the contents of the shop as snacks for the kids, or buying a more powerful tool for producing more milkfish pesto.

Rahayu group is headed by a mother who has a business: a coffee shop and children's games. Sumarsih is a leader and has three children who are still in school; her husband is a farmer. For Sumarsih, these loans are significant, especially for her family and the members of the group Rahayu. Her hope with this loan is to be able to raise capital to complete the coffee shop and add to the types of children's games. Sumarsih also hopes that all members can live better and be more eager to develop their businesses. The members of the group "Rahayu" say a big thank you to lenders for their confidence, for having been willing to provide loans, although the members of this group do not know them personally.

loans.use: to complete the coffee shop and add various children's games

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en:
Jean Bosco is 30 years old; he is married with one child aged two years, not yet going to school. He has been farming for two years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizers for rice. The profits from business will be used to buy a plot of land for farming activities.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for rice production.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es: Angélica: Es una mujer amable, originaria de Waspam, casada, tiene 3 hijos. Desde hace 20 años vive en una casa de tambo de madera. Con mucho esfuerzo desde hace 3 años ha iniciado a mejorar su vivienda poco a poco. Solicita financiamiento para comprar materiales de construcción: madera, zinc, clavos y  cubrir costos de mano de obra, con el propósito de vivir de manera segura. Su sueño es construir su vivienda de concreto.
texts.en: Angélica is a friendly woman who is a native of  Waspam. She is married and has 3 children. For twenty years she has lived in a wood house built on stilts. With much effort she began to improve the house 3 years ago. She is requesting a  loan to buy construction materials, wood, zinc laminate, nails and to pay for the cost of labor. Her goal is to live in a safe place. She dreams of building her house of cement.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Sisi Kwa Sisi Group

texts.en:
Nuru, who is in her early 30s, is single with no children.  She has been a food vendor for three years now.  She works from 6 am to 9 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Nuru's sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy a fridge and started selling cold soft drinks.  She also increased her food stock and kept on restocking the out-of-stock items in her food store.  She has paid back all her loans successfully.  She is happy with the loans and appreciates Kiva for their support.  She used the profit to take care of herself and covered household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy food-cooking ingredients to meet her customers' demand.  She dreams of becoming successful in life.

Nuru will share this loan with her loan group "Sisi kwa Sisi" which contains ten members who will help each other and are accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy  food-cooking  ingredients to  meet her customers' demand.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes es estudiante de la carrera de Enfermería trabaja en un centro asistencial como enfermera es casada vive con su marido ambos trabajan y se ayudan actualmente asiste a seminarios y está preparando su tesis porque su objetivo es tener su título Universitario para poder mejorar sus ingresos.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de su tesis, ya que de esa forma podrá cubrir ese gasto que tiene.
texts.en: Lourdes is a Nursing student. She works in a medical center as a nurse. She is married and lives with her husband. Both of them work and help each other. Currently she is attending seminars and is working on her thesis. Her goal is to get her University degree as she will get paid more. She is requesting this loan to invest in paying for her thesis as in this way she can afford to pay this expense.

loans.use: to pay for her thesis.

loans.name: Dennis

texts.es:
El Sr.  Dennis vive con sus padres y a su vez trabaja en la empresa de ellos, y gracias a su trabajo él puede estudiar.
Dennis es una persona muy responsable y dedicada a sus estudios y a su familia, aspira a ser una buena profesional y seguir estudiando y servir a las personas, está estudiando la carrera de ingeniería comercial. Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera, de manera a seguir estudiando.
texts.en: Dennis lives with his parents and works in their business. Thanks to his work he is able to study. Dennis is a very responsible person who is dedicated to his studies and to his family. He hopes to become a good professional, continue to study and help people. He is studying Commercial Engineering. He is requesting this loan to pay his tuition and in this way continue to study.

loans.use: to pay university tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for his house

loans.name: Changamoto Group

texts.en:
Bakari, who is in his mid 20s, is married with a small child.  He has been selling household items like cup, plates, flasks, hot pots, bowls, etc. for four years now.  He works from 8 am to 8 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Bakari's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He will use this loan to  buy more plates, bowls, cups, hot pots, flasks, etc. to resell.  He dreams of owning a shop for his products. 

Bakari will share this loan with his loan group "CHANGAMOTO" which consists of ten members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more plates, bowls, cups, hot pots, flasks, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Joselyne

texts.en: Joselyne is 41 years old. She is married with eight children aged between 2 and 20; five of them go to school. She has been farming for 21 years. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizers for rice production. The profit from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for rice production.

loans.name: M.nazeer

texts.en: M. Nazeer is a humble, hard-working farmer. He belongs to Sialkot. He is 50 years old, married and has eight children. He has been engaged in farming from a very young age. and he has learnt all of the trades of the field like farming crops from his father. This fellow's goal is to increase and improve his crops, so that's why he's requesting a loan to purchase agricultural supplies like fertilizers, pesticides, manure and seeds for wheat cultivation. This loan would give him the opportunity to progress as a businessman, in addition to increasing his income so he can continue contributing to his household. All he wants is to be able to improve his family's quality of life, by giving them the opportunity to have a rewarding life.

loans.use: To buy aggricultural supplies for wheat cultivation

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
La señorita Luz vive con sus padres, comenta que su mama tiene un taller de costura y en sus horas libres ella le ayuda en su taller.
Es una persona muy responsable y dedicada a sus estudios y a su familia, aspira a ser una buena profesional de la salud y seguir estudiando y servir a las personas.
Está estudiando la carrera de obstetricia, y pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar las cuotas de la universidad.
texts.en: Luz lives with her parents. She says that her mother works as a seamstress and that she helps her in her free time. She is a very responsible person who is devoted to her studies. She wants to be a health professional and keep on studying and serving people. She is studying to be a midwife, and she is requesting a loan in order to pay for her college tuition fees.

loans.use: to pay for college tuition fees.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 23-year-old single man from Deir el Balah. He lives with his family in a small simple house. His father works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income can barely cover all the family expenses. Ali is a student in a local university where he studies English literature. He would like to become a teacher in the future. 

Ali took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Ali will be able to read articles online and write the reports easily. 

Ali appears in the photo with his new laptop.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick who used his previous loan to buy more coffee, beans, and maize to sell is a married man, living in Kamwenge, Uganda. His main business is produce, but he also owns a phone-charging shop in order to earn additional income. He still faces hardships of price fluctuations and seasonal changes that affect dealers in produce, especially when they tend to do hoarding and in fact, they sell raw materials which are bought at a low price.  However, his vision is to educate his children to higher levels and to own a wholesale produce store.

Patrick intends to use the requested loan to buy more coffee and maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more coffee and maize to sell.

loans.name: Maravilla Group

texts.es:
Está integrado por 3 alegres y emprendedoras mujeres, que se organizaron desde hace 10 meses, con el propósito de acceder a financiamiento para comprar inventario para sus pequeños negocios de pulpería, venta de bastimento y mejorar su nivel de ingreso y calidad de vida de sus familia.

Ana: Es una mujer amable, tiene 42 años de edad, madre soltera de 3 hijos. Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario Maravilla. Con el objetivo de tener su propia fuente ingreso y apoyar al desarrollo profesional de sus hijos desde hace 3 años estableció una pequeña pulpería. Solicita financiamiento para comprar mercadería: granos básicos, detergentes, cloros, sopa instantánea entre otros productos. Su sueño es tener un negocio prospero, vender embutidos, pollo y carne molida.
texts.en:
This group is composed of 3 happy and entrepreneurial women who got together 10 months ago. Their goal was to access financing to buy inventory for their small businesses, a small store, and the sale of supplies and increase their income and the quality of living for their families.

Ana is a friendly woman who is 42 years old and the single mother of 3 children. She is the coordinator of the communal bank called "Maravilla.". With the objective of having her own source of income and helping with the professional development of her children she opened a small store 3 years ago. She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise: basic grains, detergent, bleach, instant soups, amongst other products. Her dream is to have a prosperous business and sell sausages, chicken and ground meat.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Karen

texts.es:
Karen es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, es una persona que está estudiando por salir adelante y ser una profesional exitosa.
Está estudiando la carrera de criminalista, y pretende ser una profesional útil a la sociedad y también a sus familiares.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su universidad, lo que le permitirá seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en: Karen is from the city of Carapegua. She is studying to get ahead and to become a successful professional. The career she  is studying for is criminology. Karen hopes to become a professional who is useful to society and, also, to her family members. She is requesting this loan to invest in paying her fees at the university, which will permit her to continue her studies.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Sara tiene 18 años, vive con sus padres, su madre está trabajando como asistente en un estudio contable y su papá es guardia de seguridad.
Sara es la menor de los hermanos y está estudiando la carrera de Enfermería, quiere ser licenciada y actualmente sus estudios son pagados por sus padres pero está buscando empleo en el hospital donde realiza sus pasantías.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su universidad, ya que así podrá seguir estudiando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Sara is 18 years old and lives with her parents. Her mother is working as an assistant in an accounting studio and her father is a security guard. Sara is the youngest of her siblings and is studying for a career in nursing. She wants to be licensed and, currently, her studies are paid for by her parents, but she is looking for employment in the hospital where she is training.

Sara is requesting this loan so that she can pay her fees at the university in order to continue studying as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Darajani Group

texts.en:
Easter, who is in her late 20s, is single with one son who is in school.  She has been a food vendor for three years now. Working from 5 am to 4 pm daily, she is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Easter's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to buy cooking ingredients to sell to more clients.  She dreams of making her business big.

Esther will share this loan with her loan group "Darajani," which consists of five members who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients to sell to more clients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport produce to market

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Hello, Kiva Lenders, meet Lucy. Lucy is a smallholder mixed-farmer from Biribiriet village in the North Rift area of Kenya. She has two children. She has been a farmer for five years, producing milk, eggs and maize both for consumption and sale. Lucy's entrepreneurial spirit extends outside agriculture: She is involved in other personal businesses for extra income.

Lucy is very ambitious. She enjoys making more and more returns but lack of adequate capital puts her on a leash. It is for this reason that she is turning to Kiva lenders for a loan. Lucy is seeking KES 21,700 to purchase a cow. With more cows, she will be able to utilize the pasture in her farm and increase milk production. 

Your loan will help Lucy pull herself out of poverty through constantly growing her asset base. The cow you will finance will reproduce and with time Lucy will produce many litres of milk and other dairy products. 

This improvement in her business will enable her to realize profits that are currently cut due to high cost of inputs. This will impact the rest of her family in a very meaningful way.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the costs of her degree.

loans.name: Selaphine

texts.en:
Selaphine is a 40-year-old married mother of five children between six and 21 years of age, all of whom go to school. Selaphine has been farming for 10 years. With this loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizers for rice production. Business profits will be used to buy more rice seeds.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for rice production.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 34-year-old hardworking married man with three children ages 12 years, eight years, and six months living in Kamwenge, Uganda. Patrick buys and sells produce, a business he started to improve his family's standard of living and educate his children. He also earns income from agriculture. His main challenges are high competition and price fluctuations.
 
To increase his profits, Patrick is requesting a loan to buy stocks of maize to sell this peak season.

loans.use: to buy stocks of maize to sell this peak season.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes es estudiante de la carrera de enfermería, es una mujer muy luchadora que quiere salir adelante, se esta esforzando por poder ser alguien útil a la sociedad. Comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en cubrir el pago de sus clases.
Hoy pide este nuevo préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir estudiando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a nursing student.  She is a very tenacious woman who wants to get ahead.  She is putting forth great effort to be a useful person in society.  She says that she used the previous loan to cover the payment for her classes.

She is now requesting this loan to be able to make her payments.  This way she will be able to continue studying as she is doing.

loans.use: to make university payments.

loans.name: Belizario

texts.es:
Belizario tiene 61 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene 02 hijos dependientes, vive con sus hijos y su conyugue en el distrito de Pomahuaca, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú. En dicho distrito sus actividades principales son la agriultura, comercio y ganaderia.

Belizario cuenta con un taller de carpinteria metalica el cual esta ubicado en su propio domicilio, en la cual elabora diferentes productos de metales como son puertas, ventanas, escaleras, etc; cuenta con una experiencia de más de 10 años en el negocio, por su buen servicio y su experiencia cuenta con bastante clientela de su zona, además se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte publico cuenta con una mototaxi propia, cuenta con muy buenas refrencias pesonales, y laborales; el destino del crédito es para invertir en el negocio compra de materiales y herramientas invirtiendo en su negocio y poder adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que mejore su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Belizario is 61 years old. He has two dependent children and lives together with his spouse and children in the Pomahuaca district of the province Jaen in Cajamarca, a region in the mountains to the north of Peru. The main activities in the area involve agriculture, commerce, and raising livestock.

Belizario has a metallic carpentry shop located in his own home, where he makes different metal products such as doors, windows, stairs, etc. He has over 10 years of experience in the business, and steady customers from his area due to his good service and experience. Additionally he offers transportation services using his own motorcycle taxi. He has very good personal and work references.

The loan is to buy materials and tools to invest in his business and obtain a reasonable profit to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy materials and tools for his business.

loans.name: Karaveri

texts.en:
Karaveri is a hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He carries out farming, a business he started with the intention of educating his children and improving his general standards of living. He also earns additional income from his retail shop. 

Karaveri hopes to turn his farm into a growing cash crop, though he faces challenges of lack of capital and unfavourable weather conditions. 

He is requesting a loan to buy more land for enlarging his farming project.

loans.use: to buy more land for enlarging his farming project.

loans.name: Selaphine

texts.en:
Selaphine is age 33 years;  she is married with 5 children between the ages of 1 and 17, and 3 of them go to school. She has been farming for nine years. 

With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizer for rice production. The profit from the business will be used to pay workers who are processing the rice from her garden.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer for rice production.

loans.name: Selaphine

texts.en:
Selaphine is 46 years old; she is married with 3 children between the ages of 8 and 20, and all of them go to school. She has been farming for 12 years. 

With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizer for rice production. The profit from the business will be used to improve her standard of living.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer for rice production.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is a 35-year-old married man with three children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in farm produce, selling coffee as his main source of income, though he also earns additional income from goat rearing. He started this business to be able to educate his children. His main challenges are heavy competition and high transportation costs that reduce his expected profits. 

Isaac is requesting a loan to buy produce such as maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy produce such as maize to sell.

loans.name: Jasiri Group

texts.en:
Mwajabu is a businesswoman, age late 20's, and has blessed with a baby girl. She is married, and for six months now she has been involved with a fabric business. She works selling door-to-door from 09 am to 04 pm daily, and is able to make a very small profit each month. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her first loan request which she will use to buy fabric for her business. She dreams of building a business premise. Mwajabu will share this loan with her loan group, "JASIRI", which consist of four members. Members of this group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy fabric for her business.

loans.name: Karibu View Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth, aged early 40's, is married and has got one boy and one girl who are at school. For four years now, she has been running a beauty salon business. She is known as a good hairstylist. Elizabeth works from 08:00 am to 07:00 pm daily, and is able to make a good profit each month. 

This is her second loan request via Kiva partner Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan, since repaid, to buy salon hair products. She earned an extra income which she used to cover part of school fees and saved part of it for her business improvement. She believes that one day her business will be better, therefore enabling her to live a better life. 

With her new loan request, Elizabeth buy salon hair products. 

The members of the group KARIBU VIEW, which has six members, will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan

loans.use: to buy salon hair products.

loans.name: Susu

texts.en: Because Susu is a conservative lady, she asked her daughter to take her place in the picture. Susu is a 46-year-old married woman and the mother of three sons and daughters. Her husband is a salesman. Susu's daughter is a university student majoring in engineering, and she is in her first year. She is planning to open an engineering office in the future. Now Susu is seeking a loan to help her daughter pay for her upcoming semester fees because they are currently facing a financial crisis, which is not helping her to do so.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter's upcoming semester

loans.name: Huda

texts.en: Huda was born in 1968. She is married and the mother of three students. Huda is aiming to provide her children with the best education. But she is currently facing a financial crisis, which is not helping her in paying their school fees. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her children's school fees

loans.name: Violette

texts.en:
Violette is 33 years old, married, and has three children who attend school. She has been farming for seven years. Violette requested a loan, which she will use to buy more fertilizers for rice production. The profits will be used to expand the business through buying land for cultivation of rice.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for rice production.

loans.name: Rael

texts.en:
Meet Rael, 32, a mother of two who lives in Eldoret, Kenya. Rael is a small-scale mixed farmer. She keeps dairy cattle and poultry. She also grows maize, among other crops. She has been doing this work for three years. To make extra income, Rael ventured into other small personal businesses.

Rael is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to purchase a dairy cow. She already has a cow named 'Chemungei'. With the additional cow, Rael will be in a position to significantly increase the volume of milk produced per day. Having more cows also spreads the risk of shortages, in case of diseases or any other factor. 

With more income, Rael will be able to afford the high input costs that cripple many farmers. Farmers usually forego important inputs that later come to compromise the quality of output. This results in their produce being rejected or less competitive in the market. With such products, they have limited returns.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Zubada

texts.en:
Zubada is 57 years old, married, and has three children. She resides in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a general store for many years and is responsible to fulfill the needs of his entire family. Zubada's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities, such as rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business, but due to financial constraints he is not in suitable position to buy these products. 

Zubada requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, which her husband will use to buy all these commodities and help him to earn maximum profit to manage his household and business.

loans.use: to purchase different types of commodities to sell

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asmaa is 43 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Asmaa provides sewing services. Her earnings allows her to contribute with her husband to manage the household.
 
Asmaa requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, which she will use to purchase needles, threads, pieces of clothes, machine oil, etc. for her business. This loan will enable her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

loans.use: to purchase needles, threads, pieces of clothes, machine oil, etc.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is a married woman. She has been doing a business of tailoring for a period of about 5 years to support her husband. She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of the household and the educational needs of the children. That is why she started tailoring at home to support her family well.

She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business.  At this time she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. Now she requested a loan of 35,000 PKR to purchase more reels of thread, packs of buttons and laces in different colors, etc. In this way, she will be able to stitch up more dresses on time.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of thread, packs of buttons and laces in different colors, etc.

loans.name: Godline Group

texts.en:
Macklian, a businessman in his late forties, is married and has four children. Three are at school and one is grown. Since 1984, Macklian has been involved with a welding business, in which he builds steel windows, doors and some cars parts. He is a well-designing man who dreams of increasing his capital. He believes that through Kiva, he can modernize his business. He works from 7:30 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. each working day and is able to make a good profit each month. 

He is applying for his first loan, to be apportioned among the four members of the Godline group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. 

Macklian will use his loan to buy welding materials: paint, iron and steel. He dreams of having a well-equipped (high-capital) business so that he can take larger orders and more orders from business firms.

loans.use: to buy welding materials: paint, iron and steel

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a 43-year-old woman, and she lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her five children. Rukhsana is providing sewing services and earning an income to contribute with her husband to managing the household.

She needs different kinds of goods e.g. needles, threads, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc., for her business purposes, but due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, she has applied for Kiva for a loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.
