This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories and will also be helpful for her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Rukhsana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy needles, threads, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc., for her business

loans.name: Zakaullah

texts.en:
Zakaullah is 33, married and the father of four children. He is a hardworking person.

For more than ten years, Zakaullah has earned his living raising and selling animals, such as cows and buffaloes, in the Sialkot area. This gives him enough income to pay for his children's school fees and to pay for their daily expenses.

The loan will go to buy the feed to raise and fatten the animals, in order to later sell them at a better price. This will increase his income and profits and thus improve the quality of life for Zakaullah and his family.

loans.use: To purchase animal feed

loans.name: Watoto Wa Mkulima Group

texts.en:
Athuman is a father of four school-age children (who are of equal genders). He is married and for two years now he has been taking care of his family by running a hardware shop selling building materials. Athuman starts working at 7 a.m. and goes to 6 p.m. per working day, and is able to make a good profit each month. 

This is the first loan to be apportioned among WATOTO WA MKULIMA, a five-member group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. 

Athuman is applying for a loan with which he wants to improve his shop and to buy building materials for his shop to resell. He dreams to be able to sell more items in his shop.

loans.use: to buy shop items

loans.name: Al Nawal Group

texts.en:
Nisrine is the featured borrower for the Al Nawal group. She got together with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and make a living at the same time.

Nisrine is a 32-year-old married mother of one child. A year ago, she decided to help her husband in covering the expenses and needs of their family, so she opened a clothing shop. She is a hard worker and she is becoming well known in her region with her special talents and good reputation in her domain. Nisrine is working hard to develop her business. For this reason her acquired loan will be invested in updating her business with new fashionable clothes especially for the upcoming autumn season. 

Nisrine is the lady on the left side of the picture. As for the other group members, Bashera is a married mother of two who works in a spice business; she is the second from the left. Hanan is a married mother of two who works in a crafts business; she is on the right.

loans.use: to update her business with new fashionable clothes for the upcoming autumn season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bundles of plastic shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase traveling bags, boxes, and school bags.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chickens and feed to fatten them, improving her production so as to earn more

loans.name: Ambreen

texts.en:
Ambreen is a 28-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a business of flower making for the last four years. She offers various colorful flowers for decorating homes and events such as birthdays, parties etc. She sells them to the people of her community and also supplies to the local market.  She has good communication skills and has a good client list. 

Her husband works as a laborer and earns insufficient income to support her family alone. She is motivated to provide for her family. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 in order to buy raw material such as fabric, glace papers and floral tapes along with packs of paints in various colors. In this way she will be able to meet with the increasing demands of her customers consistently. She wishes to spend part of the revenue to deal with the expenses of her family and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy raw material such as fabric, glace papers, floral tapes along with the packs of paints in various colors.

loans.name: Alia

texts.en:
Alia is a 40-year-old married Master's student majoring in Computer Information Systems, and she is in her second year. Her husband is a retired man. She is the mother of five sons and daughters.

Alia is seeking to get her Master's in order to start teaching at a university in the future and improve her experience and, at the same time, improve her living conditions. Now she is facing financial problems and is seeking a loan to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming Master's semester fees

loans.name: María Guadalupe

texts.es:
En la fotográfia aparece María con su última hija.

María de 29 años de edad, esta acompañada y ha procreado 4 hijos, la menor una bebe de meses de nacida, su compañero de vida quien actualmente trabaja en el ejercito, es quien le apoya en la economía de su hogar, ellos son una familia muy unida.

María es una mujer muy trabajadora,antes ella salia a vender pan; ahora ella ademas de sus oficios domésticos combina sus labores cotidianas con la agricultura junto a su padre quien vive junto a ella. María desde muy pequeña acompañaba a realizar trabajos agrícolas junto a su padre, hoy en dia retomo su costumbre ahora todas las mañanas comienzan su labor apoyando a su padre en la agricultura y por la tarde ella se dedica a los oficios de su hogar.

El prestamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar abono y pesticidas. Con el fin de obtener de una buena cosecha de postrera.

A futuro María quiere remodelar su casa, ya que su familia va creciendo pues quiere que estén cómodos y con la seguridad que su familia merece.
texts.en:
María appears in the photo holding her youngest daughter.

María, 29 years old, lives in a common law relationship. She has had four children, the youngest a baby just months old. Her life companion, who is currently in the army, helps her with household expenses. They are a very united family.

María is a very hardworking woman. Formerly she used to sell bread; now, in addition to her domestic duties, she farms with her father, who lives with her. From the time she was very small, María used to accompany her father to work in the fields. Nowadays, she has returned to that custom and begins every day by helping her father to farm in the morning and then spending the afternoon doing household tasks.

The loan is to purchase fertilizer and pesticides with the goal of reaping a good second harvest.

In the future, María wants to remodel her house since her family is growing and she wants them to be comfortable and to have the security they deserve.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Yehowa Ji Mikwelo Group

texts.en:
The Yehowa Ji Miikwelo (God is My Helper) Group is made up of three women. They are, on average, 43 years old and have two children. The women live in Chorkor-Accra, Ghana. They know one another through their savings groups and their businesses. They all sell different products, such as fish, groceries, and cooking utensils.

In order to enlarge their businesses, the group members have decided to work with the field partner, ID-Ghana. This will be their sixth group loan.

Vivian has a good reputation for selling fish, which is a secretive job in Accra. She plans to use her loan to buy two cartons of fish from the Accra fishermen to sell. She sells the fish for cash to customers in the market.

Vivian expects to make a good profit, which will be used to meet her needs and reinvest in her business.

In the future, Vivian, together with her friends would like to continue working with ID-Ghana and to benefit from their loans.

loans.use: To buy two cartons of fish

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en: Tahira is a 53-year-old married woman who has had a business with her husband for the past two years of selling milk. She has two buffalos which she uses for milk selling to the people of her locality. She also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of profit. Tahira has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her 9th loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000. This will allow her to purchase one more buffalo. Tahira is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Sobia

texts.en: Sobia is a 35-year-old married woman and she is involved in a business of sewing gloves with the support of her husband (also shown in the photo). Her husband also helps her in sewing and then sells them in the local market. They offer various types of gloves in different colors and designs to the people of their community and make a good amount of income. For the improvement of the business, Sobia contacted Kashf foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 in order to buy good quality wool, nylon and leather along with packs of needles in order to increase her sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and dreams to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy good quality wool, nylon and leather along with packs of needles

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en:
Shamshad, a responsible mother of two children, lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband, the family's sole income-earner, has been providing transport services there with his taxi for many years. 

Due to insufficient financial means, Shamshad's husband is unable to perform needed maintenance on his taxi. She has therefore applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan for this purpose.

Shamshad plans to save some of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future. She is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en: Perveen, age 39, is a married mother of nine children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become known for providing good quality milk in her locality. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. She has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales which will ultimately help in generating more income for her. She is on her fifth loan and has shown a good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Baby  Davi

texts.en: Baby Davi is a hard-working mother of four children who enjoys doing embroidery work. Her hand-made designs are very popular in her territory. Due to an increase in demand for her designs, she needs more funds for her business. Her husband supports her in the business. She is motivated to provide her family with the basic necessities of life including food, clothes and education. She has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR from Kashf foundation. In this way she can manage to buy more thread, needles, sequins and cloth which will help generate more income. She is on her seventh loan and is hopeful that she will have a good experience with this loan.

loans.use: to buy more thread, needles, sequins and cloth

loans.name: Diakaria's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois a été mise en place ce 05 Février  2014 à de son inauguration. Il est composé de  femmes qui voulu intégrer le programme de bancs villageois afin de bénéficier d’un appui financier pour développer leurs activités. Elles viennent d’entamer leur second cycle après un premier sans difficulté. Elles vivent toutes dans le même village depuis plusieurs années et entretiennent des relations de solidarité et d’entre aide mutuel. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce et la culture saisonnière sous pluie.

Madame Diakaria, âgée de 31 ans (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants dont  un  garçon et deux filles. Elle s’active dans la vente fataye (amuse gueule à base de farine accompagné de sauce), d’arachide grillé le soir dans son village. 

Avec son  nouveau prêt, elle va acheter  un sac de farine, de l’huile un bidon de 5 litres et divers ingrédients.

Les bénéfices me permettent de renforcer son épargner pour obtenir durant les prochains cycles de prêts plus importants.
texts.en:
[This group] has been in existence since the launch of its banc villageois on February 5, 2014. It is composed of women who wished to take part in the banc villageois program in order to receive financial support for growing their businesses. They just started their second loan cycle after finishing the first cycle without issues. They all have been living in the same village for years and maintain good relations in the spirit of solidarity and mutual help. They mainly work as vendor and grow seasonal rain-fed produce.

Mrs. Diakara, 31 years old (the one seated on the far right raising her hand) is the star borrower of the group. She is married and the mother of three: one son and two daughters. She sells “fataye” (a snack made from flour and served with a sauce) and grilled peanuts in her village in the evenings.

loans.use: to buy a bag of flour, a 5-liter jug of oil and various ingredients.

loans.name: Isata

texts.en:
This is 46-year-old Isatu.  She is a widow and has two children, ages 18 and 16. She has two additional dependents, living with her as sales assistants.  

In 2004, Isatu established her charcoal and palm oil business. She began her business because there was no help for her when she lost her husband. Her business is located in the central market, and her main customers are women. Working 7 days a week, 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 900,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000, which she will use to purchase 200 bags of charcoal to sell. She hopes this loan will help her get more customers and more profit.

In the future, Isatu plans to educate her children and get a house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal and palm oil

loans.name: Abdulai

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Abdulai. He is married and has two children, ages 14 and 9 years. Although he does not have an education, he was able to establish a grocery store business in 2003. His store is located in the outskirts of Freetown, and his main customers are local people of all classes. Working seven days a week and twelve hours a day, he earns about 600,000 Sierra  leones (SLL) every month from this business. 

Abdulai has applied for a loan of 5,000,000 SLL so that he can buy more goods like kayaine,mayonnaise for his store. In the future, he plans to send his children to university and to develop his business. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more goods for his store

loans.name: John

texts.en:
This is 47-year-old John.  He is married and has three children, ages 8month,15 and 17. In 2005, John established a pharmacy. He began his business because he was trained as a pharmacist. John's business is located in the outskirts of the city and his main customers are all classes of people. He works seven days a week, 10 hours a day and earns about 500,000 SLL each month. 

John is requesting a 5,000,000 SLL loan to purchase more drugs to sell. In the future, he plans to construct a clinic and to educate his children. John thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more drugs to sell
